BEFORE EVIL PHARMA CAME TO INDIA WE USED ORGANIC FOOD AS PREVENTIVE MEDICINE<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nBBB --- NO 1 KILLER IN INDIA IS WHITE / GREEN REVOLUTION---- A1 TOXIC MILK OF HUMPLESS COWS, PROCESSED FOODS, UNHEALTHY VEGETABLE OILS ( ONLY VIRGIN COCONUT OIL IS HEALTHY ), GM FOODS, NITRITES IN WATER DUE TO CHEMICAL FERTILIZERS, PESTICIDES etc<br />\n<br />\nI HAVE ADDRESSED ALL THESE PROBLEMS IN MY BLOGS ...<br />\n<br />\nBOTH AAA AND BBB CAME TO INDIA BECAUSE OF BRIBED POLITICIANS</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_78MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_79b+seedHI-kD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_79b+seedHI-kD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrites and nitrates\nare both compounds and are quite similar in composition. &nbsp;Nitrites are made up of one atom of nitrogen\nand 2 atoms of oxygen. Nitrates are made of one atom of nitrogen with 3 atoms\nof oxygen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RgydC-clrm8/WSJhHK0BINI/AAAAAAABTeg/OV0Pdlk2BMA8KeySHVHKQTiUN1Qq2V8lwCLcB/s1600/imWages.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"195\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RgydC-clrm8/WSJhHK0BINI/AAAAAAABTeg/OV0Pdlk2BMA8KeySHVHKQTiUN1Qq2V8lwCLcB/s400/imWages.png\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate: 1 Nitrogen, 3\nOxygens \u2013 Chemical Formula: NO3-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrite: 1 Nitrogen, 2\nOxygens \u2013 Chemical Formula: NO2-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So\u2026 Nitr-a-tes have 3\noxygen atoms, while Nitr-i-tes have 2 oxygen atoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">Nitrosamines are\nchemical compounds of the chemical structure R1N(\u2013R2)\u2013N=O, that is, a nitroso\ngroup bonded to an amine. Almost all nitrosamines are carcinogenic.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-G0X98n1rSMM/WSJhjd892tI/AAAAAAABTek/eFI8Wdt3IBA5jXGTjezM0EgOasSjsdouACLcB/s1600/150px-NitrosamWine_Formulae_V.1.svg.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-G0X98n1rSMM/WSJhjd892tI/AAAAAAABTek/eFI8Wdt3IBA5jXGTjezM0EgOasSjsdouACLcB/s1600/150px-NitrosamWine_Formulae_V.1.svg.png\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">Nitrosamines are potent carcinogens which induce\ncancer , DNA damage and brain degeneration in humans.&nbsp;&nbsp;</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Enzymes in our body, particularly in our mouths,\nturn nitrates into nitrites. &nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">The thing with nitrites\nis that they can turn into nitrosamines\nwhich are very bad for us. &nbsp;</span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrates irritate the\nliver and cause production of a toxic lipid (fat) compound that is able to\ncross the blood-brain barrier and destroy neuronal cells. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The brain then develops\ninsulin deficiency and insulin resistance. With no glucose (brain food), parts\nof the brain start to die. A scan of a brain with Alzheimer\u2019s will show that\ntissue is literally missing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thanks to the desh\ndrohi GRENN REVOLUTION&nbsp; nitrates packed in\nchemical fertilizers which end up on produce, particularly root vegetables such\nas potatoes and beets.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is actually very\nlittle difference between the chemical formula for nitrates and nitrites \u2013 only\nan extra oxygen atom in the nitrate molecule. &nbsp;&nbsp;Think of Nitrate as \u2018the mother\u2019 and nitrite\nas \u2018the child\u2019.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both nitrates and nitrites form deadly \u2018Nitrosamines\u2019<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrates can aggravate\nirritable bowel syndrome (IBS).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IBS is five times more\nlikely in migraine patients .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IBS and migraine\npatients benefit from the same diets that eliminate nitrate heavy foods</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/ibs-irritable-bowel-syndrome-vagus.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/ibs-irritable-bowel-syndrome-vagus.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrites and nitrates\nin our food/ water supply must take a major blame for all major diseases\nrelated to insulin resistance.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without nitrites or\nnitrates, hams would be ugly dull grey, bacon would be ugly brown and salamis\nwould be ugly black and brown \u2013 the reason is that these nitrogen-based\ncompounds inhibit the actions of bacteria and fungi which cause putrefaction.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However , nitrites and\nnitrates are also converted by the digestive system into nitrosamines \u2013 and almost\nall nitrosamines are known carcinogens.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">Whenever the nitrates\nin water are exposed to high temperatures i.e. when the water reaches the\nboiling point, they become toxic. &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-size: large;\">The\ncomposition of the nitrates will undergo a complete change, in other words,\nthey are turning into nitrosamines which are carcinogenic.</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrites can be found\nin a number of foods, but are found predominantly in the processes of pickling,\nsalting and curing.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Foods such as sausages\nand bacon usually have added nitrites and nitrates. They stop bacteria growth,\nadd a salt taste and enhance the color of the meat.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You might think you\u2019re\nmaking the healthy choice by choosing bacon that is marked as \u2018nitrate free\u2019.\nUnfortunately, many of these products are not what they seem.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While the bacon\nitself may be free from nitrates, it can often have other products added such\nas celery salt ( cheating on label to keep meat pink ) &nbsp;This in itself is very high in\nnitrates. When you buy bacon labelled nitrate free, you could actually be\neating a product that is higher in nitrates than standard bacon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The problems with\nnitrites and nitrates occurs when they are heated to high temperatures. When\nheated, nitrites and nitrates turn into nitrosamines unless you use virgin\ncoconut oil , the only good veg oil on the planet for high heat cooking</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reheating changes the\ncomposition of food item, destroying the nutritive value of the food. It may\nbreak down the proteins and nitrates in the food, thus turning the food toxic\nfor human health.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reheating and reusing\noils ( any oil other than virgin coconut oil ) &nbsp;can create free radicals which attach\nthemselves to healthy cells and may result in ailments in the long run. And\nthese free radicals can be carcinogens which cause cancer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High nitrate levels\ncreate dangerous water conditions by oxidizing the iron atoms in hemoglobin,\nand by reducing oxygen supply to the blood stream and tissue.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This condition is\ncalled Methemoglobinemia, and small babies less than 6 months of age , may die. There are thousands of such recorded baby deaths in USA<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Infants are more\nsensitive to nitrates because they take in more water for their body weight. &nbsp;&nbsp;The infants\u2019 blood contains a form of\nhemoglobin, fetal hemoglobin, which is more easily changed into methemoglobin\nthan is adults\u2019 hemoglobin. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In\naddition, infants\u2019 digestive systems have a higher pH, which increase the\nchanging of nitrates into nitrites.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">High levels of nitrate\nin drinking water pose a significant health risk for the foetus of pregnant\nwomen and formula-fed infants through using drinking water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When you eat or drink\nnitrates, they are absorbed from the small intestine (gut) into the blood.\nNitrates then enter the large intestine from the blood.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">f certain, normal\nconditions exist in the intestine, such as a low pH, the nitrate is simply\nprocessed and removed as waste without any harmful effects.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, under\nother conditions, such as a high pH in the intestine, the nitrate will be\nchanged into nitrite. This nitrite is then reabsorbed into the blood where it\nwill react with the blood\u2019s hemoglobin iron to form methemoglobin.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Note: The\nhemoglobin in our blood carries (transports) oxygen throughout our body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There exists significant\nlinks between elevated nitrate in drinking water and neural tube defects of the\nbrain and spinal cord, including spina bifida, some oral cleft defects and limb\ndeficiencies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">U.S. Environmental\nProtection Agency\u2019s (EPA) safe drinking water standards for Nitrate is 10ppm\n(10 parts per million). &nbsp;&nbsp;Note: \u201cppm\u201d is\na unit of measurement. An example of 10 parts per million would be having ten\nbeans in a pile of one million beans. &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">In many parts of India Nitrates are 20 times higher and nobody cares. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pregnant women may be\nmore sensitive to nitrates because their blood contains higher levels of\nmethemoglobin. They may be especially sensitive at the 30th week of pregnancy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; This may include salting, curing,\nfermenting, and smoking the meat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Common nitrate migraine\ntriggers are processed meats such as hot dogs, sausage, bacon, salami, aged\nmeats, and lunchmeats.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Avoid meats with\nnitrates to avoid migraines.&nbsp; Sodium\nnitrite is used as a food preservative, especially in cured meats.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ingested nitrate is\nreduced to nitrite by the bacterial flora in the mouth and digestive tract. In\nturn, nitrite reacts with amines, amides and other nitrosation precursors in\nthe gastrointestinal tract to form NOCs. &nbsp;&nbsp;Endogenous nitrosation is estimated to\naccount for 65% of &nbsp;total NOCs exposure&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/IHQ1C38PFpU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/IHQ1C38PFpU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is a link between\nincreased levels of nitrates in the environment and in food and increased\ndeaths from Alzheimer's, Parkinson's and Type 2 diabetes \u2013and nobody wants to address\nthis .&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrates and nitrites &nbsp;circulate from the digestive system, into the\nblood, then into saliva and then back into the digestive system. This is known\nas the entero-salivary circulation .&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\u2019s important to keep\nin mind that nitrosamines mostly form during very high heat. Even though\nvegetables also contain nitrates/nitrites, they are rarely exposed to such high\nheat.&nbsp;&nbsp; Vegetables contain far more\nnitrates than meats.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our bodies actually\nmake nitrates. They circulate around our bodies, from the digestive system, via\nthe blood, into our saliva then back into the digestive system again. In our\ndigestive systems they perform the vital task of keeping bad bacteria at bay.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Fu6Ckk3E3bA/WSJ5sqYReII/AAAAAAABTe0/GmaCq_9u-t4b67Z_pDPrD-1s3Ejt7gTGQCLcB/s1600/Dietary%252BFactoris-%252BCancer%252BInitiators.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cured meats use\nnitrites to prevent spoilage, preserve flavor and to maintain color.&nbsp;&nbsp; Nitrites produce substances called\nnitrosamines, when exposed to high temperatures.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrosamines can be\nconverted into carcinogenic substances when consumed.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is most important to\navoid cooking nitrite containing foods at high temperatures especially bacon,\nsausages etc. &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Nitrites must be reduced\nin cured meats and vitamin C must be added which also reduces the formation of\nnitrosamines<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The problem occurs when\nnitrites and amino acids (building blocks of protein) react in the presence of\nheat and an acidic environment (i.e., your stomach or gut) to form carcinogenic\nN-nitrosamines. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">You can create\nnitrosamines at the high temperatures needed for frying and flame-broiling.\nnitrosamines produce biochemical changes within cells and tissues<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again , nitrites are\nthe reason cured meat is pink or red\u2014lets they look brown like pieces of turd.\nNitrites turn into Nitric Oxide, which reacts with the oxygen-binding proteins\nin the meat, changing its color .&nbsp; Without\nadditives like nitrites, the meat would turn YUCK brown very quickly.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They function as\npreservatives, helping to prevent the growth of harmful bacteria.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They also add a salty\nflavour and improve the appearance of the meat products by giving them a red or\npink color.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrosamines are formed\nwhen nitrites are consumed in the absence of plants, because phytonutrients\nfound in all organic plants block nitrosamine formation.&nbsp; &nbsp;Because meat contains none of these plant\nphytonutrients, when nitrites are added to meat as preservatives and colorings,\nnitrosamines form in processed meat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemical fertilizers\nused in soil leach nitrites into our drinking water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrosamines are\nproduced when nitrites and amines combine in acidic places like the human\nstomach. High temperatures and frying increase the formation of these\nnitrosamines.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Significant levels can be found in beer, fish, non-fat dry milk\nand cured meats (primarily bacon and hot dogs) and cheese preserved with\nnitrite pickling salt.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Modi Govt must know\nthe harmful effects of nitrosamines . Strict measures must be put in place to\nreduce the risks to consumers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We are killing the quality of our future\ngenerations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I reckon this is more important than telling Indians how great Ambedkar\n, Gandhi ,&nbsp; Basava , Ramanuja , the Dasas\nor Shirdi Sai Baba was.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The NITRITES are\npreservatives identified by the E249 and E250 acronyms.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">.</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many\ndifferent types of nitrosamines\u2026 and most of them are potent carcinogens Because\nmost bacon, hot dogs and processed meat tend to be high in sodium nitrite and\nthey\u2019re high protein foods (a source of amino acids), exposing them to high heat\ncreates the perfect conditions for nitrosamine formation <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of particular interest\nis the nitrosamine N-nitrosodimethylamine (DMN). This semi-volatile organic\ncompound is highly toxic and is a human carcinogen. At higher doses, it has\nbeen shown to be a hepatotoxin that causes liver fibrosis and cancer in several\nanimal species.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So next time you see a\npink juicy piece of luncheon meat on a 5 star FREE buffet breakfast table \u2013\nknow why and how that nice pink colour is there<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is increased\ncolorectal, rectum and stomach cancer risk associated with high consumption of processed\nmeats, in particular salami, sausages, bologna, ham and bacon.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrosamines are found\nin processed meats (smoked, canned, and preserved) and grilled meats. In fact,\njust the smell of frying bacon contains nitrosamines.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aged meats, such as\nsalami, are particularly dangerous for migraine sufferers because they contain\nhigh levels of biogenic amines.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Biogenic amines can\ncombine to break the headache threshold.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Brewing barley ( beer )\nundergoes a malting process, the grain if first drenched to make it germinate\nand then dried in kilns to capture the sugar and flavour compounds for the\nbrewing process.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The heating in the kilns can cause the formation of\ncarcinogenic nitrosamine compounds in the grain,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Again , nitrosamines\nare chemical compounds, &nbsp;most of which\nare carcinogenic, and are produced when the food preservative nitrite combines\nwith amino acids in the stomach.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\ncompounds are also found in cheese products, beer and water. Exposure also\noccurs through manufacturing and processing of chemical fertilizers,\npesticides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A glioma is a type of\ntumor that starts in the brain or spine. It is called a glioma because it\narises from glial cells. The most common site of gliomas is the brain.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; Gliomas make up about 30% of all brain and\ncentral nervous system tumors and 80% of all malignant brain tumor<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hundreds of modern studies\nhave shown the link between cancer and the nitrosamines contained in cured\nmeats, like bologna, bacon, ham, sausage and hot dogs. These cancers include:\nbladder, endometrial, prostate, thyroid, testicular, kidney, and leukemia.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Yet\nthe common man does NOT know\u2014such is the power of the Zionist Jew monopolized processed\nfood lobby and EVIL PHARMA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrosamines play a\npart in Alzheimer's brain degeneration and Parkinnsons\u2019s disease .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrosamines even in\nlow, limited exposure can also cause diabetes, fatty liver disease and obesity.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrosamines can cause DNA damage, cell death\nand have been associated with insulin resistance.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leftovers are great -\nbut some of them shouldn't be reheated. Especially people recovering after\nchemotherapy..</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There have been studies\nin farming communities that have found increased rates of colon and bladder\ncancers. &nbsp;Exposures to pesticides (bug\nkillers) and diets high in preserved meats &nbsp;increase the risk of cancer in these\npopulations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/nV-uBu672EY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/nV-uBu672EY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrosamines become\nhighly reactive at the cellular level. This in turn, alters gene expression and\ncauses DNA damage. &nbsp;Cellular alterations\nthat occur as a result of nitrosamine exposure are fundamentally similar to\nthose that occur with aging, Alzheimer\u2019s, Parkinson\u2019s and Type 2 diabetes\nmellitus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Remember , when\nnitrites are exposed to high heat, in the presence of amino acids, they can\nturn into compounds called nitrosamines<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/YDyBB1BZTH8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/YDyBB1BZTH8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c5780050030093973607\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; This condition is irreversible I know but still.</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_178BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_177TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_178b+seedtePD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_177TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_177TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_177TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_178b+seedtePD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_177B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4780092400576225158\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_177M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"https://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499856592802#c4780092400576225158\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 4:19 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_177MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<br />\nIn Kerala we never had Ulcerative Colitis as we cooked in Virgin coconut oil and had our curries infused with fresh turmeric.<br />\n<br />\nExcessive consumtion of humpless cow beef causes UC<br />\n<br />\nUlcerative Colitis is a condition that causes inflammation and ulceration of the inner lining of the rectum and colon (the large bowel). In UC, tiny ulcers develop on the surface of the lining and these may bleed and produce pus.<br />\n<br />\nThe inflammation usually begins in the rectum and lower colon, but it may affect the entire colon. If UC only affects the rectum, it is called proctitis, while if it affects the whole colon it may be called total colitis or pancolitis.<br />\n<br />\nIt\u2019s one of the two main forms of Inflammatory Bowel Disease (IBD). The other is Crohn\u2019s Disease which is monopolized by Ashkenazi Jews<br />\n<br />\nHOMOSEXUAL MALES WHO ENGAGE IN ANAL SEX ARE MORE PRONE TO UC<br />\n<br />\nUlcerative Colitis is a chronic condition. This means that it is ongoing and life-long, although you may have periods of good health (remission), as well as times when symptoms are more active (relapses or flare-ups).<br />\n<br />\nThe most common symptoms are:----<br />\n\u2022 Diarrhoea<br />\n\u2022 Cramping pains in the abdomen<br />\n\u2022 Tiredness and fatigue<br />\n\u2022 Feeling generally unwell or feverish<br />\n\u2022 Loss of appetite and weight loss<br />\n\u2022 Anaemia (a reduced level of red blood cells).<br />\n<br />\nOne in 200 people in the west have UC because of consumption of A1 milk, processed foods and GM foods.<br />\n<br />\nIt can start at any age, though it often appears for the first time between the ages of 15 and 25. It affects men and women equally.<br />\n<br />\nMore than a third of people with UC develop other conditions outside of the digestive system, mainly affecting the joints, eyes and skin.<br />\n<br />\nInflammation of the joints (arthritis) affects about one out of 10 people with UC. Some people with UC also develop ankylosing spondylitis, a condition in which the joints in the spine and pelvis become inflamed and stiff.<br />\n<br />\nA variety of other health conditions can be associated with UC, including:----<br />\nskin problems, such as mouth ulcers, blisters and ulcers on the skin, and painful red swellings, usually on the legs<br />\ninflammation of the eyes<br />\nthinner and weaker bones<br />\nliver inflammation<br />\nblood clots (including deep vein thrombosis)<br />\nanaemia.<br />\n<br />\nFlare-ups can be disruptive to relationships and work \u2013 sometimes you may need to cancel engagements and take time off when you are feeling unwell.<br />\n<br />\nAround a quarter of people are children or adolescents when they are diagnosed with IBD, and symptoms in young people often appear around the age of 12. Ulcerative Colitis in children tends to be more extensive in children than adults, and consequently more severe .<br />\n<br />\nUlcerative colitis affects only the colon and rectum. Crohn's can affect any part of the digestive tract.<br />\n<br />\nIn severe cases, people may have diarrhea 10 to 20 times a day.<br />\n<br />\nThe disease can also cause other problems, such as joint pain, eye problems, or liver disease.<br />\n<br />\nTests that may be done include:----<br />\n<br />\nA colonoscopy. In this test, a doctor uses a thin, lighted tool to look at the inside of your entire colon. At the same time, the doctor may take a sample (biopsy) of the lining of the colon.<br />\nBlood tests, which look for infection or inflammation.<br />\nStool sample testing to look for blood, infection, and white blood cells.<br />\nCrohn\u2019s disease can affect any part of the gastrointestinal (GI) tract, but ulcerative colitis affects only the colon. Additionally, while Crohn\u2019s disease can affect all layers of the bowel wall, ulcerative colitis only affects the lining of the colon.<br />\nWhile both ulcerative colitis and Crohn\u2019s disease are types of inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), they should not be confused with irritable bowel Syndrome (IBS), a disorder that affects the muscle contractions of the colon. IBS is not characterized by intestinal inflammation..<br />\n<br />\ncontinued to 2---</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_177MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_177BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_177B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_202B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c900289221694158819\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_202M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499856668741#c900289221694158819\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 4:21 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_202MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1 --<br />\n<br />\nUlcerative colitis-----<br />\nLimited to the large intestine (colon and rectum)<br />\nOccurs in the rectum and colon, involving a part or the entire colon<br />\nAppears in a continuous pattern<br />\nInflammation occurs in innermost lining of the intestine<br />\nAbout 30% of people in remission will experience a relapse in the next year<br />\n<br />\nUlcerative colitis is 3 times more common than Crohn disease.<br />\n<br />\nHOWEVER --CHRONS DIFFERENCE--<br />\n<br />\nInflammation may develop anywhere in the GI tract from the mouth to the anus<br />\nMost commonly occurs at the end of the small intestine<br />\nMay appear in patches<br />\nMay extend through entire thickness of bowel wall<br />\nAbout 72 % of people in remission will have at least 1 relapse over the next 4 years<br />\n<br />\nThe UC inflammation causes your bowel to move its contents rapidly and empty frequently. As cells on the surface of the lining of your bowel die, ulcers form. The ulcers cause bleeding and discharge of mucus and pus.<br />\n<br />\nUlcerative colitis may cause additional conditions such as:--<br />\n<br />\njoint pain<br />\njoint swelling<br />\nnausea and decreased appetite<br />\nskin problems<br />\nmouth sores<br />\neye inflammation<br />\nUlcerative colitis increases your risk of colon cancer. The longer you have the disease, the higher your risk of this cancer.<br />\n<br />\nOther complications of ulcerative colitis include:--<br />\n<br />\nthickening of the intestinal wall<br />\nsepsis, or blood infection<br />\nsevere dehydration<br />\ntoxic megacolon, or a rapidly swelling colon<br />\nliver disease (rare)<br />\nintestinal bleeding<br />\nkidney stones<br />\ninflammation of your skin, joints, and eyes<br />\nrupture of your colon<br />\nankylosing spondylitis, which involves inflammation of joints between your spinal bones<br />\n<br />\nTests to diagnose ulcerative colitis often include:<br />\n<br />\nStool test: A doctor examines your stool for blood, bacteria, and parasites.<br />\nEndoscopy: A doctor uses a flexible tube to examine your stomach, esophagus, and small intestine.<br />\nColonoscopy: This diagnostic test involves insertion of a long, flexible tube into your rectum to examine the inside of your colon.<br />\nBiopsy: A surgeon removes a tissue sample from your colon for analysis.<br />\nCT scan: This is a specialized X-ray of your abdomen and pelvis.<br />\nBlood tests are often useful in the diagnosis of ulcerative colitis. A complete blood count looks for signs of anemia (low blood count). Other tests indicate inflammation such as a high level of C-reactive protein and a high sedimentation rate. Your doctor may also order specialized antibody tests.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nIf your symptoms are severe, you\u2019ll need to be hospitalized to correct the effects of dehydration and loss of electrolytes that diarrhea causes and to treat any complications<br />\n<br />\nThe severity of UC can be graded as follows:---<br />\nMild: Bleeding per rectum, fewer than 4 bowel motions per day<br />\nModerate: Bleeding per rectum, more than 4 bowel motions per day<br />\nSevere: Bleeding per rectum, more than 4 bowel motions per day, and a systemic illness with hypoalbuminemia (<30 br=\"\" g=\"\">The diagnosis of ulcerative colitis is best made with endoscopy and mucosal biopsy for histopathology.<br />Rectal involvement occurs even when the rest of the colon is spared.<br /><br />Fecal studies have shown that the composition of gut bacteria in those with ulcerative colitis is very different to that in healthy people, so probiotics may be helpful for correcting the imbalance.<br /><br />Your body absorbs nitrates from food that you eat and these turn into nitrites in the body. Usually, healthy urine shouldn\u2019t contain nitrites. However, if you have any kind of bacterial infection in your urinary tract, nitrites will show up in your urine.<br /><br />Nitrites in your urine could also mean that you have an inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). Inflammation in part or all of your digestive tract is called an inflammatory bowel disease. This usually includes ulcerative colitis and Crohn\u2019s disease.<br /><br />CONTINUED TO 3-</30></div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_202MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_202BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_202B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_203B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 8px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c599600132629490875\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_203M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user\" style=\"font-weight: bold;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/07/gayatri-mantra-savitr-savitur-saraswati.html?showComment=1499856735008#c599600132629490875\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">July 12, 2017 at 4:22 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_203MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 2-<br />\n<br />\nUlcerative colitis occasionally involves the terminal ileum, as a result of an incompetent ileocecal valve. In these cases, which may constitute as many as 10% of patients, the reflux of noxious inflammatory mediators from the colon results in superficial mucosal inflammation of the terminal ileum, called backwash ileitis. Up to about 30 cm of the terminal ileum may be affected.<br />\n<br />\nA variety of immunologic changes have been documented in ulcerative colitis. Subsets of T cells accumulate in the lamina propria of the diseased colonic segment. In patients with ulcerative colitis, these T cells are cytotoxic to the colonic epithelium. This change is accompanied by an increase in the population of B cells and plasma cells, with increased production of immunoglobulin G (IgG) and immunoglobulin E (IgE).<br />\n<br />\nThe ulcerated areas are soon covered by granulation tissue. Excessive fibrosis is not a feature of the disease. The undermining of mucosa and an excess of granulation tissue lead to the formation of polypoidal mucosal excrescences, which are known as inflammatory polyps or pseudopolyps.<br />\n.<br />\nUlcerative colitis is the result of an abnormal response by your body's immune system. Normally, the cells and proteins that make up the immune system protect you from infection. In people with IBD, however, the immune system mistakes food, bacteria, and other materials in the intestine for foreign or invading substances. When this happens, the body sends white blood cells into the lining of the intestines, where they produce chronic inflammation and ulcerations.<br />\nForeign substances (antigens) in the environment may be the direct cause of the inflammation, or they may stimulate the body's defenses to produce an inflammation that continues without control.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/nitrate-water-pollution-chemical.html<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/12/ayurvedic-massage-and-quantum-medicine.html<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/07/nutritious-a1-milk-of-vedic-cows-with.html<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/08/probiotics-prebiotics-friendly-gut.html<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/08/probiotics-prebiotics-friendly-gut.html<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/ibs-irritable-bowel-syndrome-vagus_14.html<br />\nhttp://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/small-intestinal-bacterial-overgrowth.html<br />\n<br />\n85% of IBD patients are low in vitamin D<br />\n<br />\nDO SURYANAMASKAR<br />\n<br />\nHAVE NATUROLAX BEFORE SLEEPING<br />\n<br />\nPsyllium husk are both known to increase butyrate production. Butyrate helps to repair the intestinal wall and reduce inflammation<br />\n<br />\nSurgery is necessary when there is massive bleeding, chronic and debilitating symptoms, perforation of your colon, or a severe blockage. A CT scan or colonoscopy can detect these serious problems.<br />\n<br />\nSurgery involves removing your entire colon with the creation of a new pathway for waste. This pathway can be out through a small opening in your abdominal wall or redirected back through the end of your rectum.<br />\n<br />\nTo redirect waste through your abdominal wall, your surgeon will make a small opening in your abdominal wall. The tip of your lower small intestine, or the ileum, is then brought to the skin\u2019s surface. Waste will drain through the opening into a bag. You will find that Jews have this contraption maximum on this planet by percentage<br />\n<br />\nIf waste is able to be redirected through your rectum, your surgeon removes the diseased part of your colon and rectum, but retains the outer muscles of your rectum. The surgeon then attaches your small intestine to the rectum to form a small pouch. After this surgery, you\u2019re able to pass stool through your rectum. Bowel movements will be more frequent and watery than normal.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 4-</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_203MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_203BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_203B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_204B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-DUOJiRC5obw/UwiDtflONuI/AAAAAAAAppU/hpxnNJK2CIw/s113/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6501120340593266000\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_204M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"http://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. HAVE THE SCIENTISTS GONE THERE TO HAVE BOOZE AND ENJOY ?<br />\n<br />\nMore than 70 billion tons of nitrogen stocks are stored in the upper 3.5 metres of permafrost soil, a vast sum accumulated over thousands of years through the nitrogen cycle<br />\n<br />\nThe permafrost stocks are more than 600 times larger than the annual nitrogen load added as GM fertiliser to soils globally<br />\n<br />\nSome of that nitrogen already exists in the form of \u201cold\u201d nitrous oxide, built up during the permafrost formation, while other mineralized nitrogen interacts with microbes to produce \u201cnew\u201d nitrous oxide.<br />\n<br />\nNitrous oxide that is released into the atmosphere remains in the troposphere for more than a century and then it migrates to the stratosphere, where it depletes the ozone layer. The ozone layer serves as a protective barrier absorbing solar radiation; without it the sun\u2019s ultraviolet rays would severely damage biological organisms, including humans.<br />\n<br />\nAlthough the Montreal Protocol, an international treaty signed in 1987 to protect the ozone layer, Nitrous oxide was ignored. The Zionist Jews concentrated on WEE ozone depleting items ( like refrigerants ) where they can make money out of thin air.<br />\n<br />\nLoss of nitrogen to the atmosphere may also reduce plant biomass, further contributing to climate change.<br />\n<br />\nIf nitrogen is lost to the atmosphere, plant growth won't be able to compensate for carbon being lost from permafrost soils<br />\n<br />\nThe most alarming phenomenon in the Arctic is the loss of the highly reflective snow and ice cover, known as the albedo..<br />\n<br />\nHigh nitrous oxide saturations were recently observed in productive shallow Arctic shelf waters following significant reduction in sea ice cover..<br />\n<br />\nNitrous oxide is produced in the ocean water column and sediments by two pathways. The first is in oxygen-rich conditions in which ammonium is converted to nitrate, creating nitrous oxide as a byproduct. The second occurs in deoxygenated sediments where nitrous oxide is produced in an intermediate stage between the conversion of nitrate to nitrogen gas.<br />\n<br />\nThe loss of sea ice cover in Arctic shelf waters has resulted in increased sunlight absorption, fueling phytoplankton growth. Following phytoplankton death, organic material is remineralized to ammonium, which can be converted to nitrate and ultimately produce nitrous oxide.<br />\n<br />\nWhat happens in the Arctic doesn\u2019t stay in the Arctic ( unlike the Cricket team dressing room politics )<br />\n<br />\nIndians were the first to use BIOCHAR for agriculture . It converts agricultural waste into a soil enhancer that can hold carbon, boost food security, and increase soil biodiversity, and discourage deforestation. The process creates a fine-grained, highly porous charcoal that helps soils retain nutrients and water.<br />\n<br />\nIndia was blessed with HUMUS laden topsoil with healthy microbes and earthworms for millions of years. WE WONT ALLOW YOUR MANN KE TAMANNA \u201cKOSHER COMPUTER COW\u201d IN INDIA..<br />\n<br />\nSoil building is the product of a self-reinforcing, positive feedback loop. But soil decline is also a self-reinforcing loop that can result in catastrophic soil loss.<br />\n<br />\nNitrogen fertilizers combined with tillage accelerate microbial respiration, burning up soil carbon faster than it is replaced. Due to the loss of organic carbon reservoirs, many soils have become nearly lifeless substrates that must be continually fed with irrigation water, mineral nutrients and pesticides to produce a crop. Although productive in the short term, this practice is not sustainable<br />\n<br />\nThe desh drohi GREEN REVOLUTION has caused our holy topsoil to lose 80% of their original soil organic carbon (SOC) pool.<br />\n<br />\nWE DON\u2019T WANT COMMIES AND WHITE JEWS TO DRIVE OUR EDUCATION<br />\n<br />\nBiochar serves as an electron buffer for redox reactions and helps bacteria swap electrons among themselves, improving their metabolic efficiency as a microbial community.. With its pores and its electrical charges, biochar is capable of both aBsorption and aDsorption.. The surfaces of biochar, both internal and external, aDsorb materials by electro-chemical bonds, working like an electric sponge.<br />\n<br />\nBiochar surfaces adsorb carbon and retain it in compounds with minerals, supporting at the same time a large microbial community that potentially makes more efficient use of organic debris containing carbon and other nutrients.<br />\nbalanced compost, with the optimum C:N ratio, will contain lots of humus. However, if there is not enough stable carbon (from wood, straw or other lignin sources), then the easily degradable sugars, fats and proteins will be completely consumed by microbes leaving very little substrate behind<br />\n<br />\nBoth biochar and compost increases cation exchange capacity (CEC - the ability to hold onto and transfer nutrient cations: ammonium, calcium, magnesium, and potassium)\u2026<br />\n<br />\nThey supports soil microbial life and biodiversity and helps plants resist diseases and pathogens. They add humus carbon to the soil carbon pool, reducing the atmospheric carbon pool\u2014and increases soil water holding capacity. In coastal areas they help plants grow better in high salt situations.<br />\n<br />\nUnlike biochar, compost is quickly broken down by microbial action in soil over months to at most, decades, depending primarily on climate. Biochar lasts at least ten times longer in most soils.. Biochar is effective at retaining nitrogen in soils and there is NO need for CHEMICAL UREA.<br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS THE ONLY INTELLIGENT WAY TO PREVENT FARMER SUICIDES.<br />\n<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 3--</div>\n<span class=\"comment-actions secondary-text\" id=\"bc_0_138MN\" kind=\"m\"><span class=\"item-control blog-admin pid-1783552029\" style=\"display: inline;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_138BR\" style=\"margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replybox-single\" id=\"bc_0_138B_box\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; margin-top: 5px;\">\n</div>\n</li>\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_139B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 0.25em 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c8131227607787448028\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_139M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. The moon appears full when the Earth is between the moon and the sun. In both cases, the gravitational pull of the sun is \"added\" to the gravitational pull of the moon on Earth, causing the oceans to bulge a bit more than usual. This means that high tides are a little higher and low tides are a little lower than average.<br />\n<br />\nSpring tides, has nothing to do with the season of spring. Rather, the term is derived from the concept of the tide \"springing forth.\" ..<br />\n<br />\nSpring tides occur twice each lunar month all year long, without regard to the season\u2026.<br />\n<br />\nhttp://tides.mobilegeographics.com/calendar/month/547.html<br />\n<br />\nIN THE LINK ABOVE YOU CAN SEE THAT FULL MOON IS ON 3RD DEC 2017..<br />\n<br />\nTHREE DAYS LATER THE DATE IS 6TH DEC..<br />\n<br />\nTHE HIGH TIDE ( SPRING ) IS 12.5 METRES --THE HIGHEST..<br />\n<br />\nJEW ROTHSCHILD TOOK AWAY INDIANS TO WORK AS INDENTURED LABOUR..
