, &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GREEN REVOLUTION\nagricultural science holds the belief that to feed a hungry world and meet the\ndemand for an increase in food supply artificial forms of nitrogen,\nphosphorous, potash and all micronutrients must be added as some form of\nchemical salt to grow food. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemical fertilisers\nkill off the various soil bacteria, beneficial fungus and earthworms, which\nsupport the all important humus, which is the great basis of soil structure. So\nthe soil lost its natural fertility.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants now weakened by\nbeing fed with artificial fertilisers have developed all kinds of fungus\ndiseases and susceptibility to many insect attacks, and as a consequence a\nwhole regime of chemical plant pesticides and fungicides are now also being\nused. These chemicals are causing poisonous pollution of the soil, the water\nand of humans.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The end result is that our top soil is dead ( devoid of mcirobes\n) and groundwater polluted.. Such soil is hard and gets cracked up when there\nis no moisture. Humus laden soil does not crack up<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soils that have a high\nhumus content, have abundant living biological activity to&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; convert plant residues, leaf litter,\nanimal dung and vaious biomass into stable humus. Humus gives the soil the\nability to absorb and retain moisture. Such soils do not dry out and require\nsignificantly less irrigation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humus also supports the all important\nmycorryhzal fungi, which form a&nbsp;\nsymbiosis with many plants and are an important factor in the soil food\nweb.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; The hyphae from these fungi help\nbind the soil particles to form good soil&nbsp;\nstructure. Mycorrhizae are symbiotic relationships that form between\nfungi and plants.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The fungi colonize the root system of a host plant, providing\nincreased water and nutrient absorption capabilities while the plant provides\nthe fungus with carbohydrates formed from photosynthesis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mycorrhizas are\nbeneficial fungi growing in association with plant roots, and exist by taking\nsugars from plants \u2018in exchange\u2019 for moisture and nutrients gathered from the\nsoil by the fungal strands.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The mycorrhizas greatly increase the absorptive\narea of a plant, acting as extensions to the root system. Mycorrhizal fungus\nnetworks reduce the need for water and optimize nutrients.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The snake groves of\nKerala which held the Ayurvedic herb bank was teeming with this fungi.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nwhite man called our snakes groves Hindu heathen superstition and destroyed\nalmost all of them. Communists after independence did more damage . Today we\nhave lost 95% of our ancient ayurvedic herbs.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These commie bastards do NOT know\nthat there is ZERO superstition in Hinduism other than what was injected by the\nwhite invader and his FAKE mutts. Today Kerala atheist commies hide and go to\ntemples to worship. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/king-cobra-and-snake-temples-of-kerala.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/07/king-cobra-and-snake-temples-of-kerala.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Think of humus as being\na big sponge that can hold up to 90% of it\u2019s weight in water.&nbsp; This water holding capacity of humus is why\nhumus rich soil will remain moist for weeks longer than soil without humus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humus has a negative\ncharge which means that many of the nutrients plants require stick to humus,\nincluding ammonium (source of nitrogen), calcium, magnesium and phosphorous to\nname a few. The humus sponge holds onto these nutrients and prevents rain from\nwashing them away.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a plant root comes in contact with it, the plant root\nis able to remove the nutrients from the humus sponge. The process is a bit\nmore complicated than this, but you can think of humus as being a slow release\nsource of fertilizer for your plants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Perhaps the most\nimportant reason for having humus is that it is responsible for aggregation.\nAggregation is what makes soil loose and very friable, improving the structure\nof soil.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Better soil structure found in humus rich soil makes it easier for\nplant roots to grow by providing them with better access to nutrients, water\nand most importantly oxygen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humus is left after\norganic matter decomposes. Each time you add organic matter to the soil, it\nwill increase the amount of humus in the soil. It is a slow process but if\norganic matter is added each year, the amount of humus will continue to\nincrease.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why India\u2019s fertile top soil was 6 feet deep while the rest\nof the planet has just 8 inches of top soil.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A plant can acquire 85 percent of the building materials it needs from the air to\ncreate liquid carbon. The rest of the nutrients are provided from the soil.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil microbes use this liquid carbon as an energy source to help them convert\ntied up nutrients into available plant food. In the process, the sugars emitted\nby the roots act as a glue to create complex soil structure, which includes\nstable forms of carbon and humus.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Carbon is needed for\nsoil structuring and water holding. As liquid carbon streams into the\naggregates via the roots or fungal linkages, it enables the production of glues\nand gums that hold soil particles together.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Establishing a good soil\nstructure enables nitrogen-fixing bacteria to function. You will rarely see a\nnitrogen deficient plant in a healthy natural ecosystem. Ammonia that is fixed\nfrom the air is rapidly converted into an amino acid or incorporated into a\nhumic polymer. These organic forms of nitrogen cannot be leached or\nvolatilized.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With rapid carbon\nsequestering, the growth rate of plants can quickly increase, with as much as a\n50% to 70% increase in yields the first year. That is the power of properly\nfunctioning soil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If plants can obtain\nnitrogen and phosphorus easily, ( force fed by synthetic fertilsers ) they will\nstop pumping carbon into the soil to support their microbial partners. This\ninterruption of the carbon flow to the soil reduces aggregation and the forming\nof new topsoil.</span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Avoid all chemical\napplications to top soil.&nbsp;&nbsp; This includes\nfungicides, pesticides, insecticides and herbicides. It is a no-brainer that\nsomething designed to kill things is going to do just that.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These chemical\napplications can inhibit the soil fungi that are essential to crop nutrition\nand soil building. When soil fungi are kept from functioning properly, plants\ncan no longer use them to obtain the trace elements they need to fight fungal\ndiseases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When we spray for weeds\nit creates bare ground and the weed seed that\u2019s there means the weeds simply\ncome back.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some weeds have deep\nroots that help to bring up nutrients. Leaving them can mean that better\nquality plants will eventually be able to grow in the improved soil and replace\nthe weeds. A little patience may be needed while soils improve.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For dry regions,\nperennial grasses have incredibly deep root systems and form mycorrhizal\nassociations that help them survive during dry periods. They will soon create\ntheir own microclimate to help them overcome a lack of water and thrive,\ndisplacing weeds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A diversity of plants\nactually improves nutrient acquisition and water retention, and helps to fill\nin gaps in the soil. Multi-species pasture cropping can help to displace\nunwanted weed<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dirt is transformed\ninto soil by adding large amounts of organic carbon to support biological\nactivity. The recycling of organic matter by soil organisms concentrates\nsulfur, boron, N, P and K within the top soil \u2018turning over\u2019 nutrients for\nplant use.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The capacity of\nmicrobes to rapidly turn over organic matter replenishes the nutrient supply\navailable for plants. However, microbes can only turn over humus very slowly\n(chemically protected organic carbon).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Humus is the byproduct of microbial\nactivity, essential for increasing the storage of both water and nutrients in\nsoil for plant growth -measured as cation exchange capacity.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Microbial\nactivity is most significantly affected by the availability of soil organic\ncarbon and soil moisture..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The addition of \u2018burning\u2019 fertilizers such as Big N\nor Muriate of Potash can kill microbes on contact</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rotating intensive\ncropping with several years of pasture is a time-honored way of replenishing\nthe soil. Leaving the soil covered (greater than 70%) with plant residues\nfavors the activity of soil animals, producing more food for microbes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However\nwhere stock are not feasible, green manures, minimal tillage and stubble\nmulching all feed the soil. Rotating crops from different plant families\ndiversifies the residue input, diversifying the microbial spectrum.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Matching\nthe nutrient needs of crops with rock fertilizers and/or composts improves the\nhealth and harvest of the crop, and the residues also feed the soil. Feeding\nthe soil increases the ability of microbes to \u2018turn-over\u2019 organic matter, increasing\nthe plant-available nutrient supply and the soil humus reserves.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The \u201cstructure\u201d of a\nfood web is the composition and relative numbers of organisms in each group\nwithin the soil. The living component of soil, the food web, is complex and has\ndifferent compositions in different ecosystems. In a healthy soil, there are a\nlarge number of bacteria and bacterial feeding organisms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Where the soil has\nreceived heavy treatments of pesticides, chemical fertilizers, soil fungicides\nor fumigants that kill these organisms, the beneficial soil organisms may die\n(impeding the performance of their activities), or the balance between the\npathogens and beneficial organisms may be upset, allowing those called\nopportunists (disease-causing organisms) to become problems.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Micro-organisms\ntransform organic matter into plant nutrients that are assimilated by plants.\nTwo main groups are normally found in agricultural soils: bacteria and\nmycorrhizal fungi.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bacteria are important in agricultural\nsoils because they contribute to the carbon cycle by fixation (photosynthesis)\nand decomposition.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some bacteria are important decomposers and others such as\nactinomycetes are particularly effective at breaking down tough substances such\nas cellulose (which makes up the cell walls of plants) and chitin (which makes\nup the cell walls of fungi). Land management has an influence on the structure\nof bacterial communities as it affects nutrient levels and hence can shift the\ndominance of decomposers from bacterial to fungal.</span>&nbsp;</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bacteria\nare important in agricultural soils because they contribute to the carbon cycle\nby fixation (photosynthesis) and decomposition. Some bacteria are important\ndecomposers and others such as actinomycetes are particularly effective at\nbreaking down tough substances such as cellulose (which makes up the cell walls\nof plants) and chitin (which makes up the cell walls of fungi).</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Land management\nhas an influence on the structure of bacterial communities as it affects\nnutrient levels and hence can shift the dominance of decomposers from bacterial\nto fungal.</span> <span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These organisms are responsible for the important\nprocess of decomposition in terrestrial ecosystems as they degrade and\nassimilate cellulose, the component of plant cell walls.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fungi are constituted\nby microscopic cells that usually grow as long threads or strands called hyphae\nof only a few micrometres in diameter but with the ability to span a length\nfrom a few cells to many metres. Soil fungi can be grouped into three general\nfunctional groups based on how they source their energy:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Decomposers -\nsaprophytic fungi - convert dead organic material into fungal biomass, CO2, and\nsmall molecules, such as organic acids. These fungi generally use complex\nsubstrates, such as the cellulose and lignin, in wood. They are essential for decomposing\nthe carbon ring structures in some pollutants. Like bacteria, fungi are\nimportant for immobilizing or retaining nutrients in the soil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mutualists -\nmycorrhizal fungi - colonize plant roots through a symbiotic relationship. The\ndefinition of symbiosis is a close, prolonged association between two or more\ndifferent organisms of different species that may benefit each member.\nMycorrhizae increase the surface area associated with the plant root, which\nallows the plant to reach nutrients and water that otherwise might not be\navailable.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Mycorrhizae essentially extend plant reach to water and nutrients,\nallowing plants to utilize more of the resources available in the soil.\nMycorrhizae source their carbohydrates (energy) from the plant root they are living\nin/on and they usually help the plants by transferring phosphorus (P) from the\nsoil into the root.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regenerative\nagriculture is defined as \"a holistic land management practice that\nleverages the power of photosynthesis in plants to close the carbon cycle, and\nbuild soil health, crop resilience and nutrient density.\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regenerative practices\nfocus primarily on building soils. These include use of cover crops, diverse\ncrop rotations, compost and manure to increase soil fertility; building\nbiological ecosystem diversity and soil biology; and well-managed animal\ngrazing practices to improve plant growth, soil fertility, insect and plant\ndiversity and soil carbon sequestration.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The ancient Indian method\nof regenerative agriculture can build an inch of topsoil each year. &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Imagine after millenniums of wise organic regenerative\nfarming India build up a top soil of 6 feet.\u2014when today all of the world the\nmaximum top soil extent is less than 9 inches.. <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Just 70 years of\nwestern chemical agriculture has made our holy humus laden top soil useless\ndirt..&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>WE KNOW THE DESH DROHI BASTARD INDIANS IN THE PAYROLL OF WHITE JEWS WHO\nARE RESPONSIBLE FOR THIS.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-size: large;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">WE WANT EVERY SCHOOL NCERT TEXT BOOK TO HAVE A CHAPTER ON\nREGENERATIVE ORGANIC FARMING AND GROUND WATER CONSERVATION .&nbsp; THIS BLOGPOST CAN BE GLEANED..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">WE WANT A THINK TANK SPECIALIZING&nbsp;IN THIS SUBJECT.&nbsp; CHUCK OUT ALL MINDLESS CUNTS WHO MAN OUR\nINDIAN THINK TANKS CURRENTLY&nbsp;</span></span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-57G2xiZ-5tM/WJwrrVpmOmI/AAAAAAABQqo/-9wsspdm4RAiWSVRYXpBpkgoVBQdEyLRQCK4B/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c597844168684151385\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_24M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. text-decoration-line: none;\">May 16, 2017 at 2:58 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_43MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nSOMEONE ASKED ME- HOW CAN YOU SAY FOR SURE THAT NGT DOES NOT KNOW ASSHOLE FROM ELBOW<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/cant-clean-bellandur-lake-within-deadline-says-government/articleshow/58603583.cms</span><br />\n<br />\nWELL NGT IN ALL THEIR WISDOM GAVE A DEADLINE FOR REVIVING BELLANDUR LAKE<br />\n<br />\nIF I WERE THE PM-- I WOULD HAVE SACKED ALL TOP SHOTS IN NGT AND TAKEN FRESH PEOPLE<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br />ASK AMERICANS HOW LONG THEY WILL TAKE TO REVIVE LAKE ERIE<br /><br />A MODEST ESTIMATE WILL BE \"A THOUSAND YEARS\"</span></b><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">JEW DARLING PM MODI MUST KNOW -- THIS IS THE DAMAGE DONE TO LAKE ERIE BY JUST SEVEN DECADES OF AGRICULTURAL RUN OFFS .<br /><br />LAKE ERIE HELD PRISTINE BLUE WATERS SINCE MAN CAME ON EARTH MILLIONS OF YEARS AGO..</span></b><br />\n<br />\nTHIS IS LIKE A JUDGE TELLING A DOCTOR I WANT THE BROKEN THIGH BONE TO BE HEALED IN 12 HOURS ..<br />\n<br />\nOR MAYBE MODI IS AN EXPERT<br />\n<br />\nWHO KNOW ?<br />\n<br />\nLIKE HOW HE WROTE A BOOK ON CLIMATE CHANGE WITHOUT KNOWING SHIT-- HE MIGHT START WRITING HAJAAAAR BOOKS ON FERTILIZERS AND GROUNDWATER<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Artificial fertilizers\nare man-made chemical compounds that mimic the soil's natural minerals and\nelements to maximize plant growth.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ARTIFICIAL FERTILIZERS ARE THE UNHEALTHY FAST FOOD EQUIVALENT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They usually contain\ndifferent ratios of nitrogen, phosphorus, potassium, calcium, magnesium and\nother elements.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Artificial fertilizers\nare convenient, easy to use and readily available. Organic fertilizers include\nbiofertilizers, green manure, organic manure and compost. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While natural\nfertilizers take longer to build soil vitality, they are safer and cause no\npollution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Throughout history,\nagriculture has relied on natural fertilizers to increase the nutrient levels\nof soil.&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">Only in the part 8 decades artificial fertilizers have been used\nextensively severely damaging planet earth --just because Jews want to control food and water<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Artificial fertilizers\nkill beneficial microorganisms in the soil that convert plant and animal\nremains into nutrient-rich organic matter. They also leach nitrogen and\nphosphate into groundwater and pollute streams, rivers, lakes and other water\nbodies to disrupt aquatic ecosystems.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants grown from synthetic fertilizers\ncontain toxic nitrates that react with hemoglobin to damage the vascular and\nrespiratory systems and cause suffocation and even death in extreme cases. Over\ntime, artificial fertilizers destroy the soil\u2019s natural makeup. Too much fertilizer\nproduces plants deficient in iron, zinc, carotene, vitamin C, copper and\nprotein.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just put a slight\nexcess amount in any flower pot, the plant will burn out<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Three main\nmacronutrients:<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen (N): leaf\ngrowth;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Phosphorus (P):\nDevelopment of roots, flowers, seeds, fruit;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potassium (K): Strong\nstem growth, movement of water in plants, promotion of flowering and fruiting;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Three secondary\nmacronutrients: calcium (Ca), magnesium (Mg), and sulfur (S);<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants are made up of\nfour main elements: hydrogen, oxygen, carbon, and nitrogen.&nbsp; Although nitrogen makes up most of the\natmosphere, it is in a form that is unavailable to plants. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inorganic fertilizers\nexclude carbon-containing materials except ureas. Organic fertilizers are\nusually (recycled) plant- or animal-derived matter. Inorganic are sometimes\ncalled synthetic fertilizers since various chemical treatments are required for\ntheir manufacture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main nitrogen-based\nstraight fertilizer is ammonia or its solutions. Urea is a popular source of\nnitrogen, having the advantage that it is solid and non-explosive, unlike\nammonia and ammonium nitrate<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main micronutrients\nare molybdenum, zinc, and copper. These elements are provided as water-soluble\nsalts. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Potash is a mixture of\npotassium minerals used to make potassium (chemical symbol: K) fertilizers.\nPotash is soluble in water.&nbsp; Potash\nfertilizers are usually potassium chloride, potassium sulfate, potassium\ncarbonate, or potassium nitrate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The main \"organic\nfertilizers\" are peat, animal wastes, plant wastes from agriculture, and\ntreated sewage sludge (biosolids).&nbsp; In\nterms of volume, peat is the most widely used organic fertilizer.&nbsp; This immature form of coal confers no nutritional\nvalue to the plants, but improves the soil by aeration and absorbing water. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fertilizers are applied\nto crops both as solids and as liquid. About 90% of fertilizers are applied as\nsolids. Solid fertilizer is typically granulated or powdered. Often solids are\navailable as prills, a solid globule. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Controlled release\nfertilizers are traditional fertilizers encapsulated in a shell that degrades\nat a specified rate. Sulfur is a typical encapsulation material. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excess nutrients are\ndetrimental.&nbsp;&nbsp; Fertilizer burn can occur\nwhen too much fertilizer is applied, resulting in drying out of the leaves and\ndamage or even death of the plant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Agricultural run-off is\na major contributor to the eutrophication of fresh water bodies.&nbsp; In the US, about 65 % of all the lakes are\neutrophic.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The nitrogen-rich\ncompounds found in fertilizer runoff are the primary cause of serious oxygen\ndepletion in many parts of oceans, especially in coastal zones, lakes and\nrivers. The resulting lack of dissolved oxygen greatly reduces the ability of\nthese areas to sustain oceanic fauna.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If\neutrophication can be reversed, it may take decades before the accumulated\nnitrates in groundwater can be broken down by natural processes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Someone wanted to know about the Green\nRevolution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">MS SWAMINATHAN IS THE FATHER OF \"GREEN\nREVOLUTION\"<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">HIS FATHER WAS SPONSORED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD --\nA FOLLOWER OF GANDHI<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">FOR CONVERTING INDIA FROM ORGANIC\nREGENERATIVE AGRICULTURE TO ARTIFICIAL CHEMICAL AGRICULTURE MS SWAMINATHAN WAS\nAWARDED BY JEW ROTHSCHILD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">MS SWAMINATHAN IS ONE OF THE THREE INDIANS\nINCLUDED IN TIME MAGAZINES 1999 LIST OF &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">20 MOST INFLUENTIAL PEOPLE THE OTHER BEING\nROTHSCHILD AGENTS GANDHI AND TAGORE</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">IN RETURN FOR WHEAT AID FROM USA ( EARLY\nSIXTIES ), JEW ROTHSCHILD USED US PRESIDENT LYNDON JOHNSON TO TWIST INDIAs ARM\nAND AGREE TO CHEMICAL AGRICULTURE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">There was famine in India in the early\nsixties ,caused by sabotage by Indian Communists ( pissing on grain bags stored\nin godowns ) who were released from jail after the Indo China war in 1962.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">MY SENIORS SHIPPED THIS WHEAT FROM USA TO\nINDIA ( JAYANTI, &nbsp;SCINDIA AND SCI SHIPS )<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">JUST BECAUSE INDIRA GANDHI CRITICIZED THE US\nBOMBING / AGENT ORANGE SPRAYING IN VIETNAM , THE AMERICANS SCREWED INDIA WITH\nTHIS DEADLY KILLER WEED PARTHENIUM HYSTEROPHORUS -- THE SEEDS CAME ALONG WITH\nTHE WHEAT</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Parthenium hysterophorus is a serious\ninvasive weed of pasture systems, reducing pasture productivity by more than\n90% .&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Without weed removal it is like drawing water from a well with a bucket\nfull of holes. Contact with Parthenium hysterophorus plant causes severe\nallergy ( nerve depressant ) , dermatitis and respiratory malfunction in\nhumans, dermatitis in cattle and domestic animals, due to the presence of toxin\nparthenin.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Persons exposed to this plant for prolonged period manifest the\nsymptoms of skin inflammation, eczema, asthma, allergic rhinitis, hay fever,\nblack spots, burning and blisters around eyes. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Humpless cows that have consumed Parthenium\nWeed are not fit for human consumption and their milk becomes toxic. Humped\ncows are more resistant to this weed.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b>THE APPLICATION OF ARTIFICIAL\nFERTILSERS HARDENED THE TOP CRUST AND PROFLIGATES WEEDS WHOSE ROOTS HELD THE\nTOP LAYER OF SOIL.</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drought and financial\ndepression led to the DELIBERATE&nbsp;\ncollapse of the kosher controlled wheat market, and once the wheat dried\nup, there was nothing to anchor the topsoil in place anymore in USA. &nbsp;&nbsp;As the natural winds that cross the Plains\npicked up the dry soil, dense clouds of dust called \u201cblack blizzards\u201d covered\nthe region in an unprecedented years-long \u201cstorm.\u201d&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">Below: &nbsp; Verghese Kurian , the father of White Revolution was awarded Magsaysay award --he decimated India's priceless humped bulls&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
