text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pesticides not only\nkill pests but also the natural enemies of those pests. In nature, everything\nis balanced out.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As pests respond to treatment by breeding stronger offspring\nthat are resistant to these chemicals, and with natural predators gone, these\npests will quickly multiply, which is why the need for pesticides to kill them\nkeeps increasing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Persistent organic\npollutants, also known as \u201cPOPs,\u201d are highly toxic pesticides and chemicals that\ndo not decompose. They poison nontarget organisms in the environment because\nthey are passed through the food chain (bioaccumulate).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consumption of POPs\ndisrupts the endocrine system and is linked to cancer and infertility in\nhumans. Pesticides also take a toll on our environment, contaminating water and\nsoil. Along with insects, pesticides are also toxic to fish, birds, frogs and\nmore.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Organic farming is a method of crop and\nlivestock production that involves much more than choosing not to use pesticides,\nfertilizers, genetically modified organisms, antibiotics and growth hormones.\nThe main goal of organic farming is to develop various constituents that are\nsustainable and harmonious with the ecology.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemical fertilizer\nusage has destroyed topsoil along with disturbing loss of micronutrients and\nminerals in fruits and vegetables. Feeding the soil with organic matter instead\nof ammonia and other synthetic fertilizers has proven to increase nutrients in produce,\nwith higher levels of vitamins and minerals. that organic farming builds up\norganic soil matter <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organic farming helps\nkeep our water supplies clean by stopping that polluted runoff. Organic farming\nalso helps conserve water.&nbsp; &nbsp;Organic farmers, in general, tend to spend\ntime amending soil correctly and using mulch - both of which help conserve\nwater.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE WANT THE MODI GOVT\nTO DECLARE THAT WATER SHORTAGE DUE TO CHEMICAL FERTILISERS CAUSED FARMER\nSUICIDES IN INDIA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Insects, birds, fish\nand all sorts of other critters experience problems when humans swoop in and\ndestroy their natural habitat. Organic farming not only helps preserve more\nnatural habitat areas but also encourages birds and other natural predators to\nlive happily on farmland, which assists in natural pest control.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Additionally, animals\nwhich live on organic farms are exposed to clean, chemical free grazing that\nhelps keep them naturally healthy and resistant to illness. As a perk for\norganic farmers, happy and healthy organic animals are productive organic\nanimals. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In general, the more\nbiodiversity there is on a farm, the more stable the farm is. Organic farming\nencourages healthy biodiversity, which plays a critical role in how resilient,\nor not, a farm is to issues like bad weather, disease, and pests.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Additionally,\nreduced biodiversity may directly correlate with a rise in infectious diseases,\nwhich of course, isn't good for people or the planet.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nearly 90 million acres\nof corn crops were planted in the U.S. in 2015 \u2014 a majority of it being grown\nfor fuel, not food. U.S. prairies are being converted into corn and soybean\nfields so quickly that some ecologists say grasslands are now among the most\nthreatened ecosystems on Earth \u2014 even more so than tropical rain forests.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nethanol fuel program was designed to reduce global warming but, ironically, the\nloss of grasslands is poised to do just the opposite.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without diversity, crop\nfailures become more serious, and so do the environmental ramifications. The\nseparation of crops and animals into two distinctly different processes has\nalso proven itself to be a really bad idea.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Waste becomes pollution rather than\na valuable part of the ecological cycle, and a whole host of land maintenance\nservices that animals serve for free have to be replaced with chemical and\nmechanical means.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>JEW DARLING APCO MODI<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>WE WANT VILLAGE WOMEN TO BURN WOOD TO MAKE\nFOOD<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>WE DON\u2019T WANT YOU TO IMPORT LPG GAS FROM YOUR\nWHITE MASTERS ( FROM HALF WAY AROUND THE GLOBE\u2014WE KNOW WHY !)&nbsp; WHICH EMIT NANO CARBONS \u2013 WHICH INVADE THE\nBLOOD BRAIN BARRIER AND CAUSE POOR QUALITY BABIES<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>THE ASH FROM WOOD FIRES MUST BE USED FOR\nORGANIC REGENERATIVE AGRICULTURE<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>MR MODI \u2013DO YOU HAVE OWN BRAINS ?&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;OR DO\nYOU DEPEND ON WHITE JEWs BRAINS TO RUN INDIA?<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xgNb0DeENBc/WRtWUoZbOVI/AAAAAAABTZs/TC5vyY9pLCUT9AP3IK0NlxQ2Wci0yykbgCLcB/s1600/tt8_fiDg1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"402\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xgNb0DeENBc/WRtWUoZbOVI/AAAAAAABTZs/TC5vyY9pLCUT9AP3IK0NlxQ2Wci0yykbgCLcB/s640/tt8_fiDg1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>FOR MILLENNIUMS SAGES\nFROM INDIA WENT TO FOREIGN LANDS WHICH HAS FAMINE --ON INVITATON\u2014 TO &nbsp;ADVISE ON COVER CROPS AND CROP ROTATION TO\nMAINTAIN SOIL FERTILITY AND PEST CONTROL.<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>TODAY WHITE PEOPLE WHO\nLEARNT FROM US HAVE PATENTED THIS KNOWLEDGE AND ARE TEACHING INDIA , CALLING US\nHEATHEN SAVAGES<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>NOT ANY MORE<o:p></o:p></b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ojovo_rpZFQ/WRtWgHLo6NI/AAAAAAABTZw/jQeNL0rVXbEc8c7xsWRmFQ6eg-ZlujwvwCLcB/s1600/crop-rotWation-.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"336\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-Ojovo_rpZFQ/WRtWgHLo6NI/AAAAAAABTZw/jQeNL0rVXbEc8c7xsWRmFQ6eg-ZlujwvwCLcB/s640/crop-rotWation-.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A cover crop is a crop\nplanted primarily to manage soil erosion, soil fertility, soil quality, water,\nweeds, pests, diseases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Although cover crops\ncan perform multiple functions in an agroecosystem simultaneously, they are\noften grown for the sole purpose of preventing soil erosion.&nbsp; Soil erosion is a process that can\nirreparably reduce the productive capacity of an agroecosystem.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Dense cover crop stands physically slow down\nthe velocity of rainfall before it contacts the soil surface, preventing soil\nsplashing and erosive surface runoff<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One of the primary uses\nof cover crops is to increase soil fertility. These types of cover crops are\nreferred to as \"green manure.\" They are used to manage a range of\nsoil macronutrients and micronutrients. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/0MECOZHEdDg/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/0MECOZHEdDg?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cover crops can also\nimprove soil quality by increasing soil organic matter levels through the input\nof cover crop biomass over time. Increased soil organic matter enhances soil\nstructure, as well as the water and nutrient holding and buffering capacity of\nsoil .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By reducing soil\nerosion, cover crops often also reduce both the rate and quantity of water that\ndrains off the field, which would normally pose environmental risks to waterways\nand ecosystems downstream.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cover crop\nbiomass acts as a physical barrier between rainfall and the soil surface,\nallowing raindrops to steadily trickle down through the soil profile. Also, as\nstated above, cover crop root growth results in the formation of soil pores,\nwhich in addition to enhancing soil macrofauna habitat provides pathways for\nwater to filter through the soil profile rather than draining off the field as\nsurface flow.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With increased water infiltration, the potential for soil water storage\nand the recharging of aquifers can be improved .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While cover crops can\nhelp to conserve water, in temperate regions (particularly in years with below\naverage precipitation) they can draw down soil water supply in the spring,\nparticularly if climatic growing conditions are good. In these cases, just\nbefore crop planting, farmers often face a tradeoff between the benefits of\nincreased cover crop growth and the drawbacks of reduced soil moisture for cash\ncrop production that season. C/N ratio is balanced with this application.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some cover crops\nsuppress weeds both during growth and after death . During growth these cover\ncrops compete vigorously with weeds for available space, light, and nutrients,\nand after death they smother the next flush of weeds by forming a mulch layer\non the soil surface.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some cover crops are\nused as so-called \"trap crops\", to attract pests away from the crop\nof value and toward what the pest sees as a more favorable habitat.&nbsp; In some organic systems, farmers drive over\nthe trap crop with a large vacuum-based implement to physically pull the pests\noff the plants and out of the field .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other cover crops are\nused to attract natural predators of pests by providing elements of their\nhabitat. This is a form of biological control known as habitat augmentation,\nbut achieved with the use of cover crops <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since the cover crop is\ntypically not a crop of value, its management is usually less intensive,\nproviding a window of \u201csoft\u201d human influence on the farm. This relatively\n\u201chands-off\u201d management, combined with the increased on-farm heterogeneity\ncreated by the establishment of cover crops, increases the likelihood that a\nmore complex trophic structure will develop to support a higher level of\nwildlife diversity<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crop rotation is the\npractice of growing a series of dissimilar or different types of crops in the\nsame area in sequenced seasons. It is done so that the soil of farms is not\nused for only one set of nutrients. It helps in reducing soil erosion and\nincreases soil fertility and crop yield.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Growing the same crop\nin the same place for many years in a row disproportionately depletes the soil\nof certain nutrients. With rotation, a crop that leaches the soil of one kind\nof nutrient is followed during the next growing season by a dissimilar crop\nthat returns that nutrient to the soil or draws a different ratio of nutrients.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition, crop rotation mitigates the buildup of pathogens and pests that\noften occurs when one species is continuously cropped, and can also improve\nsoil structure and fertility by increasing biomass from varied root structures.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Green Revolution\nof the mid-20th century the traditional practice of crop rotation gave way in\nthe western world to the practice of CHEMICAL KOSHER AGRICULTURE (using\nartificial fertilizers, pesticides and sterile&nbsp;\nGM seeds ) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A preliminary\nassessment of crop interrelationships can be found in how each crop: (1)\ncontributes to soil organic matter (SOM) content, (2) provides for pest\nmanagement, (3) manages deficient or excess nutrients, and (4) how it\ncontributes to or controls for soil erosion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many crops which are\ncritical for the market, like vegetables, are row crops (that is, grown in\ntight rows). While often the most profitable for farmers, these crops are more\ntaxing on the soil. Row crops typically have low biomass and shallow roots:\nthis means the plant contributes low residue to the surrounding soil and has\nlimited effects on structure<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While these crops may\nbe profitable for the farm, they are nutrient depleting. Crop rotation\npractices exist to strike a balance between short-term profitability and\nlong-term productivity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A great advantage of\ncrop rotation comes from the interrelationship of nitrogen fixing-crops with\nnitrogen demanding crops<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A crop rotation must\nconsider in what condition one crop will leave the soil for the succeeding crop\nand how one crop can be seeded with another crop. For example, a\nnitrogen-fixing crop, like a legume, should always proceed a nitrogen depleting\none; similarly, a low residue crop (i.e. a crop with low biomass) should be\noffset with a high biomass cover crop.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crop rotation systems\nmay be enriched by the influences of other practices such as the addition of\nlivestock and manure, intercropping or multiple cropping, and organic\nmanagement without using &nbsp;pesticides and\nsynthetic fertilizers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Farmers are required to\nimplement a crop rotation that maintains or builds soil organic matter, works\nto control pests, manages and conserves nutrients, and protects against\nerosion. Producers of perennial crops that aren\u2019t rotated may utilize other\npractices, such as cover crops, to maintain soil health.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition to lowering\nthe need for inputs by controlling for pests and weeds and increasing available\nnutrients, crop rotation helps organic growers increase the amount of\nbiodiversity on their farms.&nbsp; Increasing\nthe biodiversity of crops has beneficial effects on the surrounding ecosystem\nand can host a greater diversity of fauna, insects, and beneficial\nmicroorganism in the soil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The use of different\nspecies in rotation allows for increased soil organic matter (SOM), greater\nsoil structure, and improvement of the chemical and biological soil environment\nfor crops. With more SOM, water infiltration and retention improves, providing\nincreased drought tolerance and decreased erosion.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil organic matter is\na mix of decaying material from biomass with active microorganisms. Crop\nrotation, by nature, increases exposure to biomass from sod, green manure, and\na various other plant debris. The reduced need for intensive tillage under crop\nrotation allows biomass aggregation to lead to greater nutrient retention and\nutilization, decreasing the need for added nutrients.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil microorganisms\ndecrease pathogen and pest activity through competition. Plants produce root\nexudates and other chemicals which manipulate their soil environment as well as\ntheir weed environment. Thus rotation allows increased yields from nutrient\navailability but also alleviation of allelopathy and competitive weed\nenvironments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crop rotations greatly\nincrease soil organic carbon (SOC) content, the main constituent of soil organic\nmatter.&nbsp; Carbon, along with hydrogen and\noxygen, is a macronutrient for plants. Highly diverse rotations spanning long\nperiods of time have shown to be even more effective in increasing SOC.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Rotating crops adds\nnutrients to the soil. Legumes, plants of the family Fabaceae, for instance,\nhave nodules on their roots which contain nitrogen-fixing bacteria called\nrhizobia. During a process called nodulation, the rhizobia bacteria use\nnutrients and water provided by the plant to convert atmospheric nitrogen into\nammonia, which is then converted into an organic compound that the plant can\nuse as its nitrogen source.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\ntherefore makes good sense agriculturally to alternate them with cereals\n(family Poaceae) and other plants that require nitrates. How much nitrogen made\navailable to the plants depends on factors such as the kind of legume, the\neffectiveness of rhizobia bacteria, soil conditions, and the availability of\nelements necessary for plant food<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Crop rotation is also\nused to control pests and diseases that can become established in the soil over\ntime. The changing of crops in a sequence decreases the population level of\npests by (1) interrupting pest life cycles and (2) interrupting pest habitat.\nPlants within the same taxonomic family tend to have similar pests and\npathogens.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;By regularly changing crops and keeping the soil occupied by cover\ncrops instead of lying fallow, pest cycles can be broken or limited, especially\ncycles that benefit from overwintering in residue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This principle is of\nparticular use in organic farming, where pest control must be achieved without\nsynthetic pesticides<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Integrating certain\ncrops, especially cover crops, into crop rotations is of particular value to\nweed management. These crops crowd out weed through competition.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition, the sod\nand compost from cover crops and green manure slows the growth of what weeds\nare still able to make it through the soil, giving the crops further\ncompetitive advantage. By removing slowing the growth and proliferation of\nweeds while cover crops are cultivated, farmers greatly reduce the presence of\nweeds for future crops, including shallow rooted and row crops, which are less\nresistant to weeds.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Cover crops are, therefore, considered conservation crops\nbecause they protect otherwise fallow land from becoming overrun with weeds.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Increasing the\nbiodiversity of crops has beneficial effects on the surrounding ecosystem and\ncan host a greater diversity of fauna, insects, and beneficial microorganisms\nin the soil.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Increased nutrient availability from crop rotation under organic\nsystems compared to conventional practices as organic practices are less likely\nto inhibit of beneficial microbes in soil organic matter, such as arbuscular\nmycorrhizae, which increase nutrient uptake in plants.&nbsp;&nbsp; Increasing biodiversity also increases the\nresilience of agro-ecological systems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Different crops in the\nrotation can reduce the risks of adverse weather for the individual farmer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The purpose of crop rotation is to help\nmaintain the balance of nutrients, organic matter, and microorganisms necessary\nfor healthy soil.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of these three, the invisible world of soil-dwelling\nmicro-creatures is the one that most benefits from crop rotations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Most pests and diseases can damage plants of\nthe same botanical family, but cannot hurt unrelated crops <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1b8D-wwyxpk/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1b8D-wwyxpk?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In addition to\ninterrupting disease cycles, rotating crops prevents the depletion of\nnutrients. For example, tomatoes need plenty of calcium the same way beans and\nbeets crave manganese. But the exact benefits of effective rotations vary with\ncrop sequence.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Broad-leafed greens are great for suppressing weeds, and the\ndeep roots of sweet corn do a good job of penetrating compacted subsoil.\nNitrogen-fixing legumes often take no more nitrogen from the soil than they\nreplace, and their presence stimulates the growth of beneficial soil\nmicroorganisms. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Planting marigold or\ncalendula between vegetables may reduce unwanted nematodes in the soil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some herbs planted\namong the vegetables or around the vegetable patch appear to keep pests at bay.\nFor example, basil planted with tomatoes and lettuce may deter insects, and\noregano planted with broccoli may repel cabbage flies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We must rotate annual\ncrops for the same reasons. To continually plant the same thing in the same\nspace will undoubtedly create an imbalance in the soil nutrients. This system\nwould then require that we supplement the soil, replenishing whatever nutrients\nare being depleted.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/QBSGuUq2D9E/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/QBSGuUq2D9E?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Similarly, by putting the same crop in the same spot, we\nalso signal it as a prime spot for diseases and pests to wait around for next\nseason\u2019s feast. Rather, if we keep things rotating, the nutrients get naturally\nreplenished, and the problem elements have a tougher time finding what they\nwant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Legumes and pulses,\ndifferent types of beans and peas, are great because they take nitrogen from\nthe air and \u201cfix\u201d it into the soil, naturally increasing fertility. They are\ngreat crops to grow before planting hungry plants, such as those from the\nbrassica family: kale, cabbage, broccoli, cauliflower, mustard, etc.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fruiting\nplants, such tomatoes, eggplants, peppers, cucumbers, melons, and squashes, are\nnot quite as demanding as the leafy crops, so they can follow the brassicas.\nHowever, root vegetables \u2014 the garlics, the onions, the carrots, the beets of\nthe world\u2014tend to be skilled at rooting out their own nutritional needs, so\nthey can follow these two hungry plants and still do okay. Then, it\u2019s back to\nlegumes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The goals of crop\nrotation are to help manage organic soil fertility and also to help avoid or\nreduce problems with soil-borne diseases and some soil-dwelling insects.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XeNA6XdMoF8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/XeNA6XdMoF8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Different crops have\ndifferent nutrient requirements and affect soil balance differently. Some, like\ncorn and tomatoes, are heavy feeders that quickly deplete soil nitrogen and\nphosphorus.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Thus, if you plant corn in the same spot year after year, that plot\nof soil will run low on nitrogen and phosphorus more quickly than other parts\nof your garden will.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By changing the location of corn each year, you'll be able\nto renew the plot where it grew the preceding year, so your soil won't get out\nof balance. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/L1_Nz8AdTW0/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/L1_Nz8AdTW0?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are other crops\nthat also use up nitrogen rapidly. They tend to be the leafy and fruiting\ncrops, such as lettuce, cabbage, and tomatoes. In contrast, root vegetables and\nherbs are light feeders. Peas, beans, and other legumes add nitrogen to the\nsoil but need lots of phosphorus.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For decades, we\u2019ve\nproduced the bulk of our food through industrial agriculture\u2014a system dominated\nby large farms growing the same crops year after year, using enormous amounts\nof chemical pesticides and fertilizers that damage soils, water, air, and\nclimate. This system is not built to last, because it squanders and degrades\nthe resources that it depends on. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/XeNA6XdMoF8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/XeNA6XdMoF8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Moving toward a farming\nsystem that is more sustainable\u2014environmentally, economically, and socially.\nThis system has room for farms of all sizes, producing a diverse range of\nfoods, fibers, and fuels adapted to local conditions and regional markets. It\nuses state-of-the-art, science-based practices that maximize productivity and\nprofit while minimizing environmental damage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Planting cover crops\nlike clover or hairy vetch, are planted during off-season times when soils\nmight otherwise be left bare. These crops protect and build soil health by\npreventing erosion, replenishing soil nutrients, and keeping weeds in check,\nreducing the need for herbicides.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some proponents of\nindustrial KOSHER agriculture claim that its impacts are the price we must pay\nto \u201cfeed the world.\u201d <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>BALLS \u2013</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>WE DON\u2019T WANT\nZIONIST JEWS TO SAVE THIS PLANET\u2014</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><b>THEY HAVE SAVED IT ENOUGH&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></b></span></span></div>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></b><br />\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c4977057870173739064\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; BUT YOU CANT TELL THE TRUTH ABOUT A LOSER LAWYER TURNED CORRUPT COLLEGIUM JUDGE ...... REASON ?<br />\n<br />\nYOURS AND MINE SH1T SMELL , BUT A INDIAN JUDGEs SH1T DOES NOT SMELL .........<br />\n<br />\n\"CONTEMPT OF COURT \" IS MEANT TO BE APPLIED INSIDE A BRICK AND CEMENT COURT ROOM FOR A SPECIFIC CASE THE JUDGE IS RULING.....<br />\n<br />\nIT IS NOT MEANT TO BE APPLIED ALONG THE LENGTH AND BREATH OF THIS PLANET-- OVER LAND/ UNDER LAND.... OVER WATER/ UNDER WATER..... INSIDE THE TOILET/ INSIDE THE SH1T SEPTIC TANK , .. font-size: xx-large;\">JUSTICE MUST NOT BE BLIND IN INDIA.. NATURAL JUSTICE MUST PREVAIL.... CONTEXT MUST RULE....&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">BURN ALL PAST JUDGEMENTS BY COLLEGIUM JUDGES...&nbsp;</span></b></span><br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;times&quot; , &quot;freeserif&quot; , serif;\">WE THE PEOPLE ARE ABOVE THE CONSTITUTION...... Ajit Vadakayil", "url": "https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654", "image": {"url": "//4.bp.blogspot.com/-QSnd-Z8F7Kc/XFtPudWdwlI/AAAAAAABfq4/vxrkFOO7Iu8Mf6-OaPgw6FPpRDSmMgLdgCK4BGAYYCw/s35/capt%25252BajitC%25252Bvadakayil.JPG"}}, "replies": {"totalItems": "170", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/1874906313625462833/comments"}}, {"kind": "blogger#post", "id": "185960055740468312", "blog": {"id": "3564735312144269387"}, "published": "2017-05-14T11:47:00+05:30", "updated": "2017-05-15T21:08:07+05:30", "etag": "\"iHf3yWDE_geBgZ8U7rgZ_xuTeAQ/dGltZXN0YW1wOiAxNDk0ODYyNjg3NTExCm9mZnNldDogMTk4MDAwMDAK\"", "url": "http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/05/groundwater-resources-of-india-part-4.html", "selfLink": "https://www.googleapis.com/blogger/v3/blogs/3564735312144269387/posts/185960055740468312", "title": "GROUNDWATER RESOURCES OF INDIA , Part 4 \u2014 CAPT AJIT VADAKAYIL", "content": "<div dir=\"ltr\" style=\"text-align: left;\" trbidi=\"on\">\n<br />\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS POST IS CONTINUED FROM PART 3, BELOW--</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/groundwater-resources-of-india-part-3.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/05/groundwater-resources-of-india-part-3.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once an aquifer is\ncontaminated by carcinogenic chemicals from landfill leachate , it may be\nunusable for very long time.&nbsp; This period\ncan be anywhere from two years&nbsp; to 1000\nyears.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Landfill leachate\ncomposition varies relative to the amount of precipitation and the quantity and\ntype of wastes disposed. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The release of\nhazardous&nbsp; components of leachate may\nrender an aquifer unusable for drinking-water purposes and other uses. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leachate impacts to groundwater may also\npresent a danger to the environment and to aquatic species if the\nleachate-contaminated groundwater plume discharges to wetlands or streams.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once leachate is formed\nand is released to the groundwater environment, it will migrate downward\nthrough the unsaturated zone until it eventually reaches the saturated zone .\nLeachate then will follow the hydraulic gradient of the groundwater system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Landfills must not be\nin areas where there is too much rainfall and a vulnerable aquifer underneath<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even the best-installed\nplastic liner will succumb to deterioration and eventually will allow leachate\nto be released from the bottom .</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It is important to line the landfill with\nimpervious clay before laying down the landfill liner.&nbsp; Landfills must be dry tombs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Leachate from solid\nwaste landfills also can contain deadly mutating viruses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">WE ASK THE MODI GOVT TO\nLAY A POLICY ON LANDFILL LINERS AND LEACHATE PUMPING SYSTEMS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">MR MODI\u2014BE MATURE\u2014BE A\nLEADER WITH SPIRIT , WHEN YOU TALK ON YOUR MANN KI BAATH..&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">EVERYTHING WHICH COMES\nOUT OF YOUR MOUTH MUST SERVE THE WATAN..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">STOP THIS RIDICULOUS MINORITY\nAPPEASEMENT FOR VOTES AND ENDLESS PROPAGANDA FOR ROTHSCHILDs FAKE CREATIONS AND\nAGENTS .&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/1DP9nIlAEP8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/1DP9nIlAEP8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Danish SkyTEM\nmethod, is developed to map buried aquifers.&nbsp;\nIt is a airborne geophysical system capable of mapping the top 500 metres\nof the Earth in fine detail and in 3 dimensions. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The SkyTEM frame\ncarries an array of ancillary sensors including a magnetometer, laser\naltimeters, video cameras and GPS equipment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">After collecting high\nresolution SkyTEM data exploratory holes are drilled.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;SkyTEM data contributes to the success of\ndrilling programs and can often be collected for less than the cost of a single\nborehole.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SkyTEM312FAST is a\nradical cost efficient departure from all other existing helicopter HTEM\nsystems. The system can be flown at 150 kilometers per hour close to the ground\nand is built on a rigid and aerodynamic carrier frame<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This maintains the low\nnoise levels necessary to provide fine discrimination in the near surface data\nwhile retaining the&nbsp; ability to detect\nweak conductors at depth.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SkyTEM312FAST is able to acquire over 1,000\nkilometers of data per day and is ideal for both mineral exploration and\ngroundwater mapping purposes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All SkyTEM systems\nemploy dual-moment technology where a current waveform composed of low and high\ndipole-moments is used enabling discrimination between weak geological\ncontrasts in the top layers concurrently with those at depth. <o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RrHH-KsdJPY/WRhHoHzVIzI/AAAAAAABTTQ/zzuiF4UHLbobUdjjLb6CbTAKYG4EaSRYwCLcB/s1600/eskytem.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"382\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-RrHH-KsdJPY/WRhHoHzVIzI/AAAAAAABTTQ/zzuiF4UHLbobUdjjLb6CbTAKYG4EaSRYwCLcB/s640/eskytem.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Low moment (LM) mode\nwith low current, high base frequency and fast turn off provides early-time\ndata and high spatial sampling for shallow imaging.&nbsp;&nbsp; High moment (HM) mode with high current and\nlow base frequency provides high quality late-time data for deep imaging.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-O-pa1RKD_p0/WRhH1KHwyUI/AAAAAAABTTU/6S6taL9J_GkwF1vfuv7BhrnbaUTbQvozwCLcB/s1600/Fig-2-SkyTEM-dffevice-in-operation-Fig-2-Systeme-SkyTEM-en-operation.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-O-pa1RKD_p0/WRhH1KHwyUI/AAAAAAABTTU/6S6taL9J_GkwF1vfuv7BhrnbaUTbQvozwCLcB/s640/Fig-2-SkyTEM-dffevice-in-operation-Fig-2-Systeme-SkyTEM-en-operation.png\" width=\"528\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The SkyTEM system is\none-time calibrated allowing for direct comparison with ground based or borehole\nEM datasets together with complete traceability back to the established TEM\nreference model.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This ensures that data from repeat or contiguous SkyTEM\nsurveys can be seamlessly and confidently processed and combined.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/NgPJQsAhA9Q/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/NgPJQsAhA9Q?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\nhelicopter-supported SKYTEM method can map groundwater - the method can scan\nthe geological conditions to a depth of 300m at an airspeed of 30 km per hour.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/fr7XFTUnGD8/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/fr7XFTUnGD8?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><b>THE GROUND WATER OF NETHERLANDS\nIS TOTALLY POLLUTED BY ARTIFICIAL FERTILISERS AND PESTICIDES.&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;LIKE\nIN PUNJAB THE PEOPLE THERE HAVE TAKEN REFUGE IN DRUGS</b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-o56y9u9j6pM/WRhP28T6LRI/AAAAAAABTTo/fUZkfQXzaVMQc4zHxrprmVTqoOpOHmKFACLcB/s1600/Eimages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; Filipinos, blacks and Bangladesis ran to but these bungalows. A lot\nof them are dead today. Dead men tell no tales<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://auto.ndtv.com/news/ratan-tata-was-humiliated-by-ford-reveals-colleague-746893\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://auto.ndtv.com/news/ratan-tata-was-humiliated-by-ford-reveals-colleague-746893</a><o:p></o:p><br />\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">BELOW: THIS IS THE CONDITION OF BALTIC SEA DUE TO RUN OFF FROM ARTIFICIAL FERTILISERS . &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">YET THE DESH DROHI BASTARDS TAKE KICKBACKS AND PRETEND THAT GREEN REVOLUTION IS GOOD FROM INDIA. &nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\"><br /></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">YOU MUST KNOW I AM AN EXPERT OF WORLD SEAS&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both;
