text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-syhZRzFfDmA/WRhciZSmnzI/AAAAAAABTUY/NZBjmmBgjjkpEDAr0E_7crOMLkZsfzCmACLcB/s1600/iTTmage.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-syhZRzFfDmA/WRhciZSmnzI/AAAAAAABTUY/NZBjmmBgjjkpEDAr0E_7crOMLkZsfzCmACLcB/s640/iTTmage.jpg\" width=\"569\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>THIS IS WHAT NITRATE AND PHOSPHATES DO TO WATER-- AND MIND YOU, THIS IS BALTIC SEA WATER ( ALBEIT SLIGHTLY LESSER SALINITY ) &nbsp;, NOT FRESH WATER..&nbsp;</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>IN OUR LOK SABHA / RAJYA SABHA HOW MANY MPs CAN THINK FOR NUTS ?</b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><b>WE HAVE ROGUE GURUS GETTING PADMA VIBHUSHAN BECAUSE THEY ARE ENVIRONMENTAL EXPERTS , &nbsp;RIGHT MR MODI ? &nbsp; &nbsp; THEY GOT SPONTANEOUS DIVINE KNOWLEDGE, RIGHT MR MODI &nbsp;?</b></span></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vIEcbgb4DVg/WRhc98DQNCI/AAAAAAABTUc/B1UAkL_oJQY3jLjOLFixd_2tuPJfigVuACLcB/s1600/downloadEE.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"533\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-vIEcbgb4DVg/WRhc98DQNCI/AAAAAAABTUc/B1UAkL_oJQY3jLjOLFixd_2tuPJfigVuACLcB/s640/downloadEE.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/QcYKMVcc9HM/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/QcYKMVcc9HM?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">I have been to\nLithuania. My Lithuanian officers tell me that 62 % of shallow groundwater\nwells that supply more than 1.1 million rural residents in Lithuania are unfit\nfor human consumption because of a wide range of pollutants from artificial\nfertilisers and pesticides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>INDIAN TOP SOIL WAS SO\nFERTILE &nbsp;AND HOLY THAT IT NEVER NEEDED\nARTIFICIAL FERTILIZERS<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THE BASTARD POLITICIANS\nWHO TOOK BRIBES DECIMATED OUR VEDIC HUMPED COWS<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>THE BASTARD POLITICIANS\nWHO TOOK BRIBES DEDICMATED OUR HOLY TOP SOIL<o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>NOW BASTARD POLITICIANS\nWHO TOOK BRIBES ARE INJECTING USELESS VACCINES INTO OUR BABIES</b></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">ALL THESE BASTARD DESH\nDROHI POLITICIANS HAVE BENAMI MEDIA SUPPORT</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow;\"><b>THE HUMPLESS COW BEEF LOBBY HAD DECIMATED THE AIR WATER AND\nSOIL OF THIS PLANET <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/CLD1YyLBhbU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/CLD1YyLBhbU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/x2N6BEQ2SWw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/x2N6BEQ2SWw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">N2 is an \u201cunreactive\u201d\nform of nitrogen that plants and animals cannot access directly. In order for\norganisms to draw on this nitrogen to support their growth, the nitrogen must\nbe \u201cfixed\u201d \u2013 that is, converted from the unreactive N2 form to a reactive form\nsuch as nitrate (NO3) or ammonia (NH3).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In an environment absent of human\ninfluence, this conversion occurs only through fixation by plant- and\nsoil-associated bacteria and lightning strikes. Human processes have doubled\nthe global rate at which reactive nitrogen is produced. This change has led to\nan increase in the sources of reactive nitrogen that contribute to\nenvironmental pollution.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate is the most\ncommon pollutant as dissolved nitrogen&nbsp;\nin groundwater. However, it can be found in the form of nitrite (NO2-),\nnitrogen (N2), nitrogen oxide (N2O) and organic nitrogen. Nitrate that leaves\nthe atmosphere can be transformed back into elemental nitrogen, through the\nprocess of denitrification.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This often takes place in the soil through the\nactivity of bacteria that reduce the nitrate. Ammonium can undergo the process\nof nitrification, which is an oxidation reaction, that converts it to nitrate.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through this mechanism, the nitrogen in the ammonium ion is released back into\nthe atmosphere .After the conversion from elemental into nitrogenous ions in\nsolutions of rainwater, the nitrogen in these compounds can be exhausted back\nto the atmosphere.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen fertilizers or\nmanures used on a sandy soil are more prone to leaching to groundwater than\nnitrogen used on a clay soil. Water moves rapidly through sandy or other\ncoarse-textured soils.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen loss to the groundwater from clay soils is smaller\nthan those for the coarse-textured soils. Clay soils do not specially retain\nnitrates. Water movement through clay soils is very slow and small.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water does\nnot pass easily through clay soils so nitrates, which only move with water, do\nnot leach to groundwater. Pore space in clay soils is often filled with water.\nWater-filled pores of clay soils lack oxygen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lacking oxygen, a group of soil\nbacteria, called facultative anaerobes, substitute nitrates for oxygen for\nrespiration. The nitrate concentration in groundwater is influenced by\nrainfall, where the amounts of rainfall are low, the concentration tends to be\nhigh because the diluting effect is reduced.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN SINGAPORE THE UPPITTY\nGOVT CUNTS HAVE USED SO MUCH OF ARTIFICIAL FERTILISERS THAT THEIR GROUND WATER\nIN UNDRINKABLE.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">YOU SEE \"BEAUTIFUL\" &nbsp;SINGAPORE DOES NOT WANT TOURISTS TO SEE SOIL\u2014THEY HAVE\nCOVERED EVERY INCH OF SOIL WITH A BULLSHIT GRASS CALLED SINGAPORE GRASS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/honey-quantum-food-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/08/honey-quantum-food-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THEY IMPORT WATER FROM\nANOTHER COUNTRY- &nbsp;MALAYSIA<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As of 2003, about 52%\nof Singapore's water came from Malaysia.. Malaysia has often issued threats of\ncutting off the water supply to pressure Singapore politically.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By 2010, Singapore had\nconstructed five Newater plants, a desalination plant and a new water barrage\nto increase rainwater supply. NEWater is the brand name given to reclaimed\nwater produced by Singapore's Public Utilities Board. &nbsp;&nbsp;More specifically, it is treated wastewater\n(sewage) that has been purified using dual-membrane (via microfiltration and\nreverse osmosis) and ultraviolet technologies, in addition to conventional\nwater treatment processes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ALL THIS IN A COUNTRY\nWHERE IT RAINS EVERY FUCKIN\u2019 DAY.. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE\nSINGAPORE &nbsp;GOVT KEEPS GROUND WATER\nPOLLUTION AND TOTAL DESTRUCTION OF AQUIFERS AS A STATE SECRET<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per the guide lines\nof WHO (2006) and ISI (2004), the nitrate in potable water should not exceed 50\nppm and 45 ppm respectively.</span><o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIA IS GOING THE SAME WAY THANKS TO BASTARD DESH DROHI POLITICIANS WHO TAKE KICKBACKS FOR GREEN\nREVOLUTION ARTIFICIAL FERTILISERS AND PESTICIDES</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The toxicological\neffects of nitrate noted&nbsp; in three\nstages. The primary toxic effect of nitrate concentrations in drinking water of\n50 mg NO3 - /L exceeds the value of the bowel in adults, digestive and urinary\nsystems, inflammation is seen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Secondary toxicity, high nitrate concentration\nin drinking water caused disease in infants as methamoglobianemia, commonly\ncalled \u2018blue baby syndrome\u2019. A further concern is that nitrate can be\nconverted, by bacteria in the digestive tract, into nitrosamines which are carcinogenic.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/small-intestinal-bacterial-overgrowth.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/04/small-intestinal-bacterial-overgrowth.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The impact of\npesticides consists of the effects of pesticides on non-target species.\nPesticides are chemical preparations used to kill fungal or animal pests. Over\n98% of sprayed insecticides and 95% of herbicides reach a destination other\nthan their target species, because they are sprayed or spread across entire\nagricultural fields.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Runoff can carry pesticides into aquatic\nenvironments while wind can carry them to other fields, grazing areas, human\nsettlements and undeveloped areas, potentially affecting other species. Other\nproblems emerge from poor production, transport and storage practices.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Over\ntime, repeated application increases pest resistance, while its effects on\nother species can facilitate the pest's resurgence.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pesticides can\ncontribute to air pollution. Pesticide drift occurs when pesticides suspended\nin the air as particles are carried by wind to other areas, potentially\ncontaminating them.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pesticides that are applied to crops can volatilize and may\nbe blown by winds into nearby areas, potentially posing a threat to wildlife.&nbsp; Weather conditions at the time of application\nas well as temperature and relative humidity change the spread of the pesticide\nin the air.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As wind velocity increases so does the spray drift and exposure.\nLow relative humidity and high temperature result in more spray evaporating.\nThe amount of inhalable pesticides in the outdoor environment is therefore\noften dependent on the season.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Also, droplets of sprayed pesticides or\nparticles from pesticides applied as dusts may travel on the wind to other\nareas, or pesticides may adhere to particles that blow in the wind, such as\ndust particles. Ground spraying produces less pesticide drift than aerial\nspraying does.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the United States,\npesticides were found to pollute every stream and over 93% of wells sampled in\na study by the US Geological Survey.&nbsp; &nbsp;Pesticide residues have also been found in\nrain and groundwater.&nbsp; &nbsp;Studies by the EU govts showed that pesticide\nconcentrations exceeded those allowable for drinking water in most samples of river\nwater and groundwater.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bastard DESH DROHI\npoliticians ( kickbacks ) along with Rothschild\u2019s benami media has decimated\nIndia\u2019s pristine top soil and groundwater killing priceless soil microbes.\nToday India is worse off than many EU nations.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Even today the Modi govt along\nwith benami media are singing the praises of GM foods , artificial fertilisers\nand persticides.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; Our ground water was the best on\nthe planet. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\">THIS IS AS STUPID AS YOUR\nTOILET BOWL CARRYING AWAY YOUR URINE AND FLUSH WATER LEAVING SHIT BEHIND</span></b><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are four major\nroutes through which pesticides reach the water: it may drift outside of the\nintended area when it is sprayed, it may percolate, or leach, through the soil,\nit may be carried to the water as runoff, or it may be spilled, for example accidentally\nor through neglect.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They may also be carried to water by eroding soil. &nbsp;Factors that affect a pesticide's ability to\ncontaminate water include its water solubility, the distance from an\napplication site to a body of water, weather, soil type, presence of a growing\ncrop, and the method used to apply the chemical.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of the chemicals\nused in pesticides are persistent soil contaminants, whose impact may endure\nfor decades and adversely affect soil conservation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The use of pesticides\ndecreases the general biodiversity in the soil. Not using the chemicals results\nin higher soil quality, with the additional effect that more organic matter in\nthe soil allows for higher water retention.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This helps increase yields for\nfarms in drought years, when organic farms have had yields 35 -40% higher than\ntheir conventional counterparts.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A smaller content of organic matter in the\nsoil increases the amount of pesticide that will leave the area of application,\nbecause organic matter binds to and helps break down pesticides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In a natural soil\nenvironment, a cooperative relationship exists between microbes and plants.\nPlants like grass, trees and food crops depend on microorganisms in the soil to\nobtain water, solubise nutrients, protect from pests and pathogens, prevent\nnutrient loss and break down compounds that could inhibit growth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These soil\nmicrobes, in return, benefit from the health of plants growing in the soil and\nsubstances secreted from the plants root system. This relationship creates a\ndynamic living system that is easily broken by conventional systems that use\npesticides, herbicides and fertilizers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/ibs-irritable-bowel-syndrome-vagus_14.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2017/03/ibs-irritable-bowel-syndrome-vagus_14.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">BEFORE THE ADVENT OF THE DESH DROHI\nGREEN REVOLUTION INDIA WAS SUCH A PRISTINE COUNTRY WITH HOLY TOPSOIL GIVING\nPRODUCE WITH GOLDEN MEAN INHERENT\u2026<o:p></o:p></span></b></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">WE MUST REMEMBER ONLY VEDIC HUMPED\nCOW DUNG IS USEFUL FOR THE SOIL..THE DUNG OF THE USELESS HUMPESS JERSEY COW IS\nBAD FOR THE TOP SOIL</span></b><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A small handful of\nhealthy soil will include millions of microscopic organisms that are beneficial\nto the soil systems where healthy plants grow, including fungi, nematodes,\nprotozoa, microathopods and other beneficial bacteria.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These microbes decompose\norganic material while they absorb water and nutrients that would otherwise get\nlost in the soil; the absorbed water and nutrients then get used by more and\nmore complex creatures.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This ecosystem ranges from the tiniest bacteria to the\nlargest mammal predators. Any damage suffered by one part of the system can\naffect the health of all the others.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first level of the\nsoil ecosystem is made up of bacteria and fungi that consume leftover organic\nmatter, nitrogen and nutrients. These organisms act like a nutrient bank that\nplants can use when they need it.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The second level of organisms consists of\npredators that feed on the bacteria and fungi. Nitrogen and nutrients are\nmetabolized and released into the soil at a slow rate that is beneficial to\nplant growth.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Higher-level predators, like millipedes and earthworms, make up\nthe third level. These animals keep the second-level organisms in check,\nhelping the plants maintain a healthy growth rate.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The third level is also made\nup of bigger predators that keep the smaller ones from over eating. This\nextensive bio-diversity is what makes all life in the soil ecosystem possible.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pesticides include a\nlarge group of chemical agents that attempt to eliminate destructive biological\nforces in agriculture. These include herbicides for killing plants,\ninsecticides for killing insects, fungicides for killing fungus and\nbactericides for killing bacteria.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While these chemicals supposedly only target\nspecific species, repeated use inevitably kills microbial life that is\nbeneficial to the soil system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Microbes that survive can be genetically altered\nin a way that is no longer beneficial to the soil ecosystem and be resistant to\nthe chemical intended to kill them. The destruction or alteration of\nfirst-level microbes can affect the entire soil ecosystem all the way up to the\nlargest mammalian predators.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fertilizers are of two\ntypes: organic, or natural, and inorganic, or synthetic. Organic fertilizers are\nnaturally occurring substances and include biofertilizers, green manure,\norganic manure and compost.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They slowly leach essential nutrients into the soil\nand improve its overall vitality with time. Synthetic fertilizers are man-made\ncombinations of chemicals and inorganic substances.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They typically combine\nnitrogen, phosphorus, potassium, calcium, magnesium and other elements in\ndifferent ratios. Synthetic fertilizers, unlike their organic counterparts,\nimmediately supply essential nutrients to soil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic fertilizers\nhave long-term negative effects.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic fertilizers kill beneficial\nmicroorganisms in the soil that convert dead human and plant remains into\nnutrient-rich organic matter.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen- and phosphate-based synthetic\nfertilizers leach into groundwater and increase its toxicity, causing water\npollution. Fertilizers that leach into streams, rivers, lakes and other bodies\nof water disrupt aquatic ecosystems.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic fertilizers increase the nitrate\nlevels of soil. Plants produced from such soil, upon consumption, convert to\ntoxic nitrites in the intestines.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;These harmful nitrites react with the\nhemoglobin in the blood stream to cause methaeglobinaemia, which damages the\nvascular and respiratory systems, causing suffocation and even death in extreme\ncases (when blood methaemoglobin level is 80 percent or more).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic\nfertilizers damage the natural makeup of soil in the long term. Plants that\ngrow in overly fertilized soil are deficient in iron, zinc, carotene, vitamin\nC, copper and protein.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Effects of pesticides:\nPesticides reaching the soil in significant quantities have direct effect on\nsoil microbiological aspects, which in turn influence plant growth.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of the\nmost important effects caused by pesticides are :&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(1) alterations hi ecological\nbalance of the soil microflora,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(2) continued application of large quantities\nof pesticides may cause ever lasting changes in the soil microflora,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(3)\nadverse effect on soil fertility and crop productivity,</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(4) inhibition of N2\nfixing soil microorganisms such as Rhizobium, Azotobacter, Azospirillum etc.\nand cellulolytic and phosphate solubilizing microorganisms,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(5) suppression of\nnitrifying bacteria, Nitrosomonas and Nitrobacter by soil fumigants ethylene\nbromide, Telone, and vapam have also been reported,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(6) alterations in nitrogen\nbalance of the soil,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(7) interference with ammonification in soil,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(8) adverse\neffect on mycorrhizal symbioses in plants and nodulation in legumes, and&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">(9)\nalterations in the rhizosphere microflora, both quantitatively and\nqualitatively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Persistence of\npesticides in soil: How long an insecticide, fungicide, or herbicide persists\nin soil is of great importance in relation to pest management and environmental\npollution.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Persistence of pesticides in soil for longer period is undesirable\nbecause of the reasons:&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a) accumulation of the chemicals in soil to highly\ntoxic levels,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b) may be assimilated by the plants and get accumulated in edible\nplant products,&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">c) accumulation in the edible portions of the root crops,</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;d) to\nbe get eroded with soil particles and may enter into the water streams, and\nfinally leading to the soil, water and air pollutions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The effective\npersistence of pesticides in soil varies from a week to several years depending\nupon structure and properties of the constituents in the pesticide and\navailability of moisture in soil.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For instance, the highly toxic phosphates do\nnot persist for more than three months while chlorinated hydrocarbon\ninsecticides (eg. DOT, aldrin, chlordane etc) are known to persist at least for\n5 years and some times more than 15 years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">From the agricultural\npoint of view, longer persistence of pesticides leading to accumulation of\nresidues in soil may result into the increased absorption of such toxic\nchemicals by plants to the level at which the consumption of plant products may\nprove deleterious / hazardous to human beings as well as livestock's.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is\na chronic problem of agricultural chemicals, having entered in food chain at\nhighly inadmissible levels in India&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For example, intensive use of DDT to\ncontrol insect pests and mercurial fungicides to control diseases in\nagriculture had been known to persist for longer period and thereby got\naccumulated in the food chain leading to food contamination and health hazards.\nTherefore, DDT and mercurial fungicides has been, banned to use in agriculture\nas well as in public health department.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Biodegradation of\nPesticides in Soil: Pesticides reaching to the soil are acted upon by several\nphysical, chemical, and biological forces. However, physical and chemical\nforces are acting upon/degrading the pesticides to some extent, microorganism\u2019s\nplays major role in the degradation of pesticides.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many soil microorganisms\nhave the ability to act upon pesticides and convert them into simpler non-toxic\ncompounds. This process of degradation of pesticides and conversion into non-toxic\ncompounds by microorganisms is known as \u201cbiodegradation\u201d.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Not all pesticides\nreaching to the soil are biodegradable and such chemicals that show complete\nresistance to biodegradation are called \u201crecalcitrant\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The chemical reactions\nleading to biodegradation of pesticides fall into several broad categories\nwhich are discussed in brief below---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a) Detoxification:\nConversion of the pesticide molecule to a non-toxic compound. Detoxification is\nnot synonymous with degradation. Since a single chance in the side chain of a\ncomplex molecule may render the chemical non-toxic. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b) Degradation: The\nbreaking down / transformation of a complex substrate into simpler products\nleading finally to mineralization. Degradation is often considered to be\nsynonymous with mineralization, e.g. Thirum (fungicide) is degraded by a strain\nof Pseudomonas and the degradation products are dimethlamine, proteins,\nsulpholipaids, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">C. Conjugation (complex\nformation or addition reaction): In which an organism make the substrate more\ncomplex or combines the pesticide with cell metabolites. Conjugation or the\nformation of addition product is accomplished by those organisms catalyzing the\nreaction of addition of an amino acid, organic acid or methyl crown to the substrate,\nfor e.g., in the microbial metabolism of sodium dimethly dithiocarbamate, the\norganism combines the fungicide with an amino acid molecule normally present in\nthe cell and thereby inactivate the pesticides/chemical. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">d) Activation: It is\nthe conversion of non-toxic substrate into a toxic molecule, for eg. Herbicide,\n4-butyric acid (2, 4-D B) and the insecticide Phorate are transformed and\nactivated microbiologically in soil to give metabolites that are toxic to weeds\nand insects. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">e) Changing the\nspectrum of toxicity: Some fungicides/pesticides are designed to control one\nparticular group of organisms / pests, but they are metabolized to yield\nproducts inhibitory to entirely dissimilar groups of organisms, for e.g. the\nfungicide PCNB fungicide is converted in soil to chlorinated benzoic acids that\nkill plants.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Biodegradation of\npesticides / herbicides is greatly influenced by the soil factors like\nmoisture, temperature, PH and organic matter content, in addition to microbial\npopulation and pesticide solubility. Optimum temperature, moisture and organic\nmatter in soil provide congenial environment for the break down or retention of\nany pesticide added in the soil. Most of the organic pesticides degrade within\na short period (3-6 months) under tropical conditions. Metabolic activities of\nbacteria, fungi and actinomycetes have the significant role in the degradation\nof pesticides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. Criteria for\nBioremediation / Biodegradation: For successful biodegradation of pesticide in\nsoil, following aspects must be taken into consideration. i) Organisms must\nhave necessary catabolic activity required for degradation of contaminant at\nfast rate to bring down the concentration of contaminant, ii) the target\ncontaminant must be bioavailability, iii) soil conditions must be congenial for\nmicrobial /plant growth and enzymatic activity and iv) cost of bioremediation\nmust be less than other technologies of removal of contaminants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For every naturally\noccurring organic compound in holy topsoil ( like in India ) there is a microbe / enzyme system capable its\ndegradation. India has been fooled into using artificial fertilisers and pesticides , which are not required for our topsoil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; color: red; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\"><b>EVERY FAMINE IN INDIA DURING THE WHITE MANs RULE WAS DELIBERATE .</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/09/amartya-sen-gets-nobel-prize-for.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/09/amartya-sen-gets-nobel-prize-for.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/indentured-coolie-slavery-reinvented.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Strategies for\nBioremediation: For the successful biodegradation / bioremediation of a given\ncontaminant following strategies are needed.------<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a) Passive/ intrinsic\nBioremediation: It is the natural bioremediation of contaminant by tile\nindigenous microorganisms and the rate of degradation is very slow. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">b) Biostimulation:\nPractice of addition of nitrogen and phosphorus to stimulate indigenous\nmicroorganisms in soil. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">c) Bioventing:\nProcess/way of Biostimulation by which gases stimulants like oxygen and methane\nare added or forced into soil to stimulate microbial activity. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">d) Bioaugmentation: It\nis the inoculation/introduction of microorganisms in the contaminated site/soil\nto facilitate biodegradation. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">e) Composting: Piles of\ncontaminated soils are constructed and treated with aerobic thermophilic\nmicroorganisms to degrade contaminants. Periodic physical mixing and moistening\nof piles are done to promote microbial activity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">f) Phytoremediation:\nCan be achieved directly by planting plants which hyperaccumulate heavy metals\nor indirectly by plants stimulating microorganisms in the rhizosphere. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">g)\nBioremediation:Process of detoxification of toxic/unwanted chemicals /\ncontaminants in the soil and other environment by using microorganisms. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">h) Mineralization:\nComplete conversion of an organic contaminant to its inorganic constituent by a\nspecies or group of microorganisms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nature is a giant\nbiological recycling machine. A critically important part of that machine is\nsoil. But what exactly is soil?&nbsp; The\ncritters responsible for making the living system that we call soil. Without\nthese organisms, you have dead dirt, not soil. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil is a living system\ncomprised of trillions of macro and microorganisms that works synergistically\nwith plants to create a self-improving system.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The DESH DROHI GREEN\nREVOLUTION gave out the false propaganda that soil is a sterile, inert\nsubstance that requires increasing quantities of annual fertilizer and\npesticide applications in order to grow a food plant. &nbsp;This may be true for some other CHOOT nations \u2013but NOT\nIndia<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">The emphasis was on\nQUANTITY in both desh drohi revolutions\u2014 the WHITE and the GREEN.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\">These bastards did NOT\nknow that when quantity increase quality decreases</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">And the only metric of\nimport is yield: how much edible plant material can be extracted from a piece\nof dirt, while socializing the costs of the negative externalities.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This approach is\ncomparable to viewing systemic human health as measurable only by an\nindividual\u2019s muscle mass.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-ilBsx0Ndlvk/WRijRuBOSPI/AAAAAAABTUw/18LLocSieTkCs1b3dhvS22U4s2AX0NJ7gCLcB/s1600/female-bodybuileder-women-steroid.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Under this paradigm, the person who takes anabolic\nsteroids is the one who is deemed \u201chealthiest\u201d by the people who created the\ntest.</span><o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZRWmbSrVNow/WRii8W9CiMI/AAAAAAABTUs/WroKDZYoknI1iKmkukEOFZN0LdfGaGjMgCLcB/s1600/Photos-ddbodybuilder-Natural-female-bodybuilding-bodybuilders-steroids-Bodybuilding-Fitness-Your-Guide-to-Building-Muscle-Supplements-Bodybuilder-Photos-youm-misr-17.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-ZRWmbSrVNow/WRii8W9CiMI/AAAAAAABTUs/WroKDZYoknI1iKmkukEOFZN0LdfGaGjMgCLcB/s640/Photos-ddbodybuilder-Natural-female-bodybuilding-bodybuilders-steroids-Bodybuilding-Fitness-Your-Guide-to-Building-Muscle-Supplements-Bodybuilder-Photos-youm-misr-17.jpg\" width=\"404\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as the person\ntaking steroids will surely encounter long-term health problems, so too are our\nsoils increasingly experiencing systemic problems due to the continued belief\nin this paradigm.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here\u2019s why: &nbsp;&nbsp;plants need virtually every element on the\nperiodic table to grow, not just N-P-K. Interestingly, every soil type in the\nworld contains everything a plant needs to grow (including nitrogen), which is\nwhy plants grow in and on every type of soil in the world without humans\ntending to them.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;In India we have excelled in growing food for millions\nof &nbsp;years . We were vegetarians even\nthough we had meat and fish in plenty We taught the rest of the planet\nagriculture <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It\u2019s the systems of\nbiological lifeforms in the soil that make nutrients available to the plants:\nfungi, bacteria, nematodes, arthropods, etc.. The plants, in turn, make life\npossible for those microbial organisms by feeding them carbohydrates made via\nphotosynthesis and providing ideal habitat in their rhizospheres.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">What happens to the\ncarbon (C) in the earth\u2019s soils when we continuously add synthetic nitrogen (N)\nto it? &nbsp;&nbsp;Kiss your existing carbon and\nsoil nutrients goodbye.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Putting synthetic\nnitrogen fertilizer into your soil is like trying to become healthy by taking\nanabolic steroids. It\u2019s short-term, reductionist thinking that\u2019s unmoored from\nsound, modern, systems-oriented soil science.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/08/body-building-supplements-and-their.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/08/body-building-supplements-and-their.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic nitrogen\nfertilizer use rapidly depleting soil\u2019s carbon sequestration abilities (e.g.\nrather than storing carbon, carbon stores are released into the atmosphere as\nCO2)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Intensive use of N\nfertilizers in modern agriculture is motivated by the economic value of high\ngrain yields .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Long-term use of\nsynthetic nitrogen fertilizer &nbsp;increasingly\ndepleting the soil\u2019s nitrogen storage capacities, and therefore making\ncontinued crop production on those soils impossible<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic nitrogen\nfertilizer is rapidly depleting the world\u2019s soil fertility, burning out its\ncarbon stores, and causing an increase in fertilizer use in order to continue\ngetting a yield from the same land.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is why, in the\npast forty years, nitrogen fertilizer efficiency (the rate at which plants are\nable to use the nitrogen fertilizer applied on fields) has decreased by\ntwo-thirds while nitrogen fertilizer use per hectare of land has increased\nsevenfold.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: large; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">Below: I have been up the Mississippi river so many times.&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; line-height: 150%;\">There is a &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;\">6,500 square mile \u201cdead\nzone\u201d where the Mississippi River empties into the Gulf of Mexico--- thanks to artificial fertilizer&nbsp;run off --</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; , serif;\">-- &nbsp;and in India BULL DOG TV anchor Faye DSouza baby is crying about piss fart BELLANDUR LAKE&nbsp;</span></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif;
