font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">GANESHAs MOTHER PARVATI\n( SHAKTI ) RISES UP FROM MOOLADARA CHAKRA TO MEET HER HUSBAND SHIVA AT\nSAHASRARA CHAKRA ONLY IF HER SON OPENS THE DOORWAY<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lord Ganesha is\nmentioned in the Rig Veda (2.23.1) written in 5000 BC, as the Lord of Mantras\nand seer among seers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When I shifted to my\nnew home , my wife got the Ganapathi Homam done. I remember staying overnight.\nThe pujari came couple of hours before dawn and started his homam. Ganesha is\nalso called Vighnesha, the lord who removes obstacles.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ganesha is the son of\nLord Shiva and his wife Parvati. As per lore Parvati removed anointed paste\nfrom here body during a bath, and gave it life. Then she showed off her\nhandsome new baby to the other gods. Unfortunately, the god Shani (Saturn), who\nis said to have the evil eye, looked at him, causing the baby's head to be\nburned to ashes.The god Vishnu came to the rescue and replaced the missing head\nwith that of an elephant.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">All Ganesha statues\nkept at HOME, must show a broken tusk on the left side of Ganesha and the truck\ntowards that side.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The white invader lied\n--that ganesha used the broken tusk was used by him to write the epic,\nMahabharata.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The lore is that\nGanesha in anger threw the left tusk at the naughty moon.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is an allegory for\nkeeping the distance between earth and moon is 108 times the diameter of the\nmoon..and the tilt of the earth on its axis at the MACRO scale<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/108-numerical-equivalent-of-hindu-king.html</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHY DOES GANESHAs\nMOTHER SHAKI NEED TO RISE TO MEET HER HUSBAND SHIVA?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">IT IS ABOUT CREATION ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">ZAKIR HUSSIAN DOES NOT\nHAVE TE BRAINS NOR THE CHARACTER TO UNDERSTAND THIS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">4000 years ago Adi\nShankaracharya wrote \u2013<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shivah Shakthyaa Yuktho\nYadi Bhavathi Shakthaha Prabhavithum<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Na Chedevam Devo Na\nKhalu Kushalaha Sphandithumapi<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Translation Verse No 1\n: Shiva becomes capable of creating the Universe, only when united with Shakthi\n, but otherwise , He is incapable of even a stir.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Tantric\ncosmology, the whole universe is perceived as being created, penetrated and\nsustained by two fundamental forces, which are permanently in a perfect,\nindestructible UNION. These forces or universal aspects are called Shiva and\nShakti. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha (SHIVA ) is the\nembodiment of pure consciousness, and Pragati ( SHAKTI ) as the embodiment of\npure energy. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both Shiva and Shakti\nare Consciousness---- Shiva is the changeless static aspect of Consciousness,\nand Shakti is the kinetic, active aspect of the same Consciousness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through uniting with\nPurusha , Pragati gave form to his spirit and created the universe.(we are\ntalking about CREATION OF THE COSMOS here- not street side sex as figured out\nby small minds)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">When the insentient\nPrakriti comes in contact with the sentient Purusha , the universe evolves. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Purusha symbolizes\nconsciousness, the masculine principle. Pragati symbolizes the feminine\nprinciple, the activating energy<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The cosmos in all its\nmanifestations, as an act of love. The relationship between say- Shakti and\nShiva is the dance of consciousness and energy <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">CONTINUED TO 2-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">CONTINUED FROM 1-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">The eternal and\nindestructible union between Shiva and Shakti gives birth to the whole\nMacrocosm, in its stable, static aspect as well as in its dynamic one. Not only\nis Shakti responsible for creation, it is also the agent of all change<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Shakti is manifested by\nShiva only during creation and is withdrawn into himself at the end of\ncreation. This is for the perceptive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">Modern science repeats\nfrom our Vedas that matter and energy are interchangeable. So does\nconsciousness and energy . In the highest planes they are interchangeable,\nwhich is why we see a great incongruence between our spiritual experiences and\nthe external reality. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the higher\nmetaphysical realms and subtle planes of our consciousness the physical laws of\nour universe lose their validity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">CHECK OUT THE IDIOT\nNAMED ZAKIR NAIK-- SEE HOW HE DENIGRATES GOD GANESHA .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">BADAN KA MAIL -- ZAKIR\nNAIK REFERS TO MENSES BLOOD <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TLnehHUBSdI</span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">NO MUSLIM TALKS LIKE\nTHIS --<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; THE BLACK STONE IS AT SE CORNER OF KAABA\n, 5 FEET ABOVE THE GROUND <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">JUST SHOWS WHAT THIS\nPLANETs CLIMATE SCIENTISTS ARE WORTH..<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">DINOUSAURS DISAPPEARED IN ANCIENT TIMES DUE\nTO A METHANE TIME BOMB<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">ALL PARIS COP21 PUSHING JEWS WHO WANT TO PUSH\nKOSHER CARBON TAX , WANT TO HIDE THE DAMAGE TO ARCTIC ICE.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">THIS IS CAUSED BY US FRACKING FISSURES SPEWING\nMETHANE UNDERWATER \u2014 WHICH HAS CAUSED <span style=\"color: red;\"><b>GULF STREAM WARMING </b></span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2m51kJrz61k/WRW4iTSCU4I/AAAAAAABTNw/vdKn5rtS__4gejuChAW5kLtvZZCPQ9lXwCLcB/s1600/fe611f_4d14368dWWWdd1b48d2936d6b6a7d992bdc-mv2_d_2191_1257_s_2.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">ROTHSCHILD , BILDERBERG CLUB AND THEIR KOSHER\nAGENTS ARE NOW WORRIED THAT DONALD TRUMP WILL TEAR UP PARIS COP21 \u2026 &nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">MAN MADE CO2 HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH GLOBAL\nWARMING.&nbsp; \u2026 <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">CAUSING THIS MAN MADE CO2 SCARE ALLOWS ROTHSCHILD\nAND HIS AGENTS TO MAKE MONEY OUT OF THIN AIR BY CARBON CAP AND TRADE KOSHER BULLSHIT.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Coriolis force keeps pushing warm water\nof the North Atlantic along the Gulf Stream toward the Arctic Ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">On the image on the right, the Gulf Stream\nshows up as the warmer water (orange and yellow) off the coast of North\nAmerica.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9UvKaJgqZnI/WRWy_qqv7PI/AAAAAAABTM8/Ku5aUMfzrcgeDSj3WC-XgqbpwYbete_qACLcB/s1600/6a00d8W341bf7f753ef0133f5a9170a970b-600wi.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-9UvKaJgqZnI/WRWy_qqv7PI/AAAAAAABTM8/Ku5aUMfzrcgeDSj3WC-XgqbpwYbete_qACLcB/s640/6a00d8W341bf7f753ef0133f5a9170a970b-600wi.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Gulf Stream, &nbsp;is a warm and swift Atlantic ocean current\nthat originates in the Gulf of Mexico and stretches to the tip of Florida, and\nfollows the eastern coastlines of the United States and Newfoundland before\ncrossing the Atlantic Ocean.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The Gulf Stream is typically 100 kilometres &nbsp;wide and 1100 metres &nbsp;deep. The current velocity is fastest near the\nsurface, with the maximum speed typically about 2.5 metres per second<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-DUs0YhG5shw/WRW6lXWyEXI/AAAAAAABTOI/IFCY80-GLmoKGemGFGXOqPvGJ8g_cP2JACLcB/s1600/methane_bwwqubbles.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-DUs0YhG5shw/WRW6lXWyEXI/AAAAAAABTOI/IFCY80-GLmoKGemGFGXOqPvGJ8g_cP2JACLcB/s640/methane_bwwqubbles.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">DUE TO FRACKING FRACTURES AND UNDERWATER\nINGRESS OF METHANE THE GULF STREAM IS WARMER THAN WHAT IT WAS SINCE MAN CAME ON\nPLANET EARTH<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: 18.6667px;\">Below: MAD JEWS have destroyed the ancient pristine land of Red Indians&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CpHjWdkmf8U/WRW6JXD_pQI/AAAAAAABTOE/EnJXKVIEHTc8dZQKsI3jVdlC4SCvhftHQCLcB/s1600/_77W141451_skarke.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"410\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-CpHjWdkmf8U/WRW6JXD_pQI/AAAAAAABTOE/EnJXKVIEHTc8dZQKsI3jVdlC4SCvhftHQCLcB/s640/_77W141451_skarke.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Thus, as oceans keep warming, warmer water\nwill reach the Arctic Ocean, melting the sea ice from below.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Meanwhile, the sun will warm up the sea ice\nfrom above. The sea ice acts as a barrier, insulating the water of the Arctic\nOcean from the heat from above. As long as there is sea ice, water just\nunderneath the sea ice will stay close to freezing point.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2bkRf5nkeOk/WRW7PU0fQcI/AAAAAAABTOQ/UpI3I3AetYczPVLQV90R01k_0AF5pOQkACLcB/s1600/FwwIGURE-6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"511\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-2bkRf5nkeOk/WRW7PU0fQcI/AAAAAAABTOQ/UpI3I3AetYczPVLQV90R01k_0AF5pOQkACLcB/s640/FwwIGURE-6.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Sea ice reflects most sunlight back into\nspace, but in the absence of sea ice, most sunlight will instead be absorbed by\noceans.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xaxqyUVoPGg/WRW74ZGnJiI/AAAAAAABTOY/AuUyvKpSx0IPXMn8MvoDguN4HU0g6Z-8QCLcB/s1600/Thermohaline_Circwulation-450x283.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"402\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-xaxqyUVoPGg/WRW74ZGnJiI/AAAAAAABTOY/AuUyvKpSx0IPXMn8MvoDguN4HU0g6Z-8QCLcB/s640/Thermohaline_Circwulation-450x283.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">For almost a year now, global sea ice extent has\nbeen way below what it used to be, meaning that huge amounts of sunlight that\nwere previously reflected back into space, are now instead getting absorbed by\nEarth<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">I had predicted 17 months ago that Arctic ice\nwould be the lowest from Oct 2016 onwards.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">When looking at albedo changes, sea ice area\nis an even more critical measure than sea ice extent. Albedo is the fraction of\nsolar energy (shortwave radiation) reflected from the Earth back into space.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">It\nis a measure of the reflectivity of the earth's surface. Ice, especially with snow\non top of it, has a high albedo: most sunlight hitting the surface bounces back\ntowards space.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">As the sea ice gets thinner, it becomes more\nfragile. Furthermore, changes to the Jet Stream can fuel strong winds and\nwaves, which are also more likely to hit the ice as the size of the open water\nincreases.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt;\">&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">WE ASK DONALD TRUMP TO BLOW THE LID OFF THE\nPANDORAs BOX.. &nbsp; &nbsp;EXPOSE US FRACKING\nDAMAGES TO ARCTIC ICE AND TO US GROUNDWATER..</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/arctic-ice-melt-and-methane-time-bomb.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/12/arctic-ice-melt-and-methane-time-bomb.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/06/methane-time-bomb-arctic-ice-meltdown.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/04/most-potent-greenhouse-gases-nitrous.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">WE ASK MODI TO EXPOSE THE ROLE ON NITROUS\nOXIDE &nbsp;( BEEF LOBBY/ GM FERTILISERS /\nNITRO EXPLOSIVES ) AND METHANE ( BEEF LOBBY ) IN GLOBAL WARMING<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">INDIAs MONSOON ARE GETTING AFFECTED.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The ocean is not a still body of water. There\nis constant motion in the ocean in the form of a global ocean conveyor belt. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">This motion is caused by a combination of thermohaline currents (thermo =\ntemperature; haline = salinity) in the deep ocean and wind-driven currents on\nthe surface.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-TNnhkVcr0nU/WRWz3BYgudI/AAAAAAABTNI/njM7uKGS8IITN60V9dxOnmOPVicP0IBoQCLcB/s1600/gRulf-stream-schematic-w.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-TNnhkVcr0nU/WRWz3BYgudI/AAAAAAABTNI/njM7uKGS8IITN60V9dxOnmOPVicP0IBoQCLcB/s400/gRulf-stream-schematic-w.jpg\" width=\"392\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Cold, salty water is dense and sinks to the bottom of the ocean\nwhile warm water is less dense and remains on the surface. &nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The gulf stream is\nwarm .<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-22M9vJjBSUU/WRWzmjUM-LI/AAAAAAABTNE/cWESm13zHfgsMyR2iNjMXELXTP0SwsRVwCLcB/s1600/AtlantEic_conveyor.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"276\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-22M9vJjBSUU/WRWzmjUM-LI/AAAAAAABTNE/cWESm13zHfgsMyR2iNjMXELXTP0SwsRVwCLcB/s400/AtlantEic_conveyor.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">The ocean conveyor gets its \u201cstart\u201d in the\nNorwegian Sea, where warm water from the Gulf Stream heats the atmosphere in\nthe cold northern latitudes. This loss of heat to the atmosphere makes the\nwater cooler and denser, causing it to sink to the bottom of the ocean. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">As more warm water is transported north, the\ncooler water sinks and moves south to make room for the incoming warm water.\nThis cold bottom water flows south of the equator all the way down to\nAntarctica.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">Eventually, the cold bottom waters returm to the surface through\nmixing and wind-driven upwelling, continuing the conveyor belt that encircles\nthe globe.</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/UuGrBhK2c7U/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/UuGrBhK2c7U?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">BILDERBERG CLUB WANTS TO HIDE US FRACKING\nFISSURES WHICH SPEW METHANE UNDERGROUND AND UNDERWATER ( SEA ).&nbsp;&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">Capt ajit vadakayil<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white;\">..</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b>WHY DOES AN INDIAN BLOGGER NEED TO WRITE ALL THIS. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan;\"><b>I HAVE BEEN FIGHTING A LONE BATTLE FOR MANY YEARS , WITH ZERO SUPPORT FROM ANY SCIENTIST WORLDWIDE</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: blue;\">Below: &nbsp;Here is a song for these scientist CUNTS to dance . The pathetic Indian ice station scientists ( Hemadri ) a Arctic can also join in</span></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/cQDhCJGOtG4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/cQDhCJGOtG4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater comes from\nthe percolation of precipitation and other surface waters down through Earth's\nsoil and rock, accumulating in aquifers - cavities and layers of porous rock,\ngravel, sand or clay.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In some subterranean reservoirs, the water may be\nthousands to millions of years old; in others, water levels decline and rise\nagain naturally each year.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is caused by rain and flowing rivers .In India\nwe has killed our rivers by making dams upstream.&nbsp; The ancient paths of river water into distant\naquifers-- far away from river banks --are now blocked forever<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater levels do\nnot respond to changes in weather as rapidly as lakes, streams and rivers do.\nSo when groundwater is pumped for irrigation or other uses, restoration of\noriginal levels can take months or years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater mining -\nthat is when withdrawals exceed replenishment rates - is a rapidly growing\nproblem in many of the world's large aquifers.&nbsp;\nSince groundwater provides nearly 80 percent of the water required for\nirrigated agriculture, diminishing groundwater reserves pose a serious threat\nto global food security.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soils can process and\nhold considerable amount of water. They can take in water, and will keep doing\nso until they are full, or until the rate at which they can transmit water into\nand through the pores is exceeded.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some of this water will steadily drain\nthrough the soil (via gravity) and end up in the waterways and streams, but\nmuch of it will be retained, despite the influence of gravity. Much of this\nretained water can be used by plants and other organisms, thus contributing to\nland productivity and soil health.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">TRANSPIRATION FROM\nUSELESS TREES ( like the ones planted by ISHA foundation of Sadguru Jaggi\nVasudev ) CAUSES GROUNDWATER LOSS . &nbsp;GROUNDWATER\nCANNOT EVAPORATE<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EVAPORATION FROM VAST\nSTATIONARY DAM RESERVOIRS CAUSE SURFACE WATER EVAPORATION LOSS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Evaporation occurs when\nwater changes from a liquid state to a gaseous state. It can happen anywhere\nthere is SURFACE water<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ground water loss -when\nit occurs in plants, water is lost through microscopic pores in the plant\u2019s\nleaves (stomata)--is called transpiration. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Transpiration differs\nfrom evaporation not only because it occurs in trees, but also because GOOD trees\nhave some control over how much water they lose. GOOD trees can actively open\nand close their stomata, limiting how much water the plant will lose. Such\ntrees when it gives edible food are priceless.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At night time, there is\nno solar radiation, so there is a lot less energy for driving evaporation or\ntranspiration.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Transpiration is the\nprocess of water movement through a plant and its evaporation from aerial\nparts, such as leaves, stems and flowers. Water is necessary for plants but\nonly a small amount of water taken up by the roots is used for growth and\nmetabolism. The remaining 97\u201399.5% is lost by transpiration and guttation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guttation is the\nexudation of drops of xylem sap on the tips or edges of leaves of some vascular\nplants, such as grasses.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Guttation is not to be confused with dew, which\ncondenses from the atmosphere onto the plant surface. At night, transpiration\nusually does not occur because most plants have their stomata closed.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When\nthere is a high soil moisture level, water will enter plant roots, because the\nwater potential of the roots is lower than in the soil solution.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The water will\naccumulate in the plant, creating a slight root pressure. The root pressure\nforces some water to exude through special leaf tip or edge structures,\nhydathodes or water glands, forming drops.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Root pressure provides the impetus\nfor this flow, rather than transpirational pull. Guttation is most noticeable\nwhen transpiration is suppressed and the relative humidity is high, such as\nduring the night.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-size: large;\"><b>PESTICIDES USED BY\nGREEN REVOLUTION AND GM CROPS CAUSE BEES/ BUTTERFLIES/ POLLINATING INSECTS &nbsp;TO DIE WHEN THEY CONSUME GUTTATION DROPS </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b>THIS TRUTH IS KEPT AS A\nGREAT SECRET BY GMO COMPANIES .&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b></span>\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\">Below: &nbsp;HEY GM PUSHING BASTARDS -- SEE A BEE DEATH- YOU KOSHER CUNTS&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/3-XCktPpO0k/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/3-XCktPpO0k?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">Plants transpire water at different rates.\nSome plants which grow in arid regions, such as cacti and succulents, conserve\nprecious water by transpiring less water than other plants.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">QUOTE:&nbsp;\nProject Green Hands (PGH) is a grassroots ecological initiative\nestablished by Isha Foundation in the state of Tamil Nadu, India. The stated\nmission of the project is to plant 114 million trees throughout Tamil Nadu as\nsoon as possible and increase the forest cover in the state to 33\npercent.[2][3] Since its inception, Project Green Hands has organized the\nplanting of 27 million trees by over 2 million people in over 1800 communities\nacross Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.[4][5][6] :UNQUOTE <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_GreenHands\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Project_GreenHands</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-size: large;\">Below: Apun bhi Guinness book world records karenga&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b3J9C7maIog/WRXOsmBl2JI/AAAAAAABTOo/nIeMEDFmdiQhS8QoKq3WluThfV-4NxLggCLcB/s1600/pssgh6.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"342\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-b3J9C7maIog/WRXOsmBl2JI/AAAAAAABTOo/nIeMEDFmdiQhS8QoKq3WluThfV-4NxLggCLcB/s640/pssgh6.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\">Below: Modi gave homosexuality pushing rogue guru Sri Sri Ravishankar , Padma Vibhushan ( India's second highest award ). &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"https://www.thequint.com/india/2016/03/10/art-of-living-wants-to-clean-the-yamuna-with-kitchen-waste\">https://www.thequint.com/india/2016/03/10/art-of-living-wants-to-clean-the-yamuna-with-kitchen-waste</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\"><br /></span><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-size: large;\">This hair / beard dyeing guru was merrily pouring sour vinegar into Yamuna river and calling it ENZYME&nbsp;</span><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/VMr_jfvKQ7A/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/VMr_jfvKQ7A?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pores (the spaces that\nexist between soil particles) provide for the passage and/or retention of\ngasses and moisture within the soil profile. The soil's ability to retain water\nis strongly related to particle size; water molecules hold more tightly to the\nfine particles of a clay soil than to coarser particles of a sandy soil, so\nclays generally retain more water.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Conversely, sands provide easier passage or transmission of water\nthrough the profile. Clay type, organic content, and soil structure also\ninfluence soil water retention.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The maximum amount of\nwater that a given soil can retain is called field capacity, whereas a soil so\ndry that plants cannot liberate the remaining moisture from the soil particles\nis said to be at wilting point. Available water is that which the plants can\nutilize from the soil within the range between field capacity and wilting\npoint.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Roughly speaking for agriculture (top layer soil), soil is 25% water,\n25% air, 45% mineral, 5% other; water varies widely from about 1% to 90% due to\nseveral retention and drainage properties of a given soil.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The process by which\nsoil absorbs water and water drains downwards is called percolation. &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Percolation\nis the slow movement of water through the pores in soil or permeable rock. Infiltration\nand percolation are two related but different processes describing the movement\nof moisture through soil.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">Infiltration is &nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">the downward entry of water into the soil or\nrock surface , while percolation is the flow of water through soil and porous\nor fractured rock. Percolation is a relatively slow process compared to surface\nrunoff</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lvjv_nuEEC8/WRXUTKP6VpI/AAAAAAABTO4/uTOWLlVNVFcmUFmwtOi71OCCavT0CGTQgCLcB/s1600/Percolation%252BWatermm%252Bflows%252Bhorizontally%252Bthrough%252Bthe%252Bsoil%252Band%252Brocks%252Bunder%252Bthe%252Binfluence%252Bof%252Bgravity.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"300\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-lvjv_nuEEC8/WRXUTKP6VpI/AAAAAAABTO4/uTOWLlVNVFcmUFmwtOi71OCCavT0CGTQgCLcB/s400/Percolation%252BWatermm%252Bflows%252Bhorizontally%252Bthrough%252Bthe%252Bsoil%252Band%252Brocks%252Bunder%252Bthe%252Binfluence%252Bof%252Bgravity.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil water retention is\nessential to life. It provides an ongoing supply of water to plants between\nperiods of replenishment (infiltration), so as to allow their continued growth\nand survival<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil moisture has an\neffect on the thermal properties of a soil profile, including conductance and\nheat capacity.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/cC7SPH2KEY4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/cC7SPH2KEY4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The association of soil\nmoisture and soil thermal properties has a significant effect on temperature-related\nbiological triggers, including seed germination, flowering, and faunal\nactivity. (more water causes soil to more slowly gain or lose temperature given\nequal heating; water has roughly double the heat capacity of soil)</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The role of soil in\nretaining water is significant in terms of the hydrological cycle; including\nthe relative ability of soil to hold moisture and changes in soil moisture over\ntime.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/N_pARn50GHo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/N_pARn50GHo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">INDIANS HAVE BEEN LINING OUR LAKES AND PONDS\nWITH CLAY FOR MILLINIUMS\u2026&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\">THE CHOOTIYA WHITE MAN THOUGH GANESH VISARJAN\nIS HEATHEN SAVAGE SUPERSTITION\u2026.. <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></b></span></div>\n<span style=\"color: purple; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">\n\n\n\n</b></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">GANESHA STATUES ARE COMPULSORILY MADE OF BENTONITE\nCLAY\u2026</span></b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-LSe8KZ798Is/WRZIxEztczI/AAAAAAABTPI/gqkrizBZVisRgCIUw4vA092OABNPygyEACLcB/s1600/WWganfdqfesh.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"640\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-LSe8KZ798Is/WRZIxEztczI/AAAAAAABTPI/gqkrizBZVisRgCIUw4vA092OABNPygyEACLcB/s640/WWganfdqfesh.jpg\" width=\"426\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil water that is not\nretained or used by plants may continue downward through the profile and\ncontribute to the water table (the permanently saturated zone at the base of\nthe profile); this is termed \"recharge\". <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil that is at field\ncapacity (among other reasons) may preclude infiltration so to increase\noverland flow. Both effects are associated with ground and surface water\nsupplies, erosion, and salinity.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soil water can affect\nthe structural integrity or coherence of a soil; saturated soils can become\nunstable and result in structural failure and mass movement. Soil water, its\nchanges over time and management are of interest to geo-technicians and soil\nconservationists with an interest in maintaining soil stability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Improving water\nretention in soils begins with understanding the soil type found in the garden.\nSoils are generally made up of varying mixtures of three sizes of soil\nparticles; sand, silt and clay, known as soil texture.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally, water\nretention is inversely related to permeability. Sandy soils have the lowest\nwater retention, followed by silt, and then soils high in clay.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Various soil amendments\nare available that can improve water retention, particularly soil high in sand.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Organic Soil\nAmendments--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sphagnum peat moss\n(please note that Sphagnum peat may not be a sustainably harvested amendment)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Compost<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Coir dust (a byproduct\nof coconut harvest)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aged manure (may have\nhigh salt content)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other organic materials\nsuch as grass clippings and straw<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Inorganic\nAmendments:---</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vermiculite (expensive\nand breaks down quickly, better for container gardening)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Perlite (excellent for\ncontainer gardening)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These are some of the\ncommon and more readily available soil amendments for improving water\nretention. Each has its own unique benefits as well as limitations.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On a calm day the air\nclose to the surface of the water in a storage becomes saturated with water\nvapour.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; So long as the layer of\nsaturated air stays put, there will be little further evaporation, but if there\nis a wind the saturated air layer will be continually mixing with dry air and\nevaporation will continue.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Evaporation can be\nreduced by either providing some sort of a barrier between the water and the\nair or by somehow slowing the movement of the air near the water surface.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wells are tested to\ndetermine the amount of water moving through the aquifer, the volume of water\nthat can enter a well, and the effects of pumping on water levels in the area.\nChemical analysis of water from wells provides information on quality of water\nin the aquifer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater is simply\nthe subsurface water that fully saturates pores or cracks in soils and rocks.\nAquifers are replenished by the seepage of precipitation that falls on the\nland, although they can be artificially replenished by people, also.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are\nmany geologic, meteorologic, topographic, and human factors that determine the\nextent and rate to which aquifers are refilled <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As per the guidelines\nof the Ground Water Estimation Committee of Government of India, data\npertaining to aquifer geometry (vertical &amp; lateral), rainfall, ground water\nlevels/piezometric heads, canal command area, cropping pattern, surface water\nbodies, aquifer parameters (specific yield / storativity) and ground water\nquality are required for realistic assessment of ground water recharge.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater is a\nvaluable water resource in the province, it is hidden from view, and\nhistorically had a lower profile than surface water. Being \"out of sight,\nout of mind\", coupled with the&nbsp;\nphysical constraints of being underground has long made the resource\ndifficult to manage. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Incidents of\ngroundwater contamination resulting mainly from fertilizers, septic systems,\ngasoline stations, waste disposal, mining, industrial processing, and product storage\nand transportation activities have been recorded<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As water can be\nunderground for a long time, a contaminated resource ( especially by land fill seepage\n)&nbsp; is often unavailable for many years \u2013\nsometimes thousands&nbsp; of years.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">VISIT EVERY\nBURIAL GROUND, CHECK THE SUITABILITY.. &nbsp; &nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">DO NOT ALLOW GRAVEYARD PRION LADEN WATER\nTO SEEP DOWN AND CONTAMINATE AQUIFERS\u2026ESPECIALLY IN LOW LYING AREAS HAVING GOOD\nRAINFALL.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If groundwater\nwithdrawal is greater than its replenishment, then water supplies will be\nreduced. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GROUND WATER RECORDS\nMUST SHOW TRENDS .&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SATELLITE READING\nMUST NOT BE TRUSTED UNLESS IT IS VERIFIED WITH RANDOM PHYSICAL ON THE SPOT\nREADINGS.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquifers are saturated\ngeologic units that are permeable (how easy the geologic unit transmits water)\nand yield water in a usable quantity to a well, spring or stream . There are\ndifferent types of aquifers, depending on the geologic materials in which they\noccur.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Aquifer\nClassification System refers to unconsolidated aquifers (e.g., those comprised\nof sand and gravel) and consolidated \u2013 or bedrock \u2013 aquifers (e.g., those\ncomprised of fractured granite).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquitards are less\npermeable geologic units than aquifers, usually comprised of silt, clay, shale,\nor dense crystalline rocks. They may be permeable enough to transmit\nsignificant quantities of water on a regional scale, but they are incapable of\nyielding a viable water supply to a production well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An aquitard is a zone\nwithin the earth that restricts the flow of groundwater from one aquifer to\nanother. A completely impermeable aquitard is called an aquiclude or aquifuge.\nAquitards comprise layers of either clay or non-porous rock with low hydraulic\nconductivity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is a saturated low\npermeability unit that can restrict the movement of groundwater.&nbsp; It may be able to store groundwater.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/RCu4UWDiiQw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/RCu4UWDiiQw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;;
