font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A saturated but poorly\npermeable bed, formation or group of formations that does not yield water\nfreely to a borehole or spring.&nbsp; However,\nan aquitard may store water and may transmit appreciable water to and from\nadjacent aquifers.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquitards normally slow\ndown the movement of groundwater and contaminants.&nbsp; Aquitards can also store groundwater and\ncontaminants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wx0w-Az5JOY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/wx0w-Az5JOY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquifers are also\ndescribed by their degree of confinement (i.e., whether or not they are capped\nby an aquitard above).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Naturally occurring\nconfinement varies in thickness regionally across an individual aquifer or\nbetween aquifers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The degree of\nconfinement is a factor used to assess an aquifer\u2019s vulnerability to\ncontaminants introduced at the land surface <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unconfined or water\ntable aquifers are those with no overlying confining layer. In general,\nunconfined aquifers are more vulnerable to contamination than confined or\npartially confined aquifers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Confined aquifers are\nthose overlain by a confining layer. The confining layer, which offers a\nprotective \"shield\" from contamination from the land surface, is\ntypically composed of clay, silt and/or till. As a result, confined aquifers\ntend to be less vulnerable to contamination than unconfined aquifers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some water reaching the\nland flows overland into channels and then streams, ultimately discharging into\nthe ocean. Some water infiltrates into the ground and travels as groundwater,\neither discharging directly into the ocean or back to the land surface into\nlakes and streams.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Partially confined\naquifers may be confined over parts of their area and unconfined over others.\nThe unconfined parts are \"windows\" through which contaminants can\nreach the aquifer. Partially confined aquifers may also be confined by\nsemi-pervious sediments that do not completely shield the aquifer from\ncontamination from the land surface.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the Aquifer\nClassification System, confinement is assessed on an aquifer-wide basis\nArtesian wells occur when the water level is above the top of the aquifer\n(i.e., the bottom of the confining layer).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the water level is above the\nground surface, water will flow from the well without the aid of pumping. This\nis referred to as a flowing artesian well.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/wx0w-Az5JOY/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/wx0w-Az5JOY?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">All geologic materials\nthat underlie the earth\u2019s surface can be classified as either consolidated or\nunconsolidated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unconsolidated\nmaterials (sediment) are made up of loose granular particles that formed from\ndisintegration of bedrock and then deposited by water, air, gravity or ice.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consolidated materials\n(or bedrock) consist of minerals or particles of different sizes and shapes\nwelded together by chemical reactions induced by heat and pressure. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A bedrock aquifer may\ninclude different rock types or be confined to a localized zone within a single\ngeologic formation. It follows then, that water wells can be constructed in a\nsingle rock type or in several different rock types where the geology is more\ncomplex.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The\n\"productivity\" of different bedrock aquifers is generally determined\nby their fracture porosity and permeability., productivity depends primarily on\nthe existence of a water-bearing fracture zone.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The level of\nvulnerability of an aquifer is qualitative and based on type, thickness and\nextent of geologic sediments overlying the aquifer, depth to water (or depth to\ntop of confined aquifers), and type of aquifer material.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 The shallower the\naquifer and the water table, the higher the vulnerability.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 If there are\nlow-permeability confining layers above an aquifer then the aquifer is\nconsidered less vulnerable to contamination.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 Porosity is an\nimportant criterion in assessing the vulnerability for bedrock aquifers.\nFracture porosity in bedrock aquifers is generally much lower than inter-granular\nporosity in unconsolidated sand and gravel aquifers. This results in the faster\nmovement of water in the bedrock, everything else being equal, which may\nincrease the vulnerability of the bedrock aquifer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seven hydrogeological\nand water use criteria are used to determine an aquifer\u2019s ranking value:--<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">1. the productivity of\nan aquifer;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">2. the vulnerability of\nan aquifer to surface</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">contamination;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">3. aquifer size (in\narea);<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">4. demand for water;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">5. type of water use;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">6. known or documented\nwater quality concerns</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">(i.e., based on risk to\npeople\u2019s health); and</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">7. known or documented\nwater quantity concerns.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Productivity describes\nthe rate of groundwater flow from wells and springs and the abundance of\ngroundwater in an aquifer. Indicators of productivity (e.g., reported well yields,\nspecific capacity of wells, and transmissivity of the aquifer) are used to\ninfer potential water availability of the aquifer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vulnerability is the\npotential for an aquifer to be degraded. The higher the aquifer vulnerability,\nthe greater the potential for degradation and the higher the priority for directing\nprotection and management efforts to that aquifer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">How are the different\nlevels of vulnerability defined?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vulnerability is\nsubjectively determined according to the following criteria:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 nature, thickness and\nextent of geologic materialsoverlying the aquifer;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 depth to the water in\nan unconfined aquifer (ortop of confined aquifers); and<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\u2022 porosity.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Categories of water use\nare non-drinking; drinking (municipal or domestic);and multiple use (both\ndrinking water and other usessuch as commercial, industrial and agricultural).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is accepted that\nsome uses for groundwater maybe more important than other uses. An aquifer that\nis a drinking water source is generally of greater priority for protection than\nan aquifer used for irrigation and stock watering only<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bore water may be\nsuitable for uses including stock watering, irrigation, flushing toilets and\nwashing clothes or cars. It may also be suitable for showering, food\npreparation and drinking.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, bore water can\nbecome contaminated by natural processes and human activities. Testing by an\naccredited laboratory is required to confirm the quality of the water, which\nmay require treatment, depending on the intended use.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just like rivers found\non the earth\u2019s surface, water in aquifers will flow in a particular direction.\nAs it moves through the ground, it will dissolve minerals and may also pick up\nany contamination, such as nutrients, pathogens and pesticides.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water sourced from\ndeeper, confined aquifers is generally of higher quality than water from\nshallow, unconfined aquifers, which are susceptible to contamination\noriginating from animals, pesticides and fertilisers and industrial processes.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\">LAWNS ARE HUGE CULPRITS\nFOR ALLOWING PESTICIDES TO SEEP INTO GROUND WATER .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">WE ASK THE GOVT TO ENSURE LAWNS DO NOT USE\nTOXIC FERTILISERS AND&nbsp; CARCINOGENIC\nPESTICIDES</span><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bore water with a pH of\nless than 5 should be professionally tested to ensure it is safe to use. Bore\nwater may&nbsp; cause staining, due to the\ndissolved salts and metals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bore water can be\nnaturally contaminated by minerals, chemicals, bacteria and viruses. However,\nhuman activity usually has the greatest impact on shallow ground water quality\nas a result of:----<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">excessive or\ninappropriate use of fertilizers, animal manures, pesticides and insecticides<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">poorly maintained\nseptic tanks and other liquid waste disposal systems<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">leaking fuel and\nchemical tanks<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">intensive agriculture,\nindustry or mining<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">leaching from waste\ndisposal areas<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">accidental spills of\nchemicals.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is not always\npossible to tell if your bore water is contaminated. Signs of contamination may\ninclude:---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">unusual taste<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a low pH (acidic water)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">a chemical, sewage,\npetrol or \u2018rotten egg\u2019 smell<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">soap suds/foaming\naround sprinkler outlets<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">abnormal colour or\nsediment<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">dying or wilting plants<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">animals show a\nreluctance to drink.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some contaminants are\nsimply a nuisance as they cause staining, or may have an unpleasant smell or\ntaste.&nbsp; An example of this can be found\nin some metropolitan areas where iron oxide leaches out of the soil causing a\nred brown stain on walls and footpaths.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Other contaminants such\nas nitrate, arsenic, pesticides and petroleum products are of health concern,\nparticularly if bore water is used for drinking, bathing, food preparation or\nwatering of edible plants. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ensure your bore is\ninstalled with a protective cover and is surrounded by a concrete slab, with\nthe wellhead protruding well above the ground. The slab should slope away from\nthe bore, so that surface water does not drain into the casing. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Regularly inspect your\nbore to check for signs of contamination.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">For rural or remote\nlocations, ensure your bore is protected from livestock by perimeter fencing at\na distance of 50 metres away.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Locate the bore at\nleast 30 metres from any wastewater system, such as septic tanks or aerobic\ntreatment units.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Do not use pesticides\nnear your bore.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Prevent wastewater from\nsoaking into the soil near supply bores <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Take a water sample regularly.\nAllow the bore to be pumped for at least 15 minutes before taking readings of\npH and salinity (these can be done with an inexpensive field test meter) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Iron can combine with\noxygen and get trapped in the biofilm and sometimes the biofilm accumulates to\nthe point that it reduces the bore yield.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bores can be\ndecontaminated and/or unclogged by using a range of chemical and physical\nprocesses.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are about 330,000\nborewells in Bangalore, from where about 320 million litres of water are drawn\nevery day. The withdrawal of underground water is 4 times more than the\nrecharge from 900 mm of Bangalore\u2019s annual rainfall.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is the reason why the borewells have\ngone down to depths of 1,100 feet and beyond.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nAs many as 600 lakes in Bangalore Urban district have turned into sewage\ntanks</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When an aquifer\nsupports drinking water use and other uses such as commercial, industrial and\nagricultural, it is given the highest ranking value.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Imagine if all of the\nwater that fell onto the location where you lived in a single year stayed right\nwhere it landed. Everyone would be wading through water probably upto their\nnostrils Fortunately, the precipitation runs into lakes, rivers, oceans, or\ninto underground storage areas called aquifers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most of the void spaces in the\nrocks below the water table are filled with water. Rocks have different\nporosity and permeability characteristics, which means that water does not move\naround the same way in all rocks.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When a water-bearing rock readily transmits\nwater to wells and springs, it is called an aquifer. Aquifers are underground\nreservoirs. Worldwide, 97% of the planet\u2019s liquid fresh water is stored in\naquifers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Major aquifers are tapped on every continent, and groundwater is the\nprimary source of drinking water for most people worldwide. In rural areas,\nwhere centralized water supply systems are undeveloped, groundwater is\ntypically the source of water..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An aquifer is described as a subsurface\ngeologic formation that contains groundwater in sufficient quantities to be\nused, or have the potential to be used, for drinking water supply or for\ncommercial, industrial or agricultural purposes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater is nearly always\nfound when a well is drilled, although in some places there may be a very low\nrate of flow to the well.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; color: blue; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: large;\">Below: &nbsp; Bongs in Calcutta think Hoogly river is full of Himalayan glacier melted water -- BALLS ! &nbsp; Most of it is groundwater seeping into the river from aquifers far away from the river banks.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/living-water-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/01/living-water-capt-ajit-vadakayil.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/water-valley-and-walking-on-water-capt.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/11/water-valley-and-walking-on-water-capt.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/eh_a8XXA2Y4/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/eh_a8XXA2Y4?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes an aquifer\npops out the side of a hill as a spring. You can think of a spring as a newborn\nstream. Not many animals live in its water because it doesn't yet contain\nenough oxygen to support much life<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sometimes the porous\nrock layers become tilted in the earth. There might be a confining layer of\nless porous rock both above and below the porous layer. This is an example of a\nconfined aquifer. In this case, the rocks surrounding the aquifer confines the\npressure in the porous rock and its water.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If a well is drilled into this\n\"pressurized\" aquifer, the internal pressure might (depending on the\nability of the rock to transport water) be enough to push the water up the well\nand up to the surface without the aid of a pump, sometimes completely out of the\nwell. This type of well is called artesian. The pressure of water from an\nartesian well can be quite dramatic.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unconfined aquifers are\ncovered by permeable geologic formations (either solid rock or unconsolidated\nsediments) and the upper surface where the rock formations are fully saturated\nis called the water table. These aquifers are also known as water table\naquifers. They receive recharge directly from the infiltration of rainfall and\nsurface water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/RCu4UWDiiQw/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/RCu4UWDiiQw?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Confined aquifers are\nthose that are covered (confined) by an impermeable or semi-permeable layer of\nrock. Confined aquifers are not directly recharged by vertical infiltration.\nConfined aquifers need to be connected to an unconfined area through which\nrecharge can occur.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The confining impermeable layers rarely form a complete\nbarrier to groundwater. There is generally some transfer or flow of groundwater\nbetween the confined aquifer and the confining layers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ci-ABWPG7LQ/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ci-ABWPG7LQ?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In confined and\nunconfined aquifers there may be considerable amounts of groundwater that are stored\nin impermeable/semi-permeable sediments such as clays. Water from these\nsediments can reach a well if they are in contact with permeable layers that\nare intersected by the well.&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, although clays are not usually thought of as\naquifers, they may be a key part of the storage in an aquifer system.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Perched aquifers occur\nwhere groundwater is perched above unsaturated rock formations as a result of a\ndiscontinuous impermeable layer. Perched aquifers are fairly common in glacial\nsediments. They also occur in other sedimentary formations where weathered\nlayers, ancient soils or caliched (a calcareous layer common in semi-arid\nareas) have created impermeable zones.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The water that reaches\nthese chambers is usually much cleaner than the water of reservoirs at the\nearth's surface. Almost no bacteria live in aquifers. Many pollutants are\nfiltered out as the water passes through the soil on its way to the aquifer. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There is no silty mud\nto cloud the water, no pollution from boaters, and no evaporation of the water\nsupply by the sun. However, aquifers can become polluted due to human actions\nand when an aquifer becomes polluted this is very difficult to remedy.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To tap the groundwater\nin an aquifer, wells are dug until they reach the top layer of the aquifer, the\nwater table. The water table is not flat as its name makes it seem. It has\npeaks and valleys that echo the shape of the land above it. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Further precipitation\nadds water into the porous rock of the aquifer. The rate of recharge is not the\nsame for all aquifers, though, and that must be considered when pumping water\nfrom a well. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pumping too much water\ntoo fast draws down the water in the aquifer and eventually causes a well to\nyield less and less water and even run dry. In fact, pumping your well too fast\ncan even cause your neighbour's well to run dry if you both are pumping from\nthe same aquifer.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">THIS IS WHAT THE GREEDY\nSUGAR BARON MARATHA MANOOS POLITICIANS HAVE DONE , CAUSING FAMER SUICIDES</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water levels in most\naquifers vary with the season and during droughts.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\">AFTER INDIA BUILT DAMS\n( without desilting facilities ) UPSTREAM OF GANGES IN A MINDLESS MANNER&nbsp; ( kickbacks to politicians ) , AQUIFERS DOWN\nTHE RIVER FAR AWAY FROM THE RIVER BANKS HAVE DRIED UP .&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: large;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: large;\">THESE AQUIFERS HAD BEEN FULL&nbsp; SINCE MILLIONS OF YEARS . </span><span style=\"font-size: 12pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It is a debatable point whether an \u201cempty\u201d\naquifer is still an aquifer and there is no scientific agreement about what to\ncall the permanently depleted portions of overdrafted aquifers. For purposes of\nwise groundwater protection policy, we should consider as aquifers, the full\nvertical and horizontal extent of seasonally dewatered or over-pumped rock\nformations..&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When recharge areas and wetlands are replaced by parking lots and\nhighways, less water reaches the aquifer. High levels of chemical-use ( GMO\ncrops )&nbsp; and waste generation in recent\ndecades are slowly poisoning supplies of groundwater \u2013 the major source of our\nfreshwater needs. It is a silent disaster spreading through India <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The relentless\ncontamination of groundwater from artificial fertilisers and GM pesticides will\nmake the supplies of usable water tighter still.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our increasing demand\non water has made it a resource critical to a degree that even gold and oil\nhave never been. Worldwide, irrigation is by far the biggest drain on freshwater:\nit accounts for about 70% of the water drawn from rivers and wells each year.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Since 1950, there has been a dramatic expansion in irrigated agriculture. In\nIndia, the leading country in total irrigated area and the world's third\nlargest grain producer, the number of shallow tubewells used to draw\ngroundwater surged from 3,000 in 1960 to 6 million in 1990.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While India doubled\nthe amount of its land irrigated by surface water between 1950 and 1985, it\nincreased the area watered by aquifers 113-fold. Today, aquifers supply water\nto more than half of India's irrigated land.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Artificial fertilisers of GREEN REVOLUTION have made the soil non-porous ( causing evaporation ) and very thirsty. &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Green revolution by desh drohis ( who received kickbacks ) has decimated India's holy topsoil which gave produce of the divine golden mean inherent . &nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Most of India's nutritious vedic vegetables , fruits and grain are all history &nbsp;Ayurveda used them as preventive medicines. Our priceless pregnant seeds are history. &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>Today we have to buy sterile seeds from white Jews --with revision 1 , revision 2 series .</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b>Our PM Modi branded by APCO of Jew Rothchild is a great darling of Jews -- he wants GM crops in India . &nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: red; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Tc09Zij98UM/WRZRSQqPgDI/AAAAAAABTPc/8_RiXtfSt1w347lTLI_-jxAOa1P-p1zIACLcB/s1600/baRRz4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"600\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-Tc09Zij98UM/WRZRSQqPgDI/AAAAAAABTPc/8_RiXtfSt1w347lTLI_-jxAOa1P-p1zIACLcB/s640/baRRz4.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: x-large;\"><b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b>HULLO PM MODI\u2014&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; line-height: 200%;\"><span style=\"background-color: white; font-size: x-large;\"><b>CAN YOU ASSURE INDIANS THAT\nTHIS VEDIC SEED BANK BELOW ON THE HIMALAYAS IS NOT \u201c<span style=\"color: red;\">STERILE</span>\u201d GM TERMINATOR SEEDS OF WHITE JEWS ? </b></span><span style=\"font-size: 14pt;\"><o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><span style=\"color: blue;\">PM MODI-- &nbsp; WE THE PEOPLE WILL CHECK THESE SEEDS --&nbsp;</span></b></span></span><br />\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mc-A8ZpHxVA/WRZQ1m6FraI/AAAAAAABTPY/WKNuLTfc3v071wPyifba0VOyjZSICZxNQCLcB/s1600/navdRRanya-4.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"426\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-mc-A8ZpHxVA/WRZQ1m6FraI/AAAAAAABTPY/WKNuLTfc3v071wPyifba0VOyjZSICZxNQCLcB/s640/navdRRanya-4.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">FRENCH ROTHSCHILD SHOT TIPU SULTAN ON HIS FACE WHILE HE WAS\nHAVING BREAKFAST.&nbsp; &nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">TIPUs SOLDIERS TRIED TO PUT UP A FIGHT&nbsp; USING THE MASSIVE ARSENAL OF ROCKETS SUPPLIED\nTO HIS BY FRENCH ROTHSCHILD. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">ALL WERE DUDS!</span></span><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/10/tipu-sultan-unmasked-capt-ajit.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2011/10/tipu-sultan-unmasked-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cEbVgs1U5b0/WRZRc-yHJsI/AAAAAAABTPg/l5UdHs_kyrMn4g52mfQDBltP9_VB3-3KwCLcB/s1600/dowRRRnload.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-cEbVgs1U5b0/WRZRc-yHJsI/AAAAAAABTPg/l5UdHs_kyrMn4g52mfQDBltP9_VB3-3KwCLcB/s400/dowRRRnload.jpg\" width=\"326\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_29M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/05/groundwater-resources-of-india-part-3.html?showComment=1494631913100#c3173686272395810051\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 13, 2017 at 5:01 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_29MC\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: blue;\">http://blogs.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/toi-editorials/go-with-gm-permit-genetically-modified-mustard-cultivation/</span><br />\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div style=\"text-align: left;\">\n<span style=\"color: red; font-size: x-large;\"><b>WE KNOW THE BENAMI MEDIA WHO ARE IN THE PAYROLL OF JEW ROTHSCHILD...</b></span></div>\n</div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-q1BjgA3C42E/WRZRyadm-YI/AAAAAAABTPk/Gw77TF62ZmAG_RI1rzQvJDy17SaioHtsACLcB/s1600/0-XFgE-xDhcyBTZJ-KC.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-q1BjgA3C42E/WRZRyadm-YI/AAAAAAABTPk/Gw77TF62ZmAG_RI1rzQvJDy17SaioHtsACLcB/s400/0-XFgE-xDhcyBTZJ-KC.jpg\" width=\"362\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/monsanto-and-farmer-suicides-in-india.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2012/05/monsanto-and-farmer-suicides-in-india.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-iPTLOTIxNJw/WRZSK8mYaXI/AAAAAAABTPo/g9O6D0TT15QrLEgCoW8GQdJFn8B1jjuPgCLcB/s1600/RRimages.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"350\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-iPTLOTIxNJw/WRZSK8mYaXI/AAAAAAABTPo/g9O6D0TT15QrLEgCoW8GQdJFn8B1jjuPgCLcB/s400/RRimages.jpg\" width=\"400\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"></span></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/gm-ir8-rice-high-amylose-content.html\"><span style=\"background-color: lime; font-size: large;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2015/09/gm-ir8-rice-high-amylose-content.html</span></a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GcR7OR5RJUA/WRZS-LphkMI/AAAAAAABTPw/fCI2jlKCAcYlMySOkMCJm0X3V_WEH71IQCLcB/s1600/peru-p44rotects-biodiversity.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"400\" src=\"https://2.bp.blogspot.com/-GcR7OR5RJUA/WRZS-LphkMI/AAAAAAABTPw/fCI2jlKCAcYlMySOkMCJm0X3V_WEH71IQCLcB/s400/peru-p44rotects-biodiversity.png\" width=\"291\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br /></b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b>One the top soil is raped it takes more than 20 years to get it back to a &nbsp;organic humus level. &nbsp;Dam reservoirs must be desilted and the silt transported to worst areas to revive dead soil.</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many major aquifers are being\ndrained faster than their natural rate of recharge.&nbsp; As the competition among factories, farms,\nand household intensifies, it's easy to overlook the extent to which freshwater\nis also required for essential ecological services. It is not just rainfall,\nbut groundwater welling from beneath, that replenished rivers, lakes and\nstreams. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While providing surface\nbodies with enough water to keep them stable, aquifers also help prevent them\nfrom flooding: when it rains heavily, aquifers beneath rivers soak up the\nexcess water, preventing the surface flow from rising too rapidly and\noverflowing onto neighbouring fields and towns. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHEN THIS DOES NOT\nHAPPEN IT MEANS THE AQUIFER BELOW IS DEAD\u2014DUE TO DESH DROHI GREEN REVOLUTION\nAND BUILDING DAMS INDISCRIMINATELY</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In tropical&nbsp; India Asia, where the hot season can last as\nlong as 9 months, and where monsoon rains can be very intense, this dual\nhydrological service is of critical value.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than a third of\nthe planet's people live and work in densely settled cities, which occupy just\n2% of the Earth's land area. With the labour force thus concentrated, factories\nand other centres of employment also group together the same urban areas.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquifers in these areas are beginning to mirror the increasing density and\ndiversity of the human activity above them. The waste streams flowing into the\nwater under the cities contain a witch's brew of toxic and carcinogenic contaminants.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A major factor in such contamination is that in most places people have learned\nto dispose of waste - to remove it from sight and smell - so effectively that\nit is easy to forget that the Earth is a closed ecological system in which\nnothing permanently disappears.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The methods normally used to conceal garbage\nand other waste \u2013 landfills without lining , leaky septic tanks, and sewers --\nbecome the major conduits of chemical pollution of groundwater.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>PM MODI HAS MADE UMA\nBHARATI THE WATER RESOURCES MINISTER .&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>OTHER THAN HER SAFRON ROBES ( VOTE BANK ) I WONDER&nbsp; WHAT HER SPECIAL ABILITIES ARE .&nbsp;&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b>WE ASK MODI, STOP CHOOSING MINISTERS WHO ARE\nUSELESS,&nbsp; DO NOT KNOW THEIR JOBS AND ARE\nNOT SELF STARTERS&nbsp; \u2013&nbsp;</b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: yellow; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b><br /></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><b style=\"background-color: yellow;\">MOST OF MODIs\nMINISTERS HAVE GREAT ABILITY IN GIVING ENDLESS EGO MASSAGE TO THE BIG BOSS&nbsp; .</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ground water\ncontamination is nearly always the result of human activity. In areas where\npopulation density is high and human use of the land is intensive, ground water\nis especially vulnerable.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Virtually any activity whereby chemicals or wastes\nmay be released to the environment, either intentionally or accidentally, has\nthe potential to pollute ground water. When ground water becomes contaminated,\nit is difficult and expensive to clean up.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ground water and surface\nwater are interconnected and can be fully understood and intelligently managed\nonly when that fact is acknowledged.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If there is a water supply well near a\nsource of contamination, that well runs the risk of becoming contaminated. If\nthere is a nearby river or stream, that water body may also become polluted by\nthe ground water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Depending on its\nphysical, chemical, and biological properties, a contaminant that has been\nreleased into the environment may move within an aquifer in the same manner\nthat ground water moves. (Some contaminants, because of their physical or\nchemical properties, do not always follow ground water flow.) <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It is possible to\npredict, to some degree, the transport within an aquifer of those substances\nthat move along with ground water flow. For example, both water and certain\ncontaminants flow in the direction of the topography from recharge areas to\ndischarge areas. Soils that are porous and permeable tend to transmit water and\ncertain types of contaminants with relative ease to an aquifer below.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Just as ground water\ngenerally moves slowly, so do contaminants in ground water. Because of this\nslow movement, contaminants tend to remain concentrated in the form of a\nplume&nbsp; that flows along the same path as\nthe ground water. The size and speed of the plume depend on the amount and type\nof contaminant, its solubility and density, and the velocity of the surrounding\nground water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ground water and\ncontaminants can move rapidly through fractures in rocks. Fractured rock presents\na unique problem in locating and controlling contaminants because the fractures\nare generally randomly spaced and do not follow the contours of the land\nsurface or the hydraulic gradient.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contaminants can also\nmove into the ground water system through macropores\u2014root systems, animal\nburrows, abandoned wells, and other systems of holes and cracks that supply\npathways for contaminants.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In areas surrounding\npumping wells, the potential for contamination increases because water from the\nzone of contribution, a land area larger than the original recharge area, is\ndrawn into the well and the surrounding aquifer. Some drinking water wells\nactually draw water from nearby streams, lakes, or rivers. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Contaminants present in\nthese surface waters can contribute contamination to the ground water system.\nSome wells rely on artificial recharge to increase the amount of water\ninfiltrating an aquifer, often using water from storm runoff, irrigation,\nindustrial processes, or treated sewage. In several cases, this practice has\nresulted in increased&nbsp; oncentrations of\nnitrates, metals, microbes, or synthetic chemicals in the water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Under certain\nconditions, pumping can also cause the ground water (and associated\ncontaminants) from another aquifer to enter the one being pumped. This\nphenomenon is called interaquifer leakage. Thus, properly identifying and\nprotecting the areas affected by well pumping is important to maintain ground\nwater quality.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Generally, the greater\nthe distance between a source of contamination and a ground water source, the\nmore likely that natural processes will reduce the impacts of contamination.\nProcesses such as oxidation, biological degradation (which sometimes renders\ncontaminants less toxic), and adsorption (binding of materials to soil\nparticles) may take place in the soil layers of the&nbsp; unsaturated zone and reduce the concentration\nof a contaminant before it reaches ground water. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even contaminants that\nreach ground water directly, without passing through the unsaturated zone, can\nbecome less concentrated by dilution (mixing) with the ground water. However,\nbecause ground water usually moves slowly, contaminants generally undergo less\ndilution than when in surface water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Contaminants may reach ground water from\nactivities on the land surface, such as releases or spills from stored\nindustrial wastes; from sources below the land surface but above the water\ntable, such as septic systems or leaking underground petroleum storage systems;\nfrom structures beneath the water table, such as wells; or from contaminated\nrecharge water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While nitrate is a\ncommon nitrogenous compound due to natural processes of the nitrogen cycle,\nanthropogenic sources have greatly increased the nitrate concentration,\nparticularly in groundwater. The largest anthropogenic sources are septic\ntanks, application of nitrogen-rich fertilizers to turfgrass, and agricultural\nprocesses.
