text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NrigmUWyvRY/WRbO3jrHzEI/AAAAAAABTRM/erd5EhHXrmkAB5s8Cu7JK1kswPREkqTXQCLcB/s1600/yamuDna_river_001.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"424\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-NrigmUWyvRY/WRbO3jrHzEI/AAAAAAABTRM/erd5EhHXrmkAB5s8Cu7JK1kswPREkqTXQCLcB/s640/yamuDna_river_001.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MqKuKIgdgcc/WRbPJ4_jt3I/AAAAAAABTRQ/p-WCH3J38aUOhO11VHwQVCxKVq2uGvbiQCLcB/s1600/sr-moWWdi_032316085143.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"462\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-MqKuKIgdgcc/WRbPJ4_jt3I/AAAAAAABTRQ/p-WCH3J38aUOhO11VHwQVCxKVq2uGvbiQCLcB/s640/sr-moWWdi_032316085143.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><br /></b>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\">HULLO TRIPLE SRI\u2014 WE KNOW\nTHE pH VALUE OF YOUR BULLSHIT ENZYME</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lakes and streams\nbecome acidic (pH value goes down) when the water itself and its surrounding\nsoil cannot buffer the acid rain enough to neutralize it. As lakes and streams\nbecome more acidic, the numbers and types of fish and other aquatic plants and\nanimals that live in these waters decrease.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"font-size: x-large;\"><b>At pH 5, most fish eggs cannot\nhatch.&nbsp;</b></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">At lower pH levels, most adult fish die. The plants and animals living\nwithin an ecosystem are highly interdependent. For example, fish eat other fish\nand also other plants and animals that live in the lake or stream. If acid rain\ncauses the loss of acid-sensitive plants and animals, then fish that rely on\nthese organisms for food are also be affected.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">WE ASK MODI--&nbsp;</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">WHAT IS THE EXPERTISE OF YOUR PADMA VIBHUSHAN ROGUE GURUS TO DEAL WITH THE ENVIRONMENT IN AN ARBITRARY AND UNILATERAL MANNER &nbsp;?</b><br />\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\"><br /></b>\n<b style=\"background-color: white;\">IS IT GOD GIVEN ?</b><br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://artoflivingsblog.com/miracle-enzymes-yamuna/\">http://artoflivingsblog.com/miracle-enzymes-yamuna/</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fish and aquatic\ninsects can be affected indirectly by increased nitrate concentrations in the\nwater.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Basically, any excess\nnitrate in the water is a source of fertilizer for aquatic plants and\nalgae.&nbsp; In many cases, the amount of\nnitrate in the water is what limits how much plants and algae can grow.&nbsp; If there is an excess level of nitrates,\nplants and algae will grow excessively.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excess plants in a body\nof water can create many problems.&nbsp; An\nexcess in the growth of plants and algae create an unstable amount of dissolved\noxygen.&nbsp; During the day, there will be\nusually be high levels of dissolved oxygen, and at night the levels of oxygen\ncan decrease dramatically.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This will create\nstressful conditions for fish.&nbsp; If they\nare stressed for a significant part of the day, they will not behave normally\nor reproduce.&nbsp; If the conditions persist\nfor a long period of time, the stressed fish species will not spawn .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Excess plants and algae\nwill also create conditions where organic matter accumulates.&nbsp; High densities of algae will create a\ncondition where sunlight cannot reach very far into the water.&nbsp; Since plants and algae require some sunlight,\nplants and algae not receiving sunlight will die off.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These dead plant materials will settle to the\nbottom of the water ( reducing the lake depth ) &nbsp;and bacteria that feed on decaying organic\nmaterial will greatly increase in numbers.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These bacteria will consume oxygen and, therefore, the level of\ndissolved oxygen in this water will fall to levels that are too low for many\naquatic insects and fish to survive.&nbsp;\nAlso, this can cause extreme changes in habitat.&nbsp; Fish that need gravel or sand for spawning\nmay find nothing but mats of vegetation and muck so will be unable to produce\noffspring.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Plants may not be able\nto utilize all of the phosphate fertilizer applied, as a consequence, much of\nit is lost from the land through erosion, since phosphate has a stronger\naffinity to binding with the soil compared to nitrogen.. The phosphate enters\nthe ecosystem and becomes tied up in the biogeochemical system where it is\nrecycled.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The rapid growth of aquatic\nvegetation and/or increase in the algal population can cause the death and\ndecay of vegetation and aquatic life because of the decrease in dissolved\noxygen levels.&nbsp; A large percentage of the\nphosphate in water is precipitated from the water as iron phosphate or stored\nin partially decomposed organic material.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Through a combination of microbiological action and anoxic conditions,\nthe phosphate may be readily recycled back into the water for further reuse\ncausing the mass of phosphate to build-up in the ecosystem.&nbsp; In deeper environments, the phosphate may be\nstored in the sediments and then recycled through the natural process of\nlithophication, uplift, and erosion of rock formations. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Large amounts of\nblue-green algae can literally suffocate organisms by depleting the water of\nlife-sustaining oxygen by causing hypoxic or anoxic conditions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Biotoxins created\nduring algal blooms are taken up by shellfish (mussels, oysters), leading to\nthese human foods acquiring the toxicity and poisoning humans. Some get severe\nallergies cuaisng their epiglottis to slam shut and die .&nbsp; Examples include paralytic, neurotoxic, and\ndiarrhoetic shellfish poisoning.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, farmers\nfrequently apply more nutrients than are taken up by crops or pastures. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The overload of\nnitrogenous fertilizers to the soils actually kills the biota that help to\nprovide nitrogen to the soil, which the crop plants can use.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">By using much\nlower amounts of fertilizers these crops may still be as productive as those\nproduced under heavily fertilized soils, due to the healthier environment for\nthe microbes. If the farmer adds large amounts of fertilizer in the beginning\nthen he is forced to use more and more each year.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Using only moderate to low\namounts at the outset allows the farmer to avoid the entrapment into this vicious\ncycle. Furthermore, many of the aforementioned prevention methods can be\nincorporated to help reduce nitrate leaching from the soil into the\ngroundwater.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While nitrate cannot be\ncompletely removed from groundwater, the use of treatment methods such as ion\nexchange and the adoption of preventative measures, will help to reduce\nnitrates to biologically safe levels.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The disposal of many household\nwastes is not regulated in India even in the year 2017.&nbsp; SWATCH BHARAT is not only about keeping roads\nclean, but more importantly waste and water management<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once in the landfill,\nchemicals can leach into the ground water by means of precipitation and surface\nrunoff. New landfills must be mandated to &nbsp;have clay or synthetic liners and leachate\n(liquid from a landfill containing contaminants) collection systems to protect\nground water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Closed landfills can\ncontinue to pose a ground water contamination threat if they are not capped\nwith an impermeable material (such as clay) before closure to prevent the\nleaching of contaminants by precipitation.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Millions of tons of\nfertilizers and pesticides (e.g.,herbicides, insecticides, rodenticides,\nfungicides, avicides) are used annually for crop production. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A number of these\npesticides and fertilizers (some highly toxic) have entered and contaminated\nground water following normal, registered use. Some pesticides remain in soil\nand water for many years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Drinking water\ncontaining bacteria and viruses can result in illnesses such as hepatitis,\ncholera, or giardiasis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Waterborne diseases can\nbe spread via a groundwater well which is contaminated with fecal pathogens\nfrom pit latrines<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pathogens contained in\nfeces can lead to groundwater pollution when they are given the opportunity to\nreach the groundwater, making it unsafe for drinking.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Of the four pathogen\ntypes that are present in feces (bacteria, viruses, protozoa and helminths or\nhelminth eggs), the first three can be commonly found in polluted groundwater,\nwhereas the relatively large helminth eggs are usually filtered out by the soil\nmatrix.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater that is\ncontaminated with pathogens can lead to fatal fecal-oral transmission of\ndiseases (e.g. cholera, diarrhoea).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most pesticides used by\nGM companies have very complex molecular structures. This complexity determines\nthe water solubility, adsorption capacity, and mobility of pesticides in the\ngroundwater system. Thus, some types of pesticides are more mobile than others\nso they can more easily reach a drinking-water source.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chemicalized soils appear\ncolorless, bleached or salty. The carbon fraction (the humus) gets burned up in\nthe assimilation process of nitrogen. Synthetics can change the pH and tie up\nbeneficial elements, but also can start to cause toxicity levels of other\nelements.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Artificial inducement of one element can cause all kinds of weird\nbonding to occur with other elements. This all translates to the foods which we\neat.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With naturally grown foods, you do not have to worry about pesticides or\nherbicides, but probably the best benefit of organic foods is their nutritional\ncontent. The difference can be dramatic. This includes livestock and poultry\nwhich are fed naturally grown grasses and food. Nutritional content is markedly\ndifferent.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As a culture, we are becoming more and more nutritionally deficient\nand filled with toxic residues as an indirect result of synthetic fertilizers.\nThis stresses the body making it more prone to health problems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In other words,\nsynthetic fertilizers can dramatically diminish the nutritional value of foods.\nSince synthetic fertilizers also diminish the natural disease-fighting and\npest-fighting mechanisms, our foods thus become laden with other chemicals\n(pesticides and herbicides).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, we end up with foods which are lacking in\nviable nutrition and also loaded with residues form other chemicals. This kind\nof activity is not healthy for humans or animals. This consequence is probably\nthe worst of all, especially in light of the fact that more natural methods of\ngrowing plants are easier, more economical, and more viable.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Liquids leach from the\npit and pass the unsaturated soil zone (which is not completely filled with\nwater). Subsequently, these liquids from the pit enter the groundwater where\nthey may lead to groundwater pollution. This is a problem if a nearby water\nwell is used to supply groundwater for drinking water purposes.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">During the\npassage in the soil, pathogens can die off or be adsorbed significantly, mostly\ndepending on the travel time between the pit and the well. &nbsp;Most, but not all pathogens die within 50 days\nof travel through the subsurface.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate can also enter\nthe groundwater via excessive use of fertilizers, including manure spreading.\nThis is because only a fraction of the nitrogen-based fertilizers is converted\nto produce and other plant matter.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The remainder accumulates in the soil or lost\nas run-off.&nbsp;&nbsp; High application rates of\nnitrogen-containing fertilizers combined with the high water-solubility of\nnitrate leads to increased runoff into surface water as well as leaching into\ngroundwater, thereby causing groundwater pollution.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The excessive use of\nnitrogen-containing fertilizers (be they synthetic or natural) is particularly\ndamaging, as much of the nitrogen that is not taken up by plants is transformed\ninto nitrate which is easily leached.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The heavy use of\nnitrogenous fertilizers in cropping systems is the largest contributor to\nanthropogenic nitrogen in groundwater worldwide. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GREEN REVOLUTION has\nscrewed the watan. &nbsp;Yet DESH DROHI\npoliticians who will FUCK their own watan do not care as long as they get\nkosher kickbacks<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater pollution\nis much more difficult to abate than surface pollution because groundwater can\nmove great distances through unseen aquifers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Non-porous aquifers such as clays\npartially purify water of bacteria by simple filtration (adsorption and absorption),\ndilution, and, in some cases, chemical reactions and biological activity;\nhowever, in some cases, the pollutants merely transform to soil contaminants.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater that moves through open fractures and caverns is not filtered and\ncan be transported as easily as surface water.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Most ground water\ntreatment techniques utilize a combination of technologies. Some of the\nbiological treatment techniques include bioaugmentation, bioventing,\nbiosparging, bioslurping, and phytoremediation.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some chemical treatment\ntechniques include ozone and oxygen gas injection, chemical precipitation,\nmembrane separation, ion exchange, carbon absorption, aqueous chemical\noxidation, and surfactant enhanced recovery.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Some chemical techniques may be\nimplemented using nanomaterials. Physical treatment techniques include, but are\nnot limited to, pump and treat, air sparging, and dual phase extraction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/ImtXAHZpkFo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/ImtXAHZpkFo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Biochemical oxygen\ndemand (BOD) and chemical oxygen demand (COD) are two different ways to measure\nhow much oxygen the water will consume when it enters the recipient. In both\ncases the oxygen-consuming substances are mainly of organic origin.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/cGVlKH78uAs/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/cGVlKH78uAs?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These substances should\nbe reduced to a minimum in the wastewater treatment plant. Industries normally\nfocus more on COD and municipalities more on BOD removal.&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/kVadmGSj1Lo/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/kVadmGSj1Lo?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">COD is closely related\nto BOD or Biochemical Oxygen Demand, the difference being that BOD is a test of\nthe level of organic matter that can be biologically oxidised while COD is a\ntest of the amount of organic matter that can be chemically oxidised.&nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/YJ2UiuSHpuU/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/YJ2UiuSHpuU?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The BOD/COD ratio is a\nparameter of great importance for quantification of biodegradability of a\ncontaminated effluent<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-VoJBC7iuqc8/WRbiS96iNLI/AAAAAAABTRg/jnH96QVmWAYGgORZN7ASvDizJLfZeTvIACLcB/s1600/WaEEter%2BQuality.png\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"220\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-VoJBC7iuqc8/WRbiS96iNLI/AAAAAAABTRg/jnH96QVmWAYGgORZN7ASvDizJLfZeTvIACLcB/s640/WaEEter%2BQuality.png\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">With chemical\ntreatment, removal of COD is improved at basically all kinds of wastewater\nplants. The more particle-bound COD, the more efficient the removal rate.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-J1wIFowzJAU/WRbipiffHpI/AAAAAAABTRk/AFsFKTbQLacEmDoRwk_PxEMG8VaIqa4ugCLcB/s1600/waste-waWWter-treatment-4-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://3.bp.blogspot.com/-J1wIFowzJAU/WRbipiffHpI/AAAAAAABTRk/AFsFKTbQLacEmDoRwk_PxEMG8VaIqa4ugCLcB/s640/waste-waWWter-treatment-4-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The higher the BOD/COD\nthe more oxygen stripping capacity the discharged effluent has when discharged\ninto receiving waters (oxygen is used biologically/chemically to break down the\norganic matter) and the more potential for damage to biological life in those\nwaters.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">COD is normally higher\nthan BOD because more organic compounds can be chemically oxidised than\nbiologically oxidised.&nbsp; This includes\nchemicals toxic to biological life, which can make COD tests very useful when\ntesting industrial sewage as they will not be captured by BOD testing.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\n\n</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">COD does have a big\nadvantage over BOD in that the test only takes approximately three hours, as\nopposed to the five days required for BOD testing and it is usually possible\nover a period of time to establish a ratio of BOD:COD, which allows\nextrapolation of the BOD.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-83k7qeXJLAE/WRbi1LjXhAI/AAAAAAABTRo/I7bLSwmNgM0PQdRAFt8RXYdTLWK0b36iACLcB/s1600/water-quality-con444trol-treatment-74-638.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"480\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-83k7qeXJLAE/WRbi1LjXhAI/AAAAAAABTRo/I7bLSwmNgM0PQdRAFt8RXYdTLWK0b36iACLcB/s640/water-quality-con444trol-treatment-74-638.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: cyan; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b>A CHEMICAL TANKER\nCAPTAIN IS AN EXPERT IN WATER AND LIQUID ANAYSIS.. <o:p></o:p></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b style=\"background-color: cyan;\">WE DON\u2019T NEED FAALTHU\nPADMA VIBHUSHAN FROM PM MODI TO ESTABLISH OUR TECHNICAL EXPERTISE</b><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2017/05/groundwater-resources-of-india-part-3.html?showComment=1494685101252#c6298702620191158767\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">May 13, 2017 at 7:48 PM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_64MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\n<span style=\"color: red;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/02/wall-wash-method-chemical-tankers-capt.html</span><br />\n<br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">LAB EXERTS HAVE ASKED ME --</span></b><br />\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\"><br /></span></b>\n<b><span style=\"color: blue;\">WHY NITRIC ACID ?</span></b><br />\n<br />\nI HAVE GIVEN THE ANSWER THERE ITSELF IN THE CHLORIDE TEST<br />\n<br />\nQUOTE: Why Nitric acid ??--- Nitric acid parts the silver vide the assaying process as chemically silver is not active and dissolves only in strong Nitric acid or H2So4.<br />\nThe method of not involving Nitric acid in the Chloride test could pass a ship staff tank WWT , while a shore gas ion chromatograph will fail the sample for Mono Ethylene Glycol fibre grade. Nitric acid decomposes Sodium Cyanide and Sodium Sulphide which otherwise form precipitate with AgNO3 and thus interfere with the lab test. UNQUOTE<br />\n<br />\nWhen you test waste water nitric acid is used-- or lab results will be bullshit<br />\n<br />\nHeavy Metal ions in trace levels may be adsorbed by the glass. Dilute nitric acid is added to prevent the adsorption of metal ions on glass.<br />\n<br />\nNote that if you add lemon juice to your tea, no brown spots will remain on the cup inner surface<br />\n<br />\nWater having turbidity of less than 1 NTU can be alaysed without acid digestion.<br />\n<br />\nHNO3 is preferred because of its oxidizing nature. Adding HNO3 converts metal ions into their nitrate salts, which are highly soluble.<br />\n<br />\nNitric acid prevents the adsorption of metal ions and their precipitation, is antibacterial and keeps a certain degree of oxidizing power by preventing the reduction of the ions to metal.<br />\n<br />\nNitric acid is added to water samples to ensure that metals are dissolved.<br />\n<br />\nIf it is not added, some metals including iron may oxidize, form oxide mineral precipitates, and then not be detected in the chemical analysis of the water.<br />\n<br />\nHNO3 is added to samples to reduce pH to less than 2 . Below pH 2 precipitation , adsorption to container wall and microbial degradation are minimized.<br />\n<br />\ncapt ajit vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n<br /></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: white; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most characteristic\ndetrimental effect of landfill leachate discharge into the environment is\ngroundwater pollution. It is difficult to restore contaminated groundwater resources\ncaused by landfill seepage.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Commonly, the health of\nresidents is poorly affected as low quality water from polluted stretches of\nriver invades the aquifer, leading to high pollution levels of potable water. &nbsp;&nbsp;<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The value of private\nproperties are degraded for thousands of years . Nobody wants to buy property\nover a contaminated aquifer.&nbsp; Though I\nhave explained all this in my blogs several years ago\u2014nothing has been done. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
