font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><b><span style=\"color: red;\">THE GREEN REVOLUTION\nHAS GIVEN MORE PROFITS TO EVIL PHARMA \u2013 AND HAS RAPED THE WATAN. <o:p></o:p></span></b></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THIS BLOGSITE HAS\nWARNED THE MODI GOVT AGAIN AND AGAIN AND AGAIN.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">WHO CARES !<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">MODI IS MORE WORRIED ABOUT\nVOTES ,&nbsp; BY APPEASEMENT POLITICS<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 200%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<iframe allowfullscreen=\"\" class=\"YOUTUBE-iframe-video\" data-thumbnail-src=\"https://i.ytimg.com/vi/O5l8xDfvjtg/0.jpg\" frameborder=\"0\" height=\"266\" src=\"https://www.youtube.com/embed/O5l8xDfvjtg?feature=player_embedded\" width=\"320\"></iframe></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">THE GM FERTILISER AND\nBEEF LOBBY HAS SUPRESSED THIS INFORMATION BEOW.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate is composed of\none atom of nitrogen (N) and three atoms of oxygen (O); the chemical symbol for\nnitrate is NO3. Nitrite (NO2) can be formed from nitrate by a chemical process\ncalled reduction. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrates themselves are\nrelatively inert, until they are turned into nitrites by bacteria in the mouth\nor enzymes in the body.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate does not\nnormally cause health problems unless it is reduced to nitrite \u2013 Nitrites cause\ncancer\u2014especially bladder and thyroid cancer . The sudden spurt in cancer in\nIndia is related to nitrates in drinking water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate: 1 Nitrogen, 3\nOxygens \u2013 Chemical Formula: NO3-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrite: 1 Nitrogen, 2\nOxygens \u2013 Chemical Formula: NO2-<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So\u2026 Nitr-a-tes have 3\noxygen atoms, while Nitr-i-tes have 2 oxygen atoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate can react with\namines or amides in the body to form nitrosamine which is known to cause\ncancer. Nitrate must be converted to nitrite before nitrosamine can be formed. Nitrosamines\nare a well known problem in processed meats<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">90 % of the nitrate\nmost people consume comes from vegetables, but this is unlikely to cause health\nproblems because very little of the nitrate in vegetables is converted to\nnitrite.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When nitrates are in\nyour water, you can\u2019t see them, smell them, or boil them out. And because there\nis no requirement that the government monitor or treat private wells, nitrates\ncan hide there without anyone knowing. Even at low levels, nitrate can kill\ninfants and harm unborn children <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bacterial contamination\nis a double problem: it may be responsible for the reduction of nitrate to\nnitrite; but more importantly, the bacteria themselves can cause illness.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate in drinking\nwater is measured either in terms of the amount of nitrogen present or in terms\nof both nitrogen and oxygen. The federal standard for nitrate in drinking water\nis 10 milligrams per liter (10 mg/l) nitrate-N, or 45 mg/l nitrate-NO3. when\nthe oxygen is measured as well as the nitrogen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unless otherwise specified,\nnitrate levels usually refer only to the amount of nitrogen present, and the\nusual standard, therefore, is 10 mg/l. &nbsp;&nbsp;US EPA drinking water limit of 10 mg/L --in\nIndia it is usually twenty times more<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">INDIANS LIVING AROUND\nDIARY FARMS WITH USELESS HUMPLESS COWS OR LARGE FIELDS USING ARTIFICIAL\nFERTILISER &nbsp;\u2014MUST TEST THEIR WATER AND IF\nIN EXCESS , THEY MUST COMPLAIN TO THE GOVT<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are no simple\nways to remove nitrate from water in the home. Because nitrate does not\nevaporate the way chlorine does, boiling, freezing, or letting water stand does\nnot reduce the nitrate level.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In fact, boiling water for more than 10 minutes\ncan make the nitrate more concentrated. Boiling water in an aluminum pan may\nalso convert nitrate to nitrite.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrate can be removed\nfrom drinking water by three methods: distillation, reverse osmosis, and ion\nexchange.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Reverse-osmosis units &nbsp;remove nitrates and are &nbsp;an option for drinking water and cooking use..\nActivated carbon and other simple filters do not remove nitrates to any\nsignificant degree.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nitrogen is the\nnutrient applied in the largest quantities for lawn and garden care and crop\nproduction.&nbsp; In addition to\nARTIFICIAL&nbsp; fertilizer, nitrogen occurs\nnaturally in the soil in organic forms from decaying plant and animal residues.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In the soil, bacteria convert various forms of nitrogen to nitrate, a\nnitrogen/oxygen ion (NO3-). This is desirable as the majority of the nitrogen\nused by plants is absorbed in the nitrate form.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, nitrate is highly\nleachable and readily moves with water through the soil profile. If there is\nexcessive rainfall or over-irrigation, nitrate will be leached below the\nplant's root zone and may eventually reach groundwater.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If your water contains\nmore than 10 mg/L nitrate-nitrogen, it is advisable to use an alternate source\nof water for infant formula and food.&nbsp;\nTherefore, it is advisable that pregnant women should not drink water\ncontaining more than 10 mg/L NO3-N. It also is recommended that nursing mothers\nuse water that has an NO3-N concentration below 10 mg/L since nitrate may be\npassed to infants in breast milk.&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elevated nitrate in\ndrinking water causes neural tube defects of the brain and spinal cord,\nincluding spina bifida, some oral cleft defects and limb deficiencies.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">NITRITE CROSSES THE\nBLOOD BRAIN BARRIER AND CAN CAUSE SPINA BIFIDA .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/myelomeningocele-spina-bifida-neural.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2016/07/myelomeningocele-spina-bifida-neural.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ion exchange for\nnitrate-nitrogen removal operates on the same principle as a household water\nsoftener. In a standard water softener, calcium and magnesium ions are\nexchanged for sodium ions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, for the nitrate removal process, special\nanion exchange resins are used that exchange chloride ions for nitrate and\nsulfate ions in the water as it passes through the resin. Since most anion\nexchange resins have a higher selectivity for sulfate than nitrate, the level\nof sulfate in the water is an important factor in the efficiency of an ion\nexchange system for removing nitrates.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In cities with poor\nquality ground water\u2014people must collect rainwater ( RAINWATER HARVESTING ) after\nfour good rains have flushed out all dirt ad vermin. After the first rain hard\nscrub areas with has fungus and dirt<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Anion-exchange units\nare relatively inexpensive, but have the serious drawback of being effective\nfor only a short period of time (a matter of months, depending on the contents\nof the water) before the unit becomes saturated and needs to be recharged. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Methemoglobinemia is\nthe most significant health problem associated with nitrate in drinking water.\nBlood contains an iron-based compound called hemoglobin, which carries oxygen.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">When nitrite is present, hemoglobin can be converted to methemoglobin, which\ncannot carry oxygen. In the blood of adults, enzymes continually convert\nmethemoglobin back to hemoglobin, and methemoglobin levels normally do not\nexceed 1 percent.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Newborn infants have lower levels of these enzymes, and their\nmethemoglobin level is usually 1 to 2 percent. Anything above that level is\nconsidered methemoglobinemia.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The govt must made it\nmandatory for bottled water companies to have their water tested for nitrate\nannually. They should be required to give exact test results to consumers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Few clearcut symptoms\nare associated with methemoglobin levels between 1 and 10 percent. At higher\nlevels, symptoms of cyanosis usually appear. Babies with this condition have\nbluish mucous membranes and may also have digestive and respiratory problems.</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;At\nmethemoglobin levels above 20 to 30 percent, the primary effects result from\nthe blood's severely reduced oxygen-carrying capacity and are referred to as\nanoxia. At methemoglobin levels around 50 to 70 percent, brain damage or death\ncan occur.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Once diagnosed,\nmethemoglobinemia can be readily reversed, although with anoxia permanent\ndamage may have occurred. Methemoglobinemia can be prevented by restricting\nconsumption of nitrite and nitrate and by limiting the opportunities bacteria\nhave to reduce nitrate in food to nitrite before consumption.</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">SUGAR BARONS,&nbsp; SELLING ETHANOL TO FOREIGN FUEL\nCOMPANIES&nbsp; INSTALLED VERY DEEP BOREWELLS\nDEPRIVING POOR FARMERS OF THEIR SHARE OF WATER<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">IN BANGALORE THE WATER\nMAFIA RULES.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; EVEN POLICE DARE NOT\nENTANGLE WITH THEM AS THEY HAVE THE BLESSINGS OF MAFIA AS WELL AS POLICE\nCONTROLLED BY POLITICIANS<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Bore water should never\nbe used for drinking, bathing, watering edible plants, filling swimming&nbsp; pools, food preparation or cooking unless it\nhas been tested and treated to the extent necessary for the intended use.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If bore water is your\nonly water supply, or you rely on it to drink when your rainwater supply runs\nout, you should test the water at least once a year for chemical and\nmicrobiological contamination by a approved Govt laboratory with a signed and\ndated certificate&nbsp; . If false certificate\nis issued there must be a jail term<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ozonation&nbsp; is the most reliable way to ensure drinking\nwater is free from microbiological contamination.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/unsung-ozone-for-instant-prevention-and.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2013/06/unsung-ozone-for-instant-prevention-and.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n</span>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14.0pt; line-height: 200%;\"><br /></span>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\nChemical impurities and water hardness can be removed by\nfiltration. We chemical tankermen are experts in this field.<o:p></o:p></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/ph-for-chemical-tankerman-capt-ajit.html\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/ph-for-chemical-tankerman-capt-ajit.html</a><o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<span style=\"background-color: lime;\"><br /></span></div>\n<span style=\"background-color: lime; font-family: &quot;cambria&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 14pt; line-height: 200%;\">\n\n\n\n</span><br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/deionised-or-demineralised-water.html\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/deionised-or-demineralised-water.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n</div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A positive ion is\ncalled a cation and negative ion is called anion. No lather can be produced\nunless all Calcium and Magnesium ions ( cations ) have been precipitated.\nTemporary hardness is removed by boiling for 15 min.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The bicarbonates of\nCalcium and Magnesium will decompose to insoluble carbonates which settle as\nprecipitate. Permanent hardness is removed by adding washing soda. Na2Co3 10\nH2O. So hardness is defined as concentration of Cal/ Mag cations in terms of\nCalcium Carbonate.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Concentration is measured\nin degrees hardness. There are many units like American/ English/ French/\nGerman hardness etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hardness units: 1 ppm =\n1 mg/l = 0.1 Fr = 0.07 Cl = 0.02 Meq/l<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fr = French&nbsp;&nbsp; Cl = Clarke&nbsp;&nbsp;\nMeq = milli equivalent<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Good fresh water has a\nhardness of 2&nbsp; while seawater has a\nhardness of 6800 mg/l<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Seawater contains a lot\nof calcium/ magnesium and therefore has high water hardness. Some products like\nfatty acids and vegetable oils with a high free fatty acid content will formate\nwhite sticky residues ( calcium and magnesium soaps ) if they were cleaned with\na water of a high water hardness ( eg. Sea water)<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Soap is dispersed in\nspherical clusters called miscelles each of which may contain hundreds of soap\nmolecules. A soap molecule has a polar end which is water soluble (hydrophilic)\nand a and a non polar end which is not water soluble (hydrophobic ). <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The non polar HC chains\ndissolve in each other. The polar groups dissolve in water.&nbsp; Similarly charged miscelles repel each other\nand prevent oil droplets from coalescing. A stable emulsion of oil and water\nforms and can be removed easily from the surface being cleaned.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hardwater\ncontains Cal/ Mag salts which react with soap to form insoluble Cal/ Mag\nCarboxylates ( ring in the bath tub which always got your non-chemical\nchambermaid&nbsp; disgusted with your personal\nhygiene ). C12 \u2013C18 alcohols are used in enormous quantities to make\ndetergents.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Tenside in a detergent wraps\nup a particle and prevents it from redepositing.&nbsp; One end of the tenside molecule has affinity\nto water and the other is repellent to water.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Emulsifier has a water seeking end and a oil seeking end. Emulsification\ndoes not involve chemical change. It just suspends particles of one product\nwith another which gives rise to a milky appearance of solution.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Synthetic\ndetergent molecules have a non polar end which is oil soluble and a polar end\nwhich is water soluble. The most widely used detergents are sodium salts of\nAlkyl Benzene Sulphonic acids. Soft biodegradable detergents are Alkyl\nSuphates, Ethoxylates and their Sulphates and Alky Benzene Sulphonates.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Sulphates and Sulphonates retain their\nefficiency in hard water since their correpsonding Cal/ Mag salts are\nsoluble.&nbsp; Being salts of strong acids\nthey yield neutral solutions in contrast with soaps which being salts of weak\nacids yield slightly alkaline solutions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">To dissolve an ionic\ncompound the solvent must be highly polar. In addition it must have a high\ndielectric constant. Ie-- it must be a good insulator to lower the attraction\nbetween oppositely charged ions once they are solvated. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are other liquids\nwhich have very large dipole moments and high dielectric constants and yet are\nvery poor solvents for ionic compounds. What is needed is solvating power---the\nability to form strong bonds to dissolved ions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Water owes a large part of its\nspecial solvating power to its OH- group. It solvates cations strongly through\nthe unshared pairs on oxygen. It solvates anions strongly through hydrogen\nbonding.&nbsp;&nbsp; Solvents such as water are\ncalled protic solvents.----solvents containing Hydrogen that is attached to\noxygen and hence is acidic enough to form Hydrogen bonds.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aprotic solvents\ndissolve ionic compounds chiefly through their solvation of cations. Water\ndissolves ionic compounds very well but is a poor solvent for most organic\ncompounds. Aprotic solvents through their lipophilic (oil loving )portions\ndissolve organic compounds.they also dissolve inorganic compounds through\nsolvation of cations.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aprotic solvents work at room temp efficiently. A change\nto an aprotic solvent can increase the cleaning reaction rate as much to a\nmillion fold.&nbsp; Aprotic solvents dissolve\nionic reagents chiefly through their bonding to the cation. This leaves the\nanion free and highly reactive.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The National Project on\nAquifer Management (NAQUIM) is an initiative of the Ministry of Water\nResources, Government of India, for mapping and managing the entire aquifer\nsystems in the country.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;  There\nhave to&nbsp; quantify the available\ngroundwater resources,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Ministry of Water\nResources is responsible for laying down policy guidelines and programs for the\ndevelopment and regulation of the country's water resources.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Central Ground\nWater Board (CGWB) is the national apex agency for groundwater, under the\nMinistry of Water Resources, Government of India.&nbsp; It also maintains the Ground Water\nInformation System, which is a web based platform for accessing ground water\nrelated data and maps.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The National\nGeophysical Research Institute (CSIR-NGRI) is a constituent Laboratory of the\nCouncil of Scientific and Industrial Research.&nbsp;\nThe Institute plays a pivotal role in the exploration of Hydrocarbons,\nMineral and Groundwater resources in addition to studies in Engineering\nGeophysics, Seismology, Geo dynamics and Geo environment.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Most States in India have Ground Water\nDepartments, either as self-standing Departments, or embedded within other\nDepartments.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In terms of regular\naquifer mapping activities, CGWB carries out exploratory drilling for\nestablishing subsurface aquifer geometry, evaluating aquifer parameters and\ncollecting water samples. About 800 bore holes are drilled every year and so\nfar more than 30,000 boreholes have been drilled by CGWB.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Exploratory drilling\nis preceded by remote sensing studies and surface geophysical studies in hard\nrock areas. In sedimentary areas, boreholes are geophysically logged to\nprecisely delineate the aquifers dispositions and to record variation in the\nquality of ground water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An aquifer is an\nunderground layer of water-bearing rock, from which groundwater can be\nextracted. The mapping would assist in estimating the quantity and quality of\nground water in an aquifer and would help in assessment of sustainable level of\nground water extraction.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater is a\ncomponent of the water cycle; it comes from the infiltration of precipitation\nthrough voids in soil and rocks. Once all the available space is filled with\nwater, it is said to be saturated.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater flows through aquifers, which\nare geological formations made up of granular or fractured material from which\na sufficient quantity of water can be extracted to serve as a water supply.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The recharge rate of an\naquifer provides some indication of the quantity of water that can be pumped in\na sustainable manner. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">An aquifer is a\ngeological formation, composed of granular sediments or fractured rock, which\ncontains sufficient saturated permeable material to yield significant\nquantities of water to wells and springs.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Examples of potential\nsources of contamination include: spreading excessive amounts of manure and\noveruse of chemical fertilizers and pesticides, poorly designed leaky septic\ntanks, poorly controlled or managed landfill sites, hydrocarbon reservoir or\npipeline leaks, accidental spills, excessive use of road salt, livestock\nproduction waste, sewage system leaks, mining residue, liquid waste disposal\nwells, etc.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">US space agency NASA\nraised an alarm over the sharp decline in groundwater table across north India\u2014but\nwe like to satisfy ourselves . India no longer depends on the white man\u2019s\nlargesse<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">They cry \u201c The decline\nin groundwater is due to climate change caused by man made CO2 \u201c<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">FUCK OFF !.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">These are the same\npeople who did NOT warn India when the tsunami was racing towards India .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquifer mapping is a scientific\nprocess, wherein a combination of geologic, geophysical, hydrologic and\nchemical field and laboratory analyses are applied to characterize the\nquantity, quality and sustainability of ground water in aquifers.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While you know the\nwater comes from an aquifer somewhere beneath your feet, it's invisible,\ndiffused throughout layers of soil and rock. Draining an aquifer is therefore\nvery different from draining a reservoir, where you can see the water level\ndrop.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">People have an\nincentive \u2013 and no disincentive \u2013 to tap as much groundwater as they can. The\nresult is a race to the bottom of the aquifer. The govt must control the dept\nto which a bore well can be sunk. People who break this law must go to jail. In\nMahashtra most sugar barons have deprived the poor farmer of his share of water\n, causing him to commit suicide<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Without knowing when\nthe aquifers will go dry, or when water tables will sink so low that they are\neffectively inaccessible, users and water managers are blind to the scope and\nseverity of their problems.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ground water is a\nrenewable but limited resource. The water in the underground aquifer gets\nrecharged by rain water, canal seepage, irrigation water infiltrating through\ndifferent layers of soils.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">If the rate pf abstraction of ground water is higher\nthan the recharge rate, the water level of the aquifer recedes.&nbsp; This emphasizes the need for planned\ndevelopment and scientific management of this resource.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first activity for\nground water development is to locate potential aquifer. Since the water is\nbeneath the surface, task of locating it successfully is complicated.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Consequent to a\nsuccessful test bore hole development, the quantitative assessment of its\nyield, storativity, recharge and other parameters is necessary to evolve a\npragmatic water abstraction strategy.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Norms fixed by Ground Water Estimation\nCommittee (GEC) are presently used to estimate ground water potential. Ground\nwater level fluctuation method and pumping test are the most commonly used\nmethod to determine the yield of the well and aquifer parameters.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Ground water\nlevel fluctuation method is quite simple and fastest, but in case of non\nuniform aquifers it can lead to erroneous results. It is not applicable for\nconfined aquifers.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pumping test is the practical method for determining yield\nthough time consuming. The yield of aquifer may be difficult to determine if it\nis too large with respect to well undergoing the pumping test.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The ground water is\nrecharged naturally by monsoon water percolating down through soil. However,\nheavy abstraction rates exceeding the recharge rate would deplete the resource\nin the long run. Strategy options for ground water management are either to\nstop over exploitation or augment the resource.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Present administrative measures\nfor controlling over exploitation are selective and suitable legislative\nsupport is required combined with implementation. No local sugar baron politician\nmust be able to rule over smaller farmer when it comes to using water in a fair\nmanner<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Presently, the ground\nwater related issues fall under the purview of various agencies. Proper\norganizational set up for ground water management is required<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The amount of water in\na groundwater system typically grows and shrinks seasonally. Rainfall seeps\ndown into the system in the wetter months, and farmers pull water out to\nirrigate their crops in the warmer, drier months.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A part of the rain\nwater percolates in the rocks and soils and is available to us as ground water.\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The demand for ground\nwater for irrigation started increasing in Punjab and Haryana with the advent\nof Green Revolution in 1960s.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The region is\nclimatically more suited to wheat but farmers\u2019 preference to rice crop has\nchanged the entire scenario. This has led to over exploitation of ground water\nresources and ground water level is falling rather alarmingly. Rice consumes 6\ntimes more water than wheat.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In some districts of\nPunjab and Haryana, the ground water level is falling at an alarming rate\u2014power\nis free, why not ?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There was a time when\nthe world\u2019s greatest cities were located on the banks of rivers.&nbsp; Now, in many dry places across the planet,\nwater stored beneath the earth\u2019s surface is a critical resource for human\nsociety.&nbsp; Groundwater consumption has\nbecome a critical element of urban development and the expansion of human\npopulations into regions that would be otherwise uninhabitable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The state can monitor\ngroundwater directly by measuring water levels within wells---but digging new\nwells is expensive, and existing wells may be on private land.&nbsp; You're not sure what kind of aquifer they're\ndrilled into.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquifers can be confined, separated from the surface by an\nimpermeable layer of dirt or rock, or unconfined, with water entering from the\nground directly above. Well data can be hard to interpret as most wells\npenetrate more than one level in the aquifer system.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">So, not only is the\nwater-level in the well hard to interpret in terms of groundwater volume, but\nthey provide portals for water to move between different parts of the aquifer\nsystem---altering the very thing geologists seek to measure.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater is&nbsp; crucial for supporting natural ecosystems,\nsuch as rivers, wetlands and lakes. Groundwater is simply the subsurface water\nthat fully saturates pores or cracks in soils and rocks.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Aquifers are\nreplenished by the seepage of precipitation that falls on the land, although\nthey can be artificially replenished by people, also.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There are many geologic,\nmeteorologic, topographic, and human factors that determine the extent and rate\nto which aquifers are refilled with water.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Existing wells provide\nclues&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Next, a hydrologist obtains\ninformation on the wells in the target area. The locations, depth to water,\namount of water pumped, and types of rocks penetrated by wells also provide\ninformation on groundwater.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Wells are tested to determine the amount of water\nmoving through the aquifer, the volume of water that can enter a well, and the\neffects of pumping on water levels in the area. Chemical analysis of water from\nwells provides information on quality of water in the aquifer.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater comes from\nthe natural percolation of precipitation and other surface waters down through\nEarth\u2019s soil and rock, accumulating in aquifers -- cavities and layers of\nporous rock, gravel, sand, or clay. In some of these subterranean reservoirs,\nthe water may be thousands to millions of years old; in others, water levels\ndecline and rise again naturally each year.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Groundwater levels do\nnot respond to changes in weather as rapidly as lakes, streams, and rivers do.\nSo when groundwater is pumped for irrigation or other uses, recharge to the\noriginal levels can take months or years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Much of the world\u2019s\ngroundwater comes from \u201cfossil\u201d aquifers.&nbsp;\nThat means that water last replenished the aquifer a very long time ago:\non the order of 10,000-20,000 years, when our planet was in its last glacial\nperiod.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In many cases, if we use this\nwater today, it won\u2019t be recharged during our lifetimes.&nbsp; So there is a finite amount of water for use\npresently, and excessive withdrawal becomes unsustainable.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">GADDAFI WAS MURDERED\nBECAUSE THE WHITE JEW DID NOT WANT HIM TO CONSUME FROM THE NUBIAN AQUIFER<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">EVER HEARD OF THE 8TH\nWONDER OF THE WORLD?<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This was the brain\nchild of Gaddafi\u2014a great hero of the Libyan people.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">He made the the Great\nMan-Made River is a network of pipes that supplies water to the Sahara Desert\nin Libya, from the Nubian Sandstone Aquifer System fossil aquifer. It is the\nworld\u2019s largest irrigation project and the largest underground network of pipes\nand aqueducts in the world.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;It consists of more than 1,300 wells, most\nmore than 500 m deep, and supplies 6,500,000 m\u00b3 of PRISTINE fresh water per day\nto the cities of Tripoli, Benghazi, Sirt and elsewhere.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nubian Sandstone\nAquifer System fossil aquifer contains pristine fresh water ,the best on the\nplanet, fossil water or paleowater is groundwater that has remained sealed in\nan aquifer since the last ice age .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Fossil water is, by\ndefinition, a non-renewable resource.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Whereas most aquifers\nare naturally replenished by infiltration of water from precipitation, fossil\naquifers are those that get little or no recharge. The Zionist Jew want this\nwater. The same way the Zionist want all the gas under the Sahara Desert\u2014 till\nthen there will be terrorism in Algeria.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<div class=\"separator\" style=\"clear: both; text-align: center;\">\n<a href=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-w866sJg8wuk/WRS6_YJehdI/AAAAAAABTMY/Z3e6fxNB09c24vlWKHEeU1eS59IZvjy9ACLcB/s1600/manDmade1.jpg\" imageanchor=\"1\" style=\"margin-left: 1em; margin-right: 1em;\"><img border=\"0\" height=\"408\" src=\"https://4.bp.blogspot.com/-w866sJg8wuk/WRS6_YJehdI/AAAAAAABTMY/Z3e6fxNB09c24vlWKHEeU1eS59IZvjy9ACLcB/s640/manDmade1.jpg\" width=\"640\" /></a></div>\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Nubian Aquifer is\nlocated underground in the Eastern end of the Sahara Desert and spans the\npolitical boundaries of four countries in north-eastern Africa.&nbsp;&nbsp; NSAS covers a land area spanning just over\ntwo million km2, including north-western Sudan, north-eastern Chad,\nsouth-eastern Libya, and most of Egypt.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A month after the\nDELIBERATE destruction of the Great Man-Made River, more than 60% of Libya was\nwithout running water.<o:p></o:p></span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; One of the most important aspects of cotton fiber quality is fiber or staple length. . .<br />\n<br />\nFiber length is the normal length of a typical portion of the fibers of a cotton sample. Longer fibers can be processed at greater efficiencies and produce finer and stronger yarns by allowing fibers to twist around each other more times, while shorter fiber require increased twisting during spinning, causing low-strength and poor-quality yarns. . .<br />\n<br />\nFiber fineness is another important component of fiber quality because of its direct impact on processing performance and the quality of end product. . .<br />\n<br />\nFiber strength is important because the inherent breaking strength of individual cotton fiber is considered to be the most important factor in determining the strength of the yarn spun from those fibers. . .<br />\n<br />\nJEW DARLING APCO MODI AND HIS PMO WILL SAY ALL ABOVE IS FICTION. . .<br />\n<br />\nThey have just focused on a single single trait \u2013 pest resistance ( SIC )\u2013 compromising on cotton quality. ..<br />\n<br />\nMy hometown Calicut produced the best cotton fabric ( CALICO ) on this planet\u2014today with BT Cotton all this is history. ..<br />\n<br />\nFiber strength is an important parameter in determining yarn spinning value. . .<br />\n<br />\nJEW DARLING MODI will never have the commonsense to understand this \u2013 WHEN YOU RAISE QUANTTY , QUALITY REDUCES ---<br />\n<br />\nHigh fiber strength is impossible to obtain without sacrificing yield. . .<br />\n<br />\nPATHETIC !<br />\nPunch into Google search - -<br />\n. . . . . \u2026 .. .. . .. lime;\">http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.in/2010/04/deionised-or-demineralised-water.html</a><o:p></o:p></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px
