float: left; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c6985658708115781665\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_39M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"font-size: 16px; margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/08/chikungunya-disease-created-in-lab-capt.html?showComment=1474944975678#c6985658708115781665\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">September 27, 2016 at 8:26 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_39MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nhttp://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Paracetamol-injections-too-to-cost-as-much-as-35-less/articleshow/54533976.cms<br />\n<br />\nParacetamol, also known as acetaminophen or APAP, is a medication used to treat pain and fever.<br />\n<br />\nParacetamol does not help reduce inflammation, while aspirin and Ibuprofen does.<br />\n<br />\nParacetamol is classified as a mild analgesic.<br />\n<br />\nThe efficacy of paracetamol by itself in children with fevers has been questioned and a meta-analysis showed that it is less effective than ibuprofen.<br />\n<span style=\"color: blue; font-size: large;\"><b><br />Paracetamol consists of a benzene ring core. Paracetamol is derived from coal tar.&nbsp;</b></span><br />\n<br />\nIt belongs to the class of drugs known as \"aniline analgesics.\" The gravity of the side effects can be understood by the fact that it is the only such drug still in use today.<br />\n<br />\nIn India Paracetamol is the most common cause of acute liver failure. Paracetamol toxicity is one of the most common causes of poisoning worldwide. Damage to the liver, or hepatotoxicity, results not from paracetamol itself, but from one of its metabolites, N-acetyl-p-benzoquinoneimine (NAPQI).<br />\n<br />\nNAPQI decreases the liver's natural antioxidant glutathione and directly damages cells in the liver, leading to liver failure.<br />\n<br />\nMost people with paracetamol toxicity have no symptoms in the first 24 hours following overdose. Others may initially have nonspecific complaints such as vague abdominal pain and nausea. With time, signs of liver injury may develop; these include low blood sugar, low blood pH, easy bleeding, and hepatic encephalopathy.<br />\n<br />\nParacetamol has relatively little anti-inflammatory activity, unlike other common analgesics such as the NSAIDs aspirin and ibuprofen, but ibuprofen and paracetamol have similar effects in the treatment of headache. Paracetamol can relieve pain in mild arthritis, but has no effect on the underlying inflammation, redness, and swelling of the joint. It has analgesic properties comparable to those of aspirin, while its anti-inflammatory effects are weaker.<br />\n<br />\nThe US Food and Drug Administration launched a public education program to help consumers avoid overdose, warning: \"Acetaminophen can cause serious liver damage if more than directed is used.<br />\n<br />\nHabitual use of paracetamol leads to decrease in threshold for pain in a person.<br />\n<br />\nThis means that the endurance level for pain reduces in that person.<br />\n<br />\nPeople who already face liver problems, kidney problems should not take Paracetamol tablets. Paracetamol should not be taken when alcohol is consumed as this increases the risk of liver toxicity.<br />\n<br />\nIbuprofen can be used to relieve pain and inflammation caused by rheumatic and muscular pain, headaches, backache, and period pain. It can also be used to relieve cold and 'flu-like' symptoms<br />\n<br />\nAspirin is a blood thinner and NOT suitable when you have a low blood platelet count .<br />\n<br />\nThe myth that Paracetamol (acetaminophen) is a good cure for hangover is not only false, but also very dangerous.<br />\n<br />\nIf you have conditions where loss of platelets would be a concern, ibuprofen is a better choice than Aspirin. . Like all non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs, ibuprofen has very mild blood thinning properties but FAR FAR less than aspirin.<br />\n<br />\nCONTINUED TO 2-</div>\n</div>\n<div class=\"comment-replies\" id=\"bc_0_39BR\" style=\"background-color: #cccccc; font-family: &quot;Times New Roman&quot;, Times, FreeSerif, serif; font-size: 16px; margin-left: 36px; margin-top: 1em;\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_39b+seedC9QuD\" kind=\"d\"></span><br />\n<div class=\"comment-thread inline-thread\" id=\"bc_0_38T\" kind=\"t\" style=\"background-color: #eeeeee; margin: 8px 0px; padding: 0.5em 1em;\" t=\"0\" u=\"0\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_39b+seedC9QuD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_38TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_38TN\"></span></span></span><br />\n<div class=\"thread-dropContainer thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_38TD\">\n<span id=\"bc_0_39b+seedC9QuD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_38TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_38TN\"><span class=\"thread-drop\"></span></span></span></span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_39b+seedC9QuD\" kind=\"d\"><span class=\"thread-toggle thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_38TT\" kind=\"g\" style=\"cursor: pointer; display: inline-block;\"><span class=\"thread-count\" id=\"bc_0_38TN\">\n</span></span><br />\n</span><br />\n<ol class=\"thread-chrome thread-expanded\" id=\"bc_0_38TC\" style=\"list-style-type: none; padding: 0px;\"><span id=\"bc_0_39b+seedC9QuD\" kind=\"d\">\n<li class=\"comment\" id=\"bc_0_38B\" kind=\"b\" style=\"border-bottom: 0px; margin: 0px 0px 16px; padding: 16px 0px 0px;\"><div class=\"avatar-image-container\" style=\"float: left; margin: 0.2em 0px 0px; max-height: 36px; overflow: hidden; width: 36px;\">\n<img kasperskylab_antibanner=\"on\" src=\"https://1.bp.blogspot.com/-1TmA2Q8dmoI/UwiDv2Fb3eI/AAAAAAAApp4/Gfi3eJL51UI/s35/*\" style=\"border: 1px solid rgb(238, 238, 238); max-width: 36px;\" /></div>\n<div class=\"comment-block\" id=\"c3558874415253827339\" style=\"margin-left: 48px; position: relative;\">\n<div class=\"comment-header\" id=\"bc_0_38M\" kind=\"m\" style=\"margin: 0px 0px 8px;\">\n<cite class=\"user blog-author\" style=\"font-style: normal; font-weight: bold;\"><a href=\"https://www.blogger.com/profile/14410812789424637654\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">Capt. Ajit Vadakayil</a></cite><span class=\"icon user blog-author\" style=\"background-image: url(&quot;data:image/png; background-repeat: no-repeat; display: inline-block; font-weight: bold; height: 18px; margin: 0px 0px -4px 6px; width: 18px;\"></span><span class=\"datetime secondary-text\" style=\"margin-left: 6px;\"><a href=\"http://ajitvadakayil.blogspot.com/2012/08/chikungunya-disease-created-in-lab-capt.html?showComment=1474944994041#c3558874415253827339\" rel=\"nofollow\" style=\"color: #888888; text-decoration-line: none;\">September 27, 2016 at 8:26 AM</a></span></div>\n<div class=\"comment-content\" id=\"bc_0_38MC\" style=\"margin-bottom: 8px; text-align: justify;\">\nCONTINUED FROM 1-<br />\n<br />\nLiver disease can interfere with blood clotting and result in frequent and/or severe nosebleeds.<br />\n<br />\nBlood from damaged blood vessels beneath the skin collects near the surface to appear as what we recognize as a black and blue mark. This mark is from skin discoloration by red blood cells and their contents.<br />\n<br />\nThrombocytopenia that requires EMERGENCY treatment is a LOW platelet count below 50,000 per microliter. Normal platelet counts range from 150,000 to 400,000 per microliter in the blood. Platelet counts less than 150,000 are termed thrombocytopenia. A platelet count greater than 400,000 is called thrombocytosis. A platelet count below 10,000 is severe thrombocytopenia and may result in spontaneous bleeding.<br />\n<br />\nPlatelets participate in coagulation. Platelets initiate a sequence of reactions that eventually lead to the formation of a blood clot. They circulate in the blood vessels and become activated if there is any bleeding or injury in the body.<br />\n<br />\nCertain chemicals are released from the injured blood vessels or other structures that signal platelets to become activated and join the other components of the system to initiate coagulation.<br />\n<br />\nWhen activated, the platelets become sticky and adhere to one another and to the blood vessel wall at the site of the injury to slow down and stop the bleeding by plugging up the damaged blood vessel or tissue (hemostasis).<br />\n<br />\nONE TABLE SPOON OF PAPAYA LEAF JUICE INCREASES LOW BLOOD PLATELET COUNT ( CHIKUNGUNYA ) LIKE MAGIC WITHIN HOURS.THIS IS A 6200 YEAR OLD AYURVEDIC REMEDY\u2014AND THERE IS NOTHING LIKE THIS ELSEWHERE .<br />\n<br />\nThe symptoms and signs of thrombocytopenia may include:<br />\n<br />\nSuperficial bleeding into the skin resulting in small reddish spots (petechiae)<br />\nFatigue<br />\nEasy or excessive bruising (purpura)<br />\nProlonged bleeding cuts<br />\nSpontaneous bleeding from the gums or nose<br />\nJaundice<br />\nHeavy menstrual bleeding that's unusual for the individual<br />\nBlood in the urine or stools<br />\nEnlarged spleen<br />\nBleeding that will not stop<br />\nDVT (deep vein thrombosis)<br />\n<br />\nCapt Ajit Vadakayil<br />\n..</div>\n</div>\n</li>\n</span></ol>\n<span id=\"bc_0_39b+seedC9QuD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<span id=\"bc_0_39b+seedC9QuD\" kind=\"d\">\n</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">A little sneezing isn\u2019t\nuncommon. Unfortunately, viruses and bacteria aren\u2019t the only things that can\nmake us sneeze. Another culprit is allergies. In most cases, the only way to\nget rid of a cold or the flu is to ride it out and wait for our immune system\nto do its job.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">However, the same can\u2019t be said for allergies. When it comes to\nallergies, the best approach is to avoid the source of the problem. As a\nresult, it\u2019s important to know if you\u2019re dealing with an allergy, bacteria or\nvirus, which may not be an easy call.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The first step, of\ncourse, is to understand what an allergy is. In practice, it\u2019s an abnormal\nreaction of the body, or more specifically, a misguided and excessive reaction\nthat occurs when the body encounters a foreign substance. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The allergic mechanism\nhas two stages. During the first stage\u2014 sensitization\u2014the body simply recognizes\nthe allergen. Then, in the second stage, the body reacts to it. This is the\nallergic reaction, which manifests itself through various symptoms that may\noccur in isolation, in succession or even simultaneously (asthma, rhinitis,\neczema, hives, food sensitivity, conjunctivitis, etc).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The symptoms of\nallergic rhinitis include sneezing, runny nose and conjunctivitis. This is why\npeople who experience these symptoms may think they have a cold or the flu.\nRegardless of the season when the problem occurs or whether it persists all\nyear long, allergic rhinitis has some very specific symptoms that can be used\nto identify it. The trick is knowing how to recognize them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">While grass and pollen\ncan certainly be the cause of allergic rhinitis, so can a number of other\nsubstances (mold, perfume, dust mites, insects, animals, etc.).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Allergic rhinitis\nalmost always manifests itself through three symptoms: stuffy nose, runny nose\nand sneezing. There can be other uncomfortable symptoms as well like itchy\neyes, nose and throat, the feeling of sand in your eyes, watery eyes, reduced\nsense of smell and a dry cough.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike a cold or the flu, there are no muscles\naches, and headaches are fairly rare. But most importantly, the symptoms\ndisappear once you\u2019re no longer in contact with the allergen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;If you\u2019re allergic to mold, note that its\ngrowth can be minimized by good room ventilation and allowing sunlight into the\nroom.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Certain medication can\nbe used to treat allergic rhinitis.. The most commonly used drugs are\nantihistamines, which act quickly on symptoms of itchy and runny nose. Local\nsteroids have an anti-inflammatory effect and are often prescribed for more\nserious cases of allergic rhinitis.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Certain allergies, such as allergies to\npollen, can also be treated with immunotherapy. This involves injecting the\nallergy sufferer with small doses of the allergen in order to desensitize them\nto it. It\u2019s important to note that once you\u2019ve identified the symptoms of\nallergic rhinitis, it\u2019s crucial that you don\u2019t ignore them because a mild case\nof rhinitis can quickly become more severe. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Allergic reactions are\ncaused by an over-reactive immune system. Sometimes the body mistakes a\nharmless substance (like pollen or dust) for a dangerous invader. This results\nin a release of chemicals from immune cells, which can cause sneezing, itchy,\nrunny nose or eyes, rashes or hives, inflamed eyes, skin, or lungs. In severe\nallergic reactions, whole body reactions may require immediate medical\nattention.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The common cold is\ncaused by viruses (mainly rhinoviruses) that get into the cells lining the\nnose, pharynx, and bronchi. The body\u2019s immune system reacts to these viruses in\nthat it opens up blood vessels and increases mucus secretion. This leads to the\ncommon cold symptoms including stuffy nose, sore throat, and cough.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The majority of food allergies are caused by\neight types of foods: milk, soy, eggs, wheat, peanuts, tree nuts, fish, and\nshellfish. Penicillin is the most common drug allergy, though there are many\nother drugs that may cause allergic reactions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Many of my patients are\nnot sure how to tell the difference between a common cold and allergies. It\u2019s\neasy to get confused, since colds and allergies share some (but not all) of the\nsame symptoms.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><o:p></o:p></span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">watery\neyes, etc., from an allergy can happen as soon as you are in contact with the\nallergen.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Allergies never cause a\nfever or body aches. The following symptoms are more common in allergy sufferers\n(though can sometimes be associated with colds, too): itchy, watery eyes; clear\nmucus that doesn\u2019t turn yellow; and symptoms that are triggered when seasons\nchange.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unlike allergies, the\ncommon cold is often accompanied by fever and body aches.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Antihistamines: During\nan allergic reaction, the body releases a substance known as histamine.\nHistamine causes tiny blood vessels in the nose and throat to become leaky,\nresulting in tissue swelling and increased mucus production.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Histamine may also\ncause constriction of the smooth muscle in the airways, and can produce asthma\nsymptoms. Antihistamines work by preventing this histamine release. This\nrelieves itching, sneezing, and runny nose. OTC antihistamine tablets for\nadults and syrups for children are available.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Nasal Decongestants:\nNasal decongestants reduce swelling in your nasal passages and make it easier\nto breathe. Some OTC allergy tablets combine an antihistamine with a nasal\ndecongestant. Topical nasal decongestants are applied directly inside of the\nnose in the form of drops or sprays. Topical nasal decongestants should not be\nused for more than three days in a row<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Like antihistamines,\nnasal allergy symptom controllers (also known as mast cell stabilizers) also\nreduce the effects of histamine, but in a different way. Nasal allergy symptom\ncontrollers reduce how much histamine is released into the body when a person\nhas an allergic reaction. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Unfortunately, there is\nno cure for a cold virus once you\u2019ve been infected. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Usually, doctors\ndiagnose flu on the basis of whether flu is epidemic in the community and\nwhether the patient's complaints fit the current pattern of symptoms. Doctors\nrarely use laboratory testing to identify the virus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The classic symptoms of\nacute sinusitis are nasal congestion, greenish nasal discharge, facial or\ndental pain, eye pain, headache, and a nighttime cough. Some patients also\ncomplain of fever, malaise (feeling ill), bad breath, and a sore throat. It is\nusually preceded by a cold, which does not improve or worsens after 5 - 7 days\nof symptoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Chronic sinusitis is\nsubtler, and can be difficult to diagnose. It manifests the symptoms listed\nabove in a milder form, but usually persists for longer than 8 weeks. It is\nmost common in patients with allergies<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Seventeen years ago, my\nChemical tanker was at anchor off a port in Venezuela.&nbsp;&nbsp; We were to berth a 3 AM.&nbsp;&nbsp; It was nearing midnight and I went to sleep\nwith my wife and two sons, light out in my cabin.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Suddenly the phone\nrang.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">On saying HULLO all I\ncould hear was some funny croaking sound.&nbsp;\n<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Nobody would dare to\ngive a crank call to I, the Captain.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">On a hunch I jumped out\nof bed , wore my robe and doubled up&nbsp; to\nthe Chief Officers cabin with the Master key.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">What I saw there\nstunned me.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">He was lying on the\nfloor, with his face swollen, body full of rashes and hives.&nbsp;&nbsp; His heart was still beating very feebly ,\nbut he had no breath.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">His epiglottis had\nslammed shut.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">The epiglottis is a\nflap of tissue that sits at the base of the tongue that keeps food from going\ninto the trachea (windpipe) during swallowing.&nbsp;\nWhen it becomes&nbsp; inflamed, it can\nswell and obstruct or close off the windpipe, which will be fatal unless\npromptly treated.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">He has used the hard\nsplit skin of his heel to scratch his legs and there was blood everywhere.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Immediately I called up\nthe bridge and called the Third Mate down.&nbsp;\nHe came in 10 seconds.&nbsp; I told him\nto administer single man CPR .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Then I went racing down\nto the hospital and opened out the hospital with the Master key .&nbsp; The medicine locker was in a mess and I had\ntold the Second Mate to take a fresh inventory with locations and expiry dates\n, just the previous day.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Using my gut\nfeeling,&nbsp; I opened out a drawer and there\nlay Chlorpheneramine Maleate injection.&nbsp;\nI opened the next drawer and there lay disposable injection tubes.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">There would have been Epinephrine injection\nin some other drawer, but I had zilch time at my disposal --&nbsp; brain damage to Chief Officer was just around\nthe corner.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Grabbing both I raced\nback to Chief Officers cabin.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">I told Third Mate to\npull his shorts down and plunged the needle with the drug into his right\nbuttock.&nbsp; Pretty soon Chief Officer\nstarted breathing again and opened his red eyes.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">I then told the\nFilipino Third mate ( Bong ) to keep a watch , and inform me as soon as he\nstarts talking.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><br /></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\"><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Pretty soon I got a\ncall and I went back to the cabin.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">I told him \u201c You were\nhaving severe Anaphylaxis , considering the lack of blood clotting , probably\ndue to a Venezuelan moth of the family of Hylesia Metabus\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">He agreed. He said that\nhe had gone to the forecastle to check the anchor before going to sleep,and he\nfound lot of Moths flying around the forward mast floodlights . The wind was\nfresh and there were some dead moths on the forecastle decks too.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Seeing him look\nsheepishly at the Third Mate who was finding it difficult to control his\nlaughter, I send him away back to the bridge.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">So I asked him \u201c Do you\nknow why he cannot stop laughing\u201d<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Bihari Bhaiyya Chief\nOfficer ( MUSLIM ) &nbsp;replied&nbsp; \u201c&nbsp; When you pulled down my shorts you exclaimed\n\u2013&nbsp; WHAT A BIG BLACK FAT ASS. &nbsp; &nbsp; Kya kareega saab, I am fond of eating lot of\nbeef and mutton \u201d .<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">To be frank I did NOT\nrealize that I had indeed said that , and then we both had a good laugh.</span></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"background-color: #f3f3f3; font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt; line-height: 150%;\"><span style=\"color: purple;\">Surprise-- he was on\nthe forecastle to pick up the anchor at 4 AM,&nbsp;\nto berth , though I had told the Second Mate NOT to wake him up.<o:p></o:p></span></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">AGAIN---<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The viruses that cause\ncolds are contagious. You can pick them up when someone who's infected sneezes,\ncoughs, or shakes hands with you. After a couple of weeks, at the most, your\nimmune system fights off the illness and you should stop having symptoms.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">It's a different story\nwith allergies. They're caused by an overactive immune system. For some reason,\nyour body mistakes harmless things, such as dust or pollen, for germs and\nattacks them.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The most important\ndifference is that colds usually don't last longer than 14 days. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The flu is caused by a\nvirus that is mainly spread by droplets created when people cough, sneeze or\ntalk. The flu usually comes on suddenly. It can be mild or very serious .\nPeople with the flu may have fever, cough, sore throat, body aches, runny or\nstuffed-up nose, headaches and extreme tiredness.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Complications include\near and sinus infections, bronchitis and pneumonia. If it does not lead to\ncomplications, the flu typically lasts between a few days and two weeks.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flu is a complicated\nvirus. There are three basic types of flu: A, B and C.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type A is the most\ndangerous; it is the one that can cause serious disease and also triggers\nworldwide pandemics. Type C causes mild disease. Type B can make you feel very\nill, but it has never led to a worldwide pandemic.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Type A is also much\nmore complex than the other types of flu virus. On the surface of each\nInfluenza A virus there are proteins that help the virus to invade cells.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">There\nare two kinds of protein: haemagglutinin and neuraminidase (referred to as H\nand N). There are 16 different types of the H protein, and 9 different types of\nthe N protein. This means there are 144 different possibly varieties of\nInfluenza A \u2013 from H1N1 (the Swine Flu virus) to H16N9. There are still a lot\nof possible options when it comes to designing the annual flu vaccine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Each year\u2019s flu vaccine\nis made to give the best protection against the strains of flu that are\nexpected to circulate in the coming season. However, decisions about what to\nput in the flu vaccine have to be made six months before the flu season starts.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Every February in the Northern Hemisphere, the\nWorld Health Organization (WHO) reviews the types of flu that have been\ncirculating in all parts of the world and chooses the ones which will go in the\nvaccine for the following autumn.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This allows time for the vaccine to be made \u2013\nbut it also gives the flu virus time to change before vaccination starts in the\nautumn.&nbsp;&nbsp; The flu virus changes in ways\nthat are not expected.&nbsp;&nbsp; The flu vaccine\nmay not be a good match for all the strains of flu that are circulating.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The adjuvant is\nbasically used to invoke the desired immune response.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaccines are by far the\nbest way to cull the human population because most people can be tricked into\nlining up and asking for them.&nbsp;&nbsp; In\nschools vaccinations are given without taking conscurrence from the parents.&nbsp; Thus, there\u2019s no need to resort to all the\ndifficulties used by to commit genocide by hot wars .<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Researchers are\ninvestigating ways to create a flu vaccine that protects against all the many\ndifferent varieties of flu. If they are successful, it will mean that people\nwill only need a single flu vaccine to give them lifelong protection, instead\nof getting a yearly vaccine</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;BULLSHIT \u2013SUCH BROAD SPECTRUM VACCINE CAN NEVER BE\nMADE . <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">\\</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CDC is now\nencouraging \"\"universal\" flu vaccination in the U.S. to expand\nprotection against the flu to more people\" -- a move that is highly\nsuspect considering the lack of evidence supporting their effectiveness and\nsafety.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 46% of the\nU.S. population were armtwisted&nbsp; to get a\nflu shot last season, a trend that has unfortunately been steadily increasing\nin the last several years.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This is a direct result\nof the massive marketing campaign ( read as bribes )&nbsp; that is ongoing in the United States,\nencouraging every person 6 months and older to get a flu shot.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Now they're available\nnot only from your physician, but also at your drugstore and supermarket.</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flu vaccines have little to no measurable benefit<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The CDC states that the\nannual flu vaccine is the \"best\" way to avoid catching the seasonal\nflu, but what many fail to realize is that there's virtually NO valid\nscientific evidence to support it, in either its effectiveness or its safety.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Blindly trust and\nfollow the CDC or AAP \"recommendations\" without really checking into\nthem.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">the flu vaccine can\nmake you a sitting duck for a heart attack by:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span><br />\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Upping your risk of a\nblood clot,<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Elevating a blood\ncomponent called \u201cC-reactive protein\u201d which is an indicator of inflammation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\">\n<a href=\"http://thesciencepost.com/over-100-seniors-die-just-years-after-getting-pneumococcal-vaccine/\" style=\"background-color: lime;\">http://thesciencepost.com/over-100-seniors-die-just-years-after-getting-pneumococcal-vaccine/</a></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The flu shot\nrecommended for seniors, called Fluzone High-Dose, has been linked to side\neffects such as low platelet counts, enlarged lymph nodes, life-threatening\nallergic reactions, extreme shoulder pain and facial paralysis, the devastating\nnerve disease Guillain-Barre syndrome and convulsions.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;Guillain-Barr\u00e9 syndrome (GBS) is a disorder in\nwhich the body's immune system attacks part of the peripheral nervous system.\nThe first symptoms of this disorder include varying degrees of weakness or\ntingling sensations in the legs <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In Guillain-Barr\u00e9\nsyndrome, however, the immune system starts to destroy the myelin sheath that\nsurrounds the axons of many peripheral nerves, or even the axons themselves\n(axons are long, thin extensions of the nerve cells; they carry nerve signals).\n<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The myelin sheath\nsurrounding the axon speeds up the transmission of nerve signals and allows the\ntransmission of signals over long distances.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In diseases in which\nthe peripheral nerves' myelin sheaths are injured or degraded, the nerves\ncannot transmit signals efficiently. That is why the muscles begin to lose\ntheir ability to respond to the brain's commands, commands that must be carried\nthrough the nerve network. The brain also receives fewer sensory signals from\nthe rest of the body, resulting in an inability to feel textures, heat, pain,\nand other sensations. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Alternately, the brain\nmay receive inappropriate signals that result in tingling,\n\"crawling-skin,\" or painful sensations. Because the signals to and\nfrom the arms and legs must travel the longest distances they are most\nvulnerable to interruption<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The liver produces a\ntype of acute phase protein known as C-reactive protein (CRP) and the level of\nC-reactive protein increases in the blood when there is inflammation in the\nbody. When there is tissue damage the concentration of CRP in the blood can\ndouble every six hours.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Researchers are now\nquestioning the assumed safety of giving flu shots to pregnant women because\nstimulating a woman's immune system during midterm and later term pregnancy may\nsignificantly increase the risk that her baby will develop autism during\nchildhood and schizophrenia sometime during the teenage years and afterward.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Avoid exposure to toxic\nsubstances and chemicals \u2013 such as cleaning solvents, lead and mercury, some\ninsecticides, and paint.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Washing your hands will\ndecrease your likelihood of spreading a virus to your nose, mouth or other\npeople. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Use Natural\nAntibiotics.&nbsp;&nbsp; Examples include colloidal\nsilver, turmeric ,virgin coconut oil&nbsp; and\ngarlic. These work like broad-spectrum antibiotics against bacteria, viruses,\nand protozoa in your body.&nbsp; And unlike\npharmaceutical antibiotics, they do not lead to resistance.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Hospitals are prime\nbreeding grounds for infections of all kinds. The best place to get plenty of\nrest and recover from illness that is not life threatening is usually in the\ncomfort of your own home.</span></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Flu viruses change\nevery year and health officials admit that each year\u2019s vaccines are designed to\ntarget the \u2018best-guess\u2019 four of the dozens of strains of flu viruses that float\nabout during every flu season which is bullshit<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;This risk of live virus transmission is why\ngovernment pamphlets warn that \u201cchildren who have been vaccinated should avoid\nclose contact with people with severely weakened immune systems for around two\nweeks after being vaccinated\u201d, while vaccine experts have warned that children\n\u201cmay have to stay away from elderly relatives for a few days after\nvaccination\u201d.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The vaccine contains\nother ingredients that powerfully boost the immune response, triggering the\nproduction of masses of antibodies that, like drones, are programmed to destroy\nflu proteins. These hang around for a long time vigilantly on the lookout for it\n(which is what\u2019s supposed to keep you flu-free all season).<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">On reaching the brain,\nthese antibodies mistakenly target the brain cells that produce orexin in a\nprocess known as \u2018immune cross-reaction\u2019. So, primed by the vaccine, the\nnarcolepsy sufferer\u2019s own immune system is assaulting the brain, making it an\nautoimmune disease.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our natural\nimmunotolerance has proved a big problem for vaccine manufacturers over the\nyears. Simply injecting a viral or bacterial particle into our bodies does not\ntrigger the immune storm they want.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Our bodies aren\u2019t designed to encounter\npathogens via intramuscular injection, after all. Our immune system refuses to\nattack the injected pathogen since that would mean also attacking the\nlook-alike human proteins. It would rather not go to war than risk the home\ncasualties.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Adjuvants expand,\npotentiate, and increase immune responses.&nbsp;&nbsp;\nSuch hyperactivation has a price: the loss of specificity. The\nhyper-stimulated immune system does not discriminate any more between foreign\nproteins and self-proteins\u2026 Adjuvants render the immune system blind. Human\nproteins that share peptide sequences will be attacked.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The type of autoimmune\nphenomenon and disease that is eventually established will depend on the\nmolecules and organs attacked.&nbsp; Attacks\nagainst myelin may evoke demyelinating diseases (such as multiple sclerosis)\nwhereas immune reactions against proteins involved in behaviour&nbsp; and /or cognition may cause autism and\nbehaviour disorders.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<br />\n<br />\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Narcolepsy is a\ncondition characterised by frequent and uncontrollable urges to sleep at\ninappropriate times and places-- the myelin oligodendrocyte gene (MOG) has a\nmutation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Oligodendrocytes, which\nprovide support to cells in the central nervous system, produce the myelin\nprotein, a key material in the myelin sheath that ensures the proper\nfunctioning of the nervous system. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Myelin forms a\nprotective sheath around nerves, allowing them to efficiently transmit\nelectrical impulses that stimulate movement. MicroRNAs, reside on the\nchromosomes of cells, act to regulate gene expression in a way that maintains\nthe body\u2019s normal functioning. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The absence of\nmiR-219&nbsp; create&nbsp; neurodegenerative disorders. MicroRNAs are\nshort segments of RNA encoded on the chromosomes of cells.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;SURYA NAMASKAR take care of this in a\npreventive manner<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">More than 100\nautoimmune diseases have so far been identified, and the field is growing at an\nalarming rate. It includes chronic conditions that mainstream medicine\nconsiders incurable, such as multiple sclerosis, juvenile diabetes (type 1),\nrheumatoid arthritis, lupus, alopecia, scleroderma, coeliac disease and\nulcerative colitis.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Vaccination can cause\nthese diseases in susceptible individuals, yet so far, no public-health\nauthorities are trying to find out who these potential victims are.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">One study in chickens\nfound that vaccination against one disease virus \u201cenhances the fitness of more\nvirulent strains\u201d, making it possible for superbug strains to develop and be\ntransmitted. <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This creates an\nenvironment in which vaccines, like antibiotics, are always chasing new strains\nto keep up, creating \u201cconditions that promote the emergence of pathogen strains\nthat cause more severe disease in unvaccinated hosts\u201d&nbsp;&nbsp; In other words, flu vaccination promotes\nsuperbugs that jeopardize the unvaccinated too.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Influenza vaccines are\nabout marketing and not science.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">We have few trials, and\nmasses of very poor-quality observational evidence.&nbsp; Scientists have presented evidence of\nconsiderable reporting bias, which lobbied up politicians continue to ignore<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ACIP recommends annual\nvaccination for all people ages 6 months and older who do not have a\ncontraindication to the vaccine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">The Advisory Committee\non Immunization Practices (ACIP), founded in 1964, provides advice and guidance\non effective control of vaccine-preventable diseases in the U.S. civilian\npopulation<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">ACIP is a panel of\nimmunization experts that advises the Centers for Disease Control and\nPrevention (CDC).&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">This ACIP vote is based on data showing poor or relatively\nlower effectiveness of LAIV from 2013 through 2016.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Live attenuated influenza\nvaccine (LAIV) is a type of influenza vaccine in the form of a nasal spray that\nused to be recommended to prevent influenza. In June 2016 the CDC stopped\nrecommending the use of LAIV as its effectiveness has appeared to have\ndecreased between 2013 and 2016.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Lately something odd\nhappened at the annual CDC\u2019s Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices\n(ACIP).&nbsp; They voted that the nasal flu\nvaccine or more precisely, that the \"live attenuated influenza vaccine\n(LAIV)\" should not be used during the 2016-2017 flu season.&nbsp; <o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Here's a brief history\nof LAIV:--</span><span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , serif; font-size: 12pt;\">&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;June 17, 2003 - FDA approves nasal spray flu\nvaccine invented at U-M<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;FluMist is a cold-adapted, live-attenuated,\ntrivalent influenza virus vaccine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;A trivalent vaccine, like the flu shot, it\nincludes three different strains of vaccine.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In 2009, H1N1 was all the rage<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<br /></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">&nbsp;The 2009 H1N1 nasal spray vaccine is being\nmade in the same way as the seasonal nasal spray vaccine, but instead of\ncontaining three weakened live flu viruses, it only contains weakened 2009 H1N1\nvirus.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Live Attenuated\nInfluenza Vaccine Enhances Colonization of Streptococcus pneumoniae and\nStaphylococcus aureus<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">In June 2016 the CDC\nstopped recommending the use of LAIV as its effectiveness has appeared to have\ndecreased between 2013 and 2016.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">New strains of virus\npop up every six months. This is one way for Jews of evil pharma to make money\nout of thin air.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">LAIV is supposed to\nbe&nbsp; an attenuated vaccine ( sic ) ,\nunlike most influenza vaccines, which are inactivated vaccines.&nbsp;&nbsp; LAIV is administered intranasally, while\ninactivated vaccines are administered by intramuscular injection.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Both live\nattenuated and inactivated vaccines are typically trivalent. That is, they\ncontain material from three different influenza virus strains recommended by\nnational and international public health agencies as most likely to be\nprotective against seasonal influenza in any given year.&nbsp;&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">Even though the virus in LAIV is attenuated\n(low in virulence), it is still a living virus, and may cause an infection with\ncomplications in people with weakened immune systems or other underlying\nmedical conditions.&nbsp;</span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">As of 2010, LAIV is recommended only for people 2\u201349 years\nof age, and is not recommended for people who have a weakened immune system,\nfor pregnant women, or for people with certain chronic diseases.<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\"><br /></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot; , &quot;serif&quot;; font-size: 12.0pt; line-height: 150%;\">BioDiem has also\nlicensed production to the Serum Institute of India, which holds exclusive\nlicenses for production in Mexico, Argentina, Peru, South Africa, Bangladesh,\nBhutan, Nepal, Pakistan and Sri Lanka, and the Government Pharmaceutical Office\nof Thailand. It was the first and (as of 2007) the only live attenuated vaccine\nfor influenza available outside of Europe<o:p></o:p></span></div>\n<div class=\"MsoNormal\" style=\"line-height: 150%;\">\n<span style=\"font-family: &quot;times new roman&quot;
